It‚Äôs unfortunate that the filmmakers felt it necessary to sink into typical slasher territory with one avoidable topless sex scene and another dream sequence that feels forced by producers to be included. These two sequences are part of the reason this sequel doesn‚Äôt measure up to the superior original when it comes to rising above average teen fare.Scream Factory includes some entertaining special features. There are interviews with Director Jeff Burr, Special Effects Artists Greg Nicotero and Gino Crognale, and Actor Mark McCracken. We also get a featurette entitled ‚ÄúRe-creating the Monster.‚Äù‚ÄúPumpkinhead II: Blood Wings‚Äô‚Äù debut on Blu-ray will please fans of the franchise and horror movie buffs. Special appearances by genre regulars like Linnea Quigley and Kane Hodder add to the fun. Although originally a straight-to-video offering when released in 1993, it still fares well in its HD format thanks to good video and audio transfers and a suitable dose of bonus material.

An eccentric young couple (Dan Aykroyd and Cathy Moriarity) move in next door to a reserved man (John Belushi) and his wife's (Kathryn Walker) residence. It's evident from the start that these two misfits are out of place in the cul-de-sacs of the suburbs. As the night progresses, things get more and more zany and out of control.Whether John G. Avildsen‚Äôs cinematic adaptation of Thomas Berger‚Äôs best-selling novel ‚ÄúNeighbors‚Äù is cinematic gold is still up for debate 33 years later. Some call it an uneven comedic misfire. Others would claim it to be a foreshadowing of the darkly and quirky genius that would become a popular and respectable sub-genre thanks to Tim Burton‚Äôs rise to fame a few years later.Although ‚ÄúNeighbors‚Äù has Belushi and Aykroyd successfully switching roles, it‚Äôs still a perfect example of the charisma the two had when they paired up together. Belushi would usually play crazy to Aykroyd‚Äôs straight man. However, the two decided to switch parts at the beginning of production for this film. It gives the movie a unique spin that sets it apart from all the other team ‚Äìups the two engaged in.One thing ‚ÄúNeighbors‚Äù does well is suck you into its crazy world. You truly forget it‚Äôs a movie and are taken on a wild ride that unfolds over the period of one Friday night. It gives you that fuzzy buzzy feeling you get when you stay awake all night long after the last day of the work week. The sensation adds to the quirky viewing experience.Although it‚Äôs rated R, ‚ÄúNeighbors‚Äù would achieve nothing above a PG-13 if released today. There‚Äôs quite a bit of profanity and adult content. However, no nudity is found. It‚Äôs tame by today‚Äôs rating standards.‚ÄúNeighbors‚Äù was only re- released on DVD, which will no doubt make many consumers depressed. It‚Äôs still nice to be able to get our hands on a copy of the movie after so many years off the grid. There are no special features included. We can only dream about new interviews with Dan Aykroyd, Cathy Moriarity, and Kathryn Walker about the making of the film and working with Belushi.A new edition of ‚ÄúNeighbors‚Äù is a welcome addition to any film enthusiast‚Äôs library of 1980‚Äôs comedy classics. It captures a unique moment in the careers of John Belushi and Dan Aykroyd. Even without any bonus material or ‚ÄúBehind-the-Scenes‚Äù featurettes, it‚Äôs still worth picking up thanks to an entertainingly dark romp through suburbia.

I should‚Äôve known as soon as the POV footage appeared on my TV what I was in store for after putting ‚ÄúThe Devil Incarnate‚Äù into my DVD player. As if the cover of a baby with horns adorned with a logo featuring an upside-down cross in place of the ‚Äút‚Äù wasn‚Äôt enough of a warning. I love a good possession or religious thriller so I wanted to give it a chance. I‚Äôll need to remember to listen to my instincts next time.Holly (Graci Carli) and Trevor Davidson (Rod Luzzi) are newlyweds on a road trip for their honeymoon. After stopping to have their palms read, Holly begins acting strangely. The announcement that she's pregnant further sets off a chain reaction of bizarre behavior and strange occurrences. Is she suffering from mood swings because of the pregnancy or is there something more sinister at work?The only thing good I have to say about ‚ÄúThe Devil Incarnate‚Äù is that its actors all come across as genuine in their roles. They give the audience no indication that they didn‚Äôt take the movie seriously during production. It‚Äôs a testament to each of them and their individual skills. I felt this needed to be recognized.No sort of Biblical theology is explored in ‚ÄúThe Devil Incarnate.‚Äù There are two possible ‚Äúmessages‚Äù the movie might be trying to convey to viewers. One is that we shouldn‚Äôt get involved in the occult. The other is that the sins of our ancestors will affect us. Unfortunately, it doesn‚Äôt award us any hope that we can break such a generational curse.‚ÄúThe Devil Incarnate‚Äù is not rated, but would hold an ‚ÄúR‚Äù if it were. While there‚Äôs no nudity, it contains enough adult situations and content to push it beyond ‚ÄúPG-13.‚Äù It also includes frightening images and profanity.Many times an anemic independent project like ‚ÄúThe Devil Incarnate‚Äù can gain some sympathy with me if I can see the sort of hard work and passion filmmakers poured into its creation. A ‚ÄúMaking of‚Äù featurette or ‚ÄúBehind the Scenes‚Äù documentary gives a reviewer like myself a chance to experience the blood, sweat, and tears everyone involved in the production put into it. Unfortunately, the DVD contains no special features to help redeem it in my eyes.‚ÄúThe Devil Incarnate‚Äù is the sort of horror film we really don‚Äôt need any more of. Playing like an unholy mash-up of ‚ÄúDrag Me to Hell,‚Äù ‚ÄúRosemary‚Äôs Baby,‚Äù and ‚ÄúThe Devil Inside,‚Äù it‚Äôs an unnecessary addition to the demon possession and "found footage‚Äù genres that‚Äôve been overdone lately. There‚Äôs not a shred of originality to be found in its 76-minute running time.

"Scooby-Doo! Mystery Incorporated: The Complete Season 2" collects the last 26 episodes of this highly acclaimed series. I admit it's definitely different from the other shows featuring everybody's favorite crime solving canine. There are way more adult-oriented jokes and witty pop culture nods and winks that most children of the 2000s won't pick up on. However, I still feel it has elements which would appeal to a younger demographic. What's not to like about a Great Dane and his gang of mystery solvers facing off against a different monster every week?In Season Two, Scooby and the gang continue to try and solve the mystery of the Planispheric Disc. As they uncover the secrets surrounding the different pieces of the artifact, new crimes come up that need to be solved. Each clue they uncover along the way gets them closer to the truth behind the mystical Disc."Scooby-Doo! Mystery Incorporated" is obviously a prequel to "Scooby-Doo! Where Are You?" Not to give away too much, but they're shown heading out of their hometown of Crystal Cove in the Mystery Machine as the series closes. This leaves the viewer with the feeling that you could put the original 1969 show in your DVD player and the two would fit seamlessly together.After 52 episodes, you'd think we could get some type of extra features for the final episodes of "Scooby-Doo! Mystery Incorporated." How can there not be any footage of the voice actors recording their parts or animators doing what they do? Couldn't they get the producers, director, or any of the cast members to record commentary for a few of the episodes?"Scooby-Doo! Mystery Incorporated: The Complete Season 2" is a wonderful addition to the library of any fan of the Great Dane's adventures or Hanna-Barbera enthusiasts. The monsters are scary and the mysteries will keep kids wondering who the bad guy in the mask is while laughing at the same time. Fans of all things Hanna-Barbera will love it because it incorporates classic characters from the animation studio's colorful past such as Dr. Benton Quest and Roger "Race" Bannon from "Johnny Quest" and Dynomutt and the Blue Falcon.

When it was announced that Bryan Singer was returning to the Director‚Äôs Chair for ‚ÄúX-Men: Days of Future Past,‚Äù fanboys and girls everywhere squealed in excitement. Finally, the series was going back into the hands of the man who helped start the whole film franchise. I, on the other hand, groaned and wondered why ‚ÄúFirst Class‚Äù helmsman Matthew Vaughn couldn‚Äôt return to push the story further. It was my favorite entry in the series and took the bad taste out of my mouth created by the mess referred to as ‚ÄúThe Last Stand.‚ÄùIn the distant future, robots known as Sentinels have all but wiped out both mutants and humans. Wolverine is sent by the X-Men to prevent an event which will send history down this path to destruction. First he has to find a way to unite Professor X and Magneto in a search for the harbinger of doom - Mystique.My worries over Singer‚Äôs return to steer the franchise were all realized after the first hour or so of ‚ÄúX-Men: Days of Future Past.‚Äù The first portion of the film moves ahead and sets the viewer up for a powerful and epic thrill ride. Unfortunately, like most of the director‚Äôs movies, it starts to meander and get tedious right after the halfway mark. The action and excitement gets bogged down in a lot of dramatic narrative which feels as if it was injected into the script to make the movie more analytical than it really needed to be.One thing I was pleasantly surprised by was the way the massive amount of cast members and the parts they played in the story were handled. I was concerned when it was announced that the original and new actors who portrayed their respective characters were going to be jammed into one movie. How in the world were filmmakers going to keep the movie from becoming overcrowded and derailing?Director Singer and Screenwriter Simon Kinberg handled the whole affair quite well. Instead of trying to cram as much of a pleasurable thing down our throats as they could, they worked towards the greater good of the whole. They didn‚Äôt play favorites and shove certain popular actors into scenes just to give them more face time.‚ÄúX-Men: Days of Future Past‚Äù is rated PG-13for sequences of intense sci-fi violence and action, some suggestive material, nudity, and language. I‚Äôve seen Hugh Jackman‚Äôs butt enough now. Does it really have to be showcased in every one of these films?Although I did enjoy ‚ÄúX-Men: Days of Future Past‚Äù to a certain degree, I felt myself getting lethargic as it moved along towards its inevitable climax. By no means is it a bad movie, but I think it could‚Äôve been better under Matthew Vaughn‚Äôs direction. I do give it props for fully embracing its science fiction roots.

Disney continues its new tradition of unveiling all their classics in digitally restored high-definition with the release of ‚ÄúSleeping Beauty‚Äù in a Diamond Edition. Having been released already in a Blu-ray format, the new version doesn‚Äôt create the same sense of urgency we get when one of the vaulted titles gets its first upgrade. Mouse House devotees will still want to jump up and grab one off store shelves before they disappear.The evil sorceress Maleficent places a curse on Princess Aurora after being slighted by the royal family. She will die by pricking her finger on the spindle of a spinning wheel before her 16th birthday. The king puts his daughter in the care of three fairies who take her into hiding to keep the tragedy from occurring. Maleficent becomes obsessed with finding the girl and fulfilling her evil spell.‚ÄúSleeping Beauty‚Äù Diamond Edition is presented in 1080p High-Definition with an aspect ratio of 2.55:1. The digital restoration brings out all the beauty, texture, and depth of the backgrounds and foregrounds for each scene. It‚Äôs gorgeously apparent during the climactic battle sequence between the prince and Maleficent.A 7.1 audio upgrade puts home audiences in the center of all the drama, romance, and action. The movie‚Äôs musical score, strong voice cast, and atmospheric sound effects place us in a fairy tale world you‚Äôll want to re-visit time and time again. It‚Äôs all a perfect accent to the great imagery unfolding before our very eyes.‚ÄúSleeping Beauty‚Äù Diamond Edition comes with a myriad of educating and entertaining bonus material. There are several featurettes focusing on the making of the movie and the talent involved. ‚ÄúBeauty-Oke‚Äù provides children of all ages the opportunity to sing along to their favorite songs from the movie. Three deleted scenes are included as well. Some of the classic special features from the original 2008 Blu-ray release are found as well.I was pleasantly reminded of the dark elegance of Maleficent and the strong gothic overtones presented in ‚ÄúSleeping Beauty.‚Äù They reminded me of the atmosphere found in the underrated ‚ÄúThe Black Cauldron‚Äù and ‚ÄúHunchback of Notre Dame.‚Äù Being a fan of horror movies, I was attracted to the last quarter of the film more so than the first three.Disney collectors and those who never got a chance to get the Platinum Edition of ‚ÄúSleeping Beauty‚Äù will want to rush out and grab a copy of the Diamond Edition immediately. After a window of a month or so, this new version will become scarce and you‚Äôll be hard-pressed to find a copy of it anywhere. It‚Äôs an essential addition to your family‚Äôs home entertainment collection.

If there‚Äôs one thing ‚ÄúHalloween: The Complete Collection‚Äù has done for fans, its let them conveniently re-live their favorite movie in the franchise at any given moment in the comfort of their own home. October is one of my favorite times of year because of a certain horror-themed holiday which gives me even more reason to go through the ‚ÄúHalloween‚Äù series as furiously as possible. I recently took in Rob Zombie‚Äôs ‚ÄúHalloween II‚Äù after only seeing it once when it was released in 2009.Zombie‚Äôs 2007 remake / reboot / origin story of John Carpenter‚Äôs classic tale took the first half of the film to give us exhaustive information on Michael Myers‚Äô past and his reasons for becoming the cold-blooded killer he turned into. The second part was a rather faithful re-tooling of the original 1978 classic.His ‚ÄúHalloween II‚Äù does the exact same thing as the remake. It loosely takes the storyline from Rick Rosenthal‚Äôs 1981 follow-up to Carpenter‚Äôs masterpiece and runs with it for the first 30 or so minutes before heading in a completely different direction. In a nut shell, Michael Myers is viciously making his way back to Haddonfield to finish the business he started in the first chapter. This time he‚Äôs being led by the specter of his dead mother riding a white horse while leading around a vision of his childhood self. It seems Judith Myers wants Michael to bring his sister Laurie ‚Äúhome.‚ÄùTyler Mane portrays Michael Myers as a coherent demonic force with an unquenchable fury. When he wants someone dead, he sees the job through grunting and viciously thrusting his weapon to the bitter end. Carpenter‚Äôs Myers was more calm and passive in his approach. Although cut from the same cloth, these are two very different versions of the same character.Where the original 1978 film and even its sequel were studies in gore minimalism, Rob Zombie‚Äôs ‚ÄúHalloween II‚Äù revels in its onscreen gruesomeness. From the graphic opening scenes of Laurie Strode being put back together on the operating table to each and every kill performed by Michael Myers, it‚Äôs an exercise in excess blood and guts. Just what audiences crave in their horror films now.Taking in ‚ÄúHalloween II‚Äù for a second time has revealed it‚Äôs not quite as cerebral as I originally thought on first viewing. Don‚Äôt misunderstand me. There‚Äôs way more thought put into the script here than a slasher film really demands, but at its core it‚Äôs still just a modern update of a good old-fashioned stalking killer flick. I still think there are points in the film where it‚Äôs insinuated someone else besides Michael is doing the butchering.‚ÄúHalloween: The Complete Collection‚Äù features the unrated Director‚Äôs Cut of Rob Zombie‚Äôs ‚ÄúHalloween II.‚Äù It‚Äôs 14 minutes longer than the version seen by audiences in the theater. The extended edition is made up of 94 altered scenes including 42 examples of alternative footage and 14 re-cuts. What‚Äôs strange is there‚Äôs no extra violence or sexual situations among any of the unused and amended material.While still a worthy entry into the ‚ÄúHalloween‚Äù franchise, Rob Zombie‚Äôs sequel isn‚Äôt quite as fulfilling on a second watch. I remembered it being a whole lot smarter than it really is. It does deserve props for trying to take the slasher genre in a heavier psychological and abstract route. However, at the end of the day, it‚Äôs still just another entertaining episode in the legend of Michael Myers.Rob Zombie's "Halloween II: Unrated Director's Cut" is available now on the "Halloween: The Complete Collection" Deluxe and Standard Edition box sets.

‚ÄúHalloween‚Äù fans have a huge reason to be celebrating. In what can only be referred to as a major miracle, nine different movie companies have come together to release the definitive box set for the most important franchise in the slasher genre. ‚ÄúHalloween: The Complete Collection‚Äù hits store shelves just in time to be binge-watched during its namesake‚Äôs holiday season.‚ÄúHalloween: The Complete Collection‚Äù is an exhaustive assemblage of every film in the series and enough special features to keep any horror fan entertained for days. Not only are all ten of the entries in the franchise included, but there are alternate versions of a couple highlighted as well depending on which version of the collection you get.The deluxe edition includes the long sought-after Producer‚Äôs Cut of ‚ÄúHalloween: The Curse of Michael Myers.‚Äù This rare gem is available for the first time ‚Äúlegally‚Äù and features 43 minutes of footage not seen in theaters, which creates a completely different viewing experience than what audiences in 1995 received. An extended cut of John Carpenter‚Äôs original 1978 film made up of footage from the TV edition is found as well. The TV versions of both ‚ÄúHalloween‚Äù and ‚ÄúHalloween II‚Äù are also included.The standard release comes with the theatrical cuts of the original eight movies and unrated director‚Äôs cuts of Rob Zombie‚Äôs reboots. ‚ÄúHalloween: The Curse of Michael Myers Producer‚Äôs Cut,‚Äù the ‚ÄúHalloween‚Äù and ‚ÄúHalloween II‚Äù TV versions, and the extended ‚ÄúHalloween‚Äù aren‚Äôt included in this edition. It‚Äôs perfect for those who just want all the basic films in one neat package.‚ÄúHalloween: The Complete Collection‚Äù is filled with so much bonus material it would take a whole other article to describe them in detail. They include audio commentaries, deleted scenes, alternate endings, behind-the-scenes featurettes, new and vintage cast and crew interviews, TV and radio spots, theatrical trailers, and more. ‚ÄúHorror‚Äôs Hallowed Grounds‚Äù takes audiences back to the filming locations of ‚ÄúHalloween II‚Äù and ‚ÄúHalloween III: Season of the Witch.‚ÄùI don‚Äôt know if there‚Äôs really any point for me to even include a breakdown of the ratings for the ‚ÄúHalloween‚Äù movies, but here it is for what it‚Äôs worth. Each one has its own measure of violence, bloody images, profanity, nudity, and adult situations. They‚Äôre all an interesting example of where the slasher genre was at the time they were made. 1978‚Äôs ‚ÄúHalloween‚Äù is a study in suspense which shows very little onscreen gore. Move ahead to 1989‚Äôs ‚ÄúHalloween 5: The Revenge of Michael Myers‚Äù and more bloodshed is seen. Rob Zombie‚Äôs versions of Michael Myers are even more graphic in every way to fit in with what genre fans expect in the 2000s.It‚Äôs safe to say that ‚ÄúHalloween: The Complete Collection‚Äôs‚Äù high-definition audio and video transfers for each film beats any previous standard DVD releases. Most have been available on Blu-ray before, but having them all together in one set is where the excitement comes in. They all look and sound great based on the level of restoration they were given.John Carpenter‚Äôs ‚ÄúHalloween‚Äù and its sequels deserve to be celebrated because of their impact on the modern slasher and horror genres. ‚ÄúHalloween: The Complete Collection‚Äù helps to remind older audiences of this and educate newer viewers on where movies like ‚ÄúSaw,‚Äù ‚ÄúHatchet,‚Äù and other less potent reboots and remakes of classics come from. It‚Äôs a historical piece celebrating the many faces and eras of the Boogeyman and how he‚Äôs stayed the iconic face of terror for over 35 years.

In the early 1990s, my Friday and Saturday nights were spent at home watching movie after movie of whatever I could find in my local video store. I would first scour the shelves for the newest horror, sci-fi, or action flicks and then move on to older or lesser known titles. Thus, my love affair with Full Moon Features and straight-to-video fare began.I would literally scoop up anything with a Full Moon logo on it and spend hours in the dark of my living room devouring ‚ÄúSubspecies,‚Äù ‚ÄúPuppet Master,‚Äù ‚ÄúDemonic Toys,‚Äù ‚ÄúRobot Jox,‚Äù and anything else I could get my hands on. The ‚ÄúTrancers‚Äù movies were among those B-movie gems I would pick up.Full Moon Entertainment recently released ‚ÄúTrancers: The Ultimate Edition‚Äù on Blu-ray for those of us wanting to relive the dawn of the straight-to-video age and hopefully introduce these priceless films to a whole new generation. Let‚Äôs face it. Without Charles Band and Full Moon Features, there wouldn‚Äôt be the Asylum, SyFy Channel, Anchor Bay, or any other independent genre companies giving us ‚ÄúSharknado,‚Äù ‚ÄúMega Piranha,‚Äù and ‚ÄúMetal Shifters.‚ÄùJack Deth (Tim Thomerson) is an Angel City trooper sent back in time to the Los Angeles of 1985. He is assigned to inhabit the body of his ancestor in order to find his arch-enemy, Whistler (Michael Stefani), who turns people into zombies. Deth must stop him before is able to kill all the ancestors of the members of the future governing council.‚ÄúTrancers: The Ultimate Edition‚Äù is a perfect example of everything Full Moon and Charles Band was creating in the early and mid-1980s. It‚Äôs obvious they saw blockbuster films and wanted to make their own low-budget versions of them for genre fans to enjoy. After all, once you saw ‚ÄúBlade Runner,‚Äù ‚ÄúThe Terminator,‚Äù and ‚ÄúTotal Recall,‚Äù where could you get more of those types of entertainment to enjoy? Band and his army of filmmakers filled that niche perfectly.You don‚Äôt get any more 1980s than ‚ÄúTrancers.‚Äù As the director and producer of the movie, Charles Band injected it with as much noir flavor as he could wring out of ‚ÄúBlade Runner‚Äù without being sued for plagiarism. You‚Äôve got the long trench coats with the added flare of shoulder pads. Couple that with weird bolos, shirt collars, and ties and you have a futuristic beat cop ready to take down any zombie or android he comes up against in the past.Let‚Äôs not forget Helen Hunt‚Äôs crazy puffed-up hair and her fixation with punk rock. Just like Kyle Reese in James Cameron‚Äôs ‚ÄúThe Terminator,‚Äù Jack Deth somehow makes his way into a nightclub to enjoy some tunes from a bygone era as he pursues his murderous target. Like they say, ‚ÄúImitation is the greatest form of flattery.‚ÄùAlthough ‚ÄúTrancers‚Äù has been remastered in high-definition, the video quality is far from perfect. The picture is still better than it‚Äôs ever looked before, but contains some pops and scratches here and there. It‚Äôs about the best you could expect from a B-movie which was probably not always stored under the best of conditions. It‚Äôs presented with 5.1 stereo surround which will give viewers a more immersive experience when it comes to all the laser fire and environmental sounds you expect from a sci-fi flick.The bonus material for ‚ÄúTrancers: The Ultimate Edition‚Äù will make collectors happy. Audio commentary is provided by Actor Tim Thomerson and Director / Producer Charles Band. Daniel Griffith‚Äôs ‚ÄúTrancers‚Äù featurette and a rare interview with Tim Thomerson, Helen Hunt, and Megan Ward are included. The complete ‚ÄúTrancers: City of Lost Angels‚Äù segment from the anthology film ‚ÄúPulsepounders‚Äù is found as well. It doesn‚Äôt appear to have been cleaned up or remastered at all. A rare still gallery rounds out the special features.‚ÄúTrancers: The Ultimate Edition‚Äù is unrated, but would be worthy of a PG-13 if put before the MPAA. There are some adult situations with no nudity. The language and violence is what you would expect from any genre movie these days.All in all, enthusiasts of 1980s B-movies will love "Trancers: The Ultimate Edition." The film is filled with fun practical effects, film noir overtones, and plenty of action for everyone to enjoy. Even with a less than spectacular video transfer, it‚Äôs an essential item for any sci-fi devotee‚Äôs home entertainment library.

The Force is with Disney and Lucasfilm's first major venture together. The two powerhouses held special advanced screenings in select theaters across the country for "Star Wars Rebels," which premieres October 3rd on the Disney Channel. Audience reactions to what they saw was unanimously positive and with good cause. The show completely captures the spirit and youthful charm of the original 1977 classic that started it all.The 50-minute sneak preview shown in theaters across the country was titled ‚ÄúStar Wars Rebels: Spark of Rebellion.‚Äù It takes place between the events of ‚ÄúEpisodes III‚Äù and ‚ÄúIV‚Äù and introduces a band of rebels who man the space vessel Ghost. They make it their life mission to foil the Galactic Empire‚Äôs plans of galactic domination. Fourteen year old orphan Ezra Bridger reluctantly joins former Padawan Kanan Jarrus, pilot Hera Syndulla, Mandalorian warrior Sabine Wren, Lasat warrior Zeb Orrelios, and astromech droid Chopper on a rescue mission to the spice mines of Kessel to free a group of Wookiee slaves. Agent Kallus of the Imperial Security Bureau leads his stormtroopers in pursuit of the motley crew.You can tell that the producers of ‚ÄúStar Wars Rebels: Spark of Rebellion‚Äù listened to uptight fans of anything related to the prequel trilogy when taking in to consideration the direction they wanted to head in for the new series. Personally, I enjoy everything ‚ÄúStar Wars‚Äù and didn‚Äôt have any problem with ‚ÄúThe Clone Wars‚Äù or ‚ÄúEpisodes I‚Äù through ‚ÄúIII.‚ÄùThe echoes of ‚ÄúStar Wars ‚Äì Episode IV: A New Hope‚Äù are very much evident here. We have a young man yearning for something more from life than his aimless existence on a forgotten world in the outer rim of a galaxy far, far away. We get a band of misfits from all corners of the universe taking the boy in and giving him direction. Add to that the evil establishment who wants to rule everyone with an iron fist. It‚Äôs just like all great tales of adventure and heroism, but with different characters and settings. Let‚Äôs just call it what it is: ‚ÄúStar Wars‚Äù revamped for a new generation.Familiar spaceships and figures from the original ‚ÄúStar Wars‚Äù trilogy no doubt makes longtime fans comfortable as they take in ‚ÄúSpark of Rebellion.‚Äù TIE Fighters race through space and stormtroopers follow their uniformed superiors around as they bark orders at them. The exterior and interior of the Star Destroyers also mirror the images embedded into our psyche by ‚ÄúThe Empire Strikes Back.‚ÄùThe animation style utilized for ‚ÄúStar Wars Rebels: Spark of Rebellion‚Äù is very much similar to that of ‚ÄúThe Clone Wars.‚Äù They‚Äôve obviously moved forward with leaps and bounds when it comes to the depth, texturing, and movements of the human characters. It‚Äôs also evident that the work of original trilogy concept artist Ralph McQuarrie‚Äôs handiwork was a huge influence on the design of the show. The evidence of that can be seen immediately in the character of Zeb, whose appearance is based on the original design of the Wookies.The musical score for ‚ÄúStar Wars Rebels: Spark of Rebellion‚Äù also differs greatly from that of ‚ÄúThe Clone Wars.‚Äù It‚Äôs a return to the classic sounds of John Williams‚Äô symphonic work that makes audiences want to stand up and clap in excitement every time it‚Äôs heard. Composer Kevin Kiner is the talent behind the series, but it sounds like he‚Äôs taking all of Williams‚Äô work and just rearranging it to fit new sequences of peril and drama.‚ÄúStar Wars Rebels: Spark of Rebellion‚Äù is Lucasfilm and Disney trying to meet the needs and expectations of three very different generations all at the same time. Returning to the original formula a young and enthusiastic film geek named George Lucas introduced the world to 37 years ago was obviously the correct direction to journey in. It‚Äôs going to be fun seeing where the new show will venture and what familiar characters we‚Äôll get to see along the way.

DC Comics characters continue to rule the television world and the proof is in ‚ÄúArrow: The Complete Second Season‚Äù Blu-ray and DVD sets. Every actor in the cast is invested in their role and strives to provide quality entertainment in each episode. The fight choreography creates some of the greatest action sequences ever seen in super hero movies and TV. Good writing doesn‚Äôt hurt when it comes to keeping audiences engaged week after week, either.After the Glades are ravaged by the Undertaking, Oliver Queen (Stephen Amell) retreats to the island he was stranded on for so many years. Arrow is unable to face the citizens and friends he feels he‚Äôs failed. At the plea of Diggle (David Ramsey) and Felicity (Emily Bett Rickards), he returns to discover Starling City is worse off than ever. Oliver finds himself pitted against old and new villains alike as he struggles to fend off evil and protect those he loves.The Blu-ray edition of ‚ÄúArrow: The Complete Second Season‚Äù is presented in 1080p High-Definition 16x9 (1.78.1) coupled with DTS-HD MA: English 5.1 audio. The video quality is flawless and gives viewers no reason to be distracted from all the action and excitement taking place onscreen. The surround sound puts you right in the middle of the jungles of the island and the noisy streets of Starling City.Those who love bonus material will be impressed with ‚ÄúArrow: The Complete Second Season‚Äù Blu-ray set. A bonus recap episode reminds viewers of the events of the first season. Three featurettes entitled ‚ÄúFrom Vigilante to Hero,‚Äù ‚ÄúHow Did They Do That? The Visual Effects of ‚ÄòArrow,‚Äô‚Äù and ‚ÄúWirework: The Impossible Moves of ‚ÄòArrow‚Äô‚Äù take us behind the scenes of the show. Unaired scenes, a gag reel, and the ‚ÄúArrow‚Äù 2013 Comic-Con Panel complete the special features.‚ÄúArrow: The Complete Second Season‚Äù is unrated, even though it would merit a PG-13 if put before the MPAA. There‚Äôs a whole lot of violence and bloodshed when our hooded vigilante comes face-to-face with the criminals who cross him. Some adult situations and mild language are found as well.If you‚Äôre not watching ‚ÄúArrow‚Äù already, you need to be. Strong scripting, great acting, and breakneck pacing make it an experience you don‚Äôt want to miss. Marvel might be the Kings of the Cinema right now when it comes to compact two hour super hero tales. However, DC reigns supreme if you‚Äôre looking for longevity and complex dramas that keep your attention for the long haul.

DO NOT BUY unless you pay for 1-3 mbs internet! I have charter internet and pay for 60 mbs! I bought this one to replace my TP LInk router in hopes to get more consistent 40-60 mbs internet. Well I was fooled. This router was on sale and was really cheap. There was a reason why! It is because this is the worst router ever! Connection speed was slow. It kept on disconnecting. It was NOT RELIABLE. I will list my PROS and CONS with this router.PROS:+Easy to connect, with an easy password to remember.CONS:+SLOW---AND I MEAN REALLY REALLY SLOW! Get this if you already have slow internet, do not get this if you are expecting super high speed fast internet.+Unreliable--the number of times I had to restart the router because the connection was lost is incredible. I wasted so much time trying to fix it than using the actual internet.+SLOW--Dnt let those two antennas fool you into thinking it will be super fast.+CHEAP LOOKING AND FEELS CHEAPOverall, DO NOT WAST YOUR MONEY ON THIS ROUTER. Even the cheaper TP-Link that is usually #1 on Amazon is faster. You seriously get what you pay for and it is definitely not worth the time and effort. Trust me do not waste your time and money on this! I ultimately, returned this item and the Netgear Range Extender and bought the high end TP-Link router worth about $100 and it is way better. I didn't even need the range extender anymore. I just needed a good new router.

This is literally the best invention ever! I mainly use it for my Ikea side table. I have a iPhone lightening cable and I use the Cordies to keep my charging cable in place instead of it constantly falling to the ground after unplugging my iPhone. The cordies is such cool and amazing solution to keep wires from falling to the ground from a desk or side table. I wish I had found this sooner! I will list my PROS and CONS to help you get a better sense of this product.PROS:+It gets the job done. It securely holds my lightening cable wire for my iPhone & iPad in place on my ikea side table.+It can be used anywhere, whether it be a side table or a desk.+Comes in fun colors to match any decor!+Really stable and heavy so it doesn't get pulled around.CONS:-The quality of it seems a bit cheap, as in there are some sharp edges. This is probably due to the molding.-The cordies in the teal color does not match in real life. It is a much lighter teal color than the darker blue teal in the image.Overall, the CONS aren't to bad that will prevent me from buying this again. It is a very helpful solution to keeping my lightening cable in place on my nightstand. Be aware that there are a lot of fake ones out there. I bought my directly from Amazon "Shipped and sold by Amazon" to ensure that I was getting the Authentic Cordies from Quirky. Don't be fooled by the cheaper version! It is not the same! You will definitely get what you pay for if you buy the cheaper alternative. Overall, I will highly recommend this to anyone.

For anyone who loves emojis this is the case for you! It is super thin and not bulky at all which I love. The design is printed onto the case, which is a bit bad as it will wear out and start to fade away over time. I will list the PROs and CONs about this case:PROs+Very thin and not bulky--I hate cases that make your thin iPhone 6 phone so big.+Unique design--emojis are the in thing right now with young people+Cut-out for everything are precise--no need to worry about the mic hold being covered upCONs-The design is printed on, so it will eventually fade away as time goes on-The printing seems a lil bit on the cheap sideOverall, I would recommend this case to those who are looking for a thin case that offers little protection but shows off a unique style with emojis.

The quality of their Galaxy S6 case is not the same as the iPhone 6. The Galaxy S6 case that I received the bottom gold part is very loose and does not stay with the other half. I push really hard to have it stay attached to the other piece. I have resorted to putting on tape so that it doesn't fall off. This case is pretty and durable. However, it gets dirty fast! Maybe it is because of the light color? Or maybe the material it is made of. I would not recommend the Galaxy S6 Vibrance Series case to anyone. I have been on the hunt for the perfect GoPro case to house my GoPro and the many different accessories that I own. I recently got back from my trip across Europe. I have used this GoPro case from Smatree for the past month and this is surely the best case I have ever owned. It is super durable and holds a lot of different accessories. I found that I could fit all my accessories into this case in a breeze.Throughout my trip I was constantly on the go. I found that the outer clip was extremely helpful as I would attach it to my backpack so it would not get lost. In addition, My GoPro sticks fit into the compartment perfectly.I will list my PROS and CONS for this case.PROS:+So many compartments!--this is the only GoPro case you will ever need as it fits everything!+Durability--this case stayed in tacked throughout a month long trip backpacking in Europe. The zippers all worked and my GoPro stayed safe in the compartments.+Size--the case is large enough to fit all my accessories, but not so huge that it takes up so much space and can't fit into my backpack/luggage+Weight--the Styrofoam compartments make this case lightweight and easy to carry, while still protecting the case.CONS:-It does not fit all GoPro sticks--of course it fits Smatree brand GoPro sticks, and it fit my GoPro brand selfie stick.Overall, this is a solid, durable, reliable case. I can fit all my accessories and not have to worry about them getting damaged. I am interested in buying another set just to include more of my GoPro accessories. My GoPro and accessories survived a month long trip in Europe. I am sure this is the best GoPro case on the market.

A $70 remote?! Is it worth it?! NO. For the whopping price of $70 you get an overpriced remote that your smart phone with a GoPro app can easily do. The reason why I bought this because I wanted to use this instead of using the app especially when traveling internationally. Don't get me wrong, it works well, but it is way to overpriced. The buttons work exactly how they work on the actual GoPro. It is pretty light weight and somewhat durable. Overall, I would not really recommend this to anyone if they dnt use it for international travel. I would recommend this for people who travel internationally, want to take pics in the water, or who want to use it during adventurous activities and do not want to risk breaking your phone.

Cheap feeling, but amazing sound quality. I know it sounds like an oxymoron, but this exactly describes these headphones. In your hands, these headphones feel cheap and plastic like that can easily break, but when you put it on your ears and listen to sounds such as music it sounds pretty incredible for bluetooth headphones. These headphones were easy to connect to bluetooth. I will list my PROS and CONSPROS:+incredible sound quality--compared to bose they are pretty good at its price range.+easy connection to bluetooth--this is extremely important factor in that connection to bluetooth needs to be fast and easy+feels good around the head and ears--the material feels comfortable around my ears+lightweight--it is not too heavy and will not hurt your head after hours of usage.CONS:-cheap build quality--these headphones feel super cheap. I feel like I can easily break them by accidentally dropping it onto the ground.-okay battery life--the battery life was not that great, im not sure if I just got a bad unit?-expensive for the quality--I do not think the quality is worth the price, maybe the sound technology is worth the price, but not the aesthetics and feel of it.Overall, these headphones are great if your interested in sound quality more than aesthetics and feel of your headphones. I believe that the sound quality compromises for the cheap build quality, which is why I did not rate it 4 stars. I do recommend these if you love the sentey brand, but you can find better headphones out there for cheaper the price.**Disclaimer: I received this headphone for free in return for my unbiased review.

The cord to connect that speaker to the player is 39" not including the ends.2. The charging USB code is 29" not including the ends.3. To turn unit on, just hold down the encoder. Same to turn off.4. To mute (if wired) or pause (if bluetooth), just push the encoder, same to un-mute/un-pause.5. To fast forward a song push the encoder twice, to back up a song push the encoder 3 times (only if using bluetooth).I am extremely pleased with this speaker. I will make sure to post any updates should anything change.I received a free sample in exchange for an unbiased review.Update 08/31/15:I received the following email in response to my review:"There is a detail we want to explain for you.In the review, you mention that the speaker can not charge and listen at the same time when using wired.In fact, the speaker can do it. You just need to charge it on the outlet not into the computer USB port. The attachment is the detail, please check it."Sure enough, if I plug the USB charging cord into another unit to charge, such as a USB charge port, the unit can both play and charge at the same time. I decided to bump up the stars both due to the prompt customer service, and also due to the offer of a solution to a problem.

A wallet in a back pocket is an easy target, and a purse equally so.Using a bag that can be kept concealed under garments is really a wonderful idea, and this little bag is a nice option. Offers the option to use an expandable strap or a belt loop. Has two pockets to separate items, and a loop to hang your keys on.The RFID feature is a nice bonus, but I'm not convinced yet, so I'm going to test it using my key card that utilizes RFID technology. I'm going to put my card in the bag and see if I can unlock the door. I will post an update once I have done this.A free sample was provided in exchange for an unbiased review.Update 08/26/15:I finally had an opportunity to test the RFID protection claims. I put my RFID based key card in this bag, and went to see if I could still open a door using the card through the bag. Not even a hesitation. I have reduced the stars to three based on that claim alone. The bag is still useful in wearing under your garments to keep your personal items safe physically, but not electronically.

1:15 Mins What you get is a pair of nail clippers, and a nail file. Together they work great to trim your dog's nails, followed by a quick file to smooth up sharp edges. That's a nice touch if you're someone like me where you allow your dog on your furniture, and their freshly cut nails catch on the fabric of your couch.Overall, the clippers seem to perform fine on nails, sharp enough to get it with one swift cut. So why not five stars?While most dog owners know how to clip their pets nails, many new dog owners might not. So it's always nice to have instructions on how to use a tool, especially if it can lead to harm to your pet. Not only was there no instructions on how to use on your dog, but also no explanation of the functions of the tool. I realize it's a standard nail clipping tool, but not everyone is familiar with them, so instructions are always nice. It's also nice to get reminders, like how to identify where the quick is on your pets nail, so you don't cut into that and result in accidental bleeding, not to mention pain for your pet. it's just nice to have something on paper that validates what you're about to do.A free sample was provided in exchange for an unbiased review.

0:53 Mins These bird repellent disks can do wonders if used correctly, and by that, I mean that you'll need quite a number of them.First, putting them together is easy, attach some rings, a hook, remove the plastic cover, and done.The hard part is figuring out where to hang them. The goal here is to freak out the wild birds by making them see reflections that will scare them off. This has it's own challenges, including setting up in an area where a problem already persists.I found that when used as a preventative measure, it keeps the birds from inviting themselves in, however, if the birds are already established, hanging up one or even two of these, will do nothing for the problem.The best way these can be used is as a preventative is by hanging up several of these in the area that you don't want birds. Make a circle of these to keep the center prize out. After a week, move them around! This is the most important step. The birds get used to these tricks, and learn to ignore them, the best way to keep up with it, is to keep them guessing if it's a trick or a real threat. Fortunately the hook that comes with these is mendable to a certain degree.My experiment consisted of splitting these in half. I took the first half of my assembled disks and put them in an area that was already compromised by the wild birds, and I took the other half to an area that was not yet compromised, but expected any minute it would be due to the delicious and tempting plant life that was coming to life. The results? In the bird established area, the bird attacks only reduced by about 30%. Not bad if you ask me, but not good enough. In the future bird attack area, not a single bird was sighted, not a one. So it would appear to me, that these disks work best as a preventative rather than a solution.Of note, the disks work best when they are no more than three feet apart from each other, in a small area. If you have acreage, you might be looking at purchasing a large number of these.A free sample was provided in exchange for an unbiased review.

1:55 Mins This watch is a very nice gift that is unique not only with the design, but also with the fact that it is a wind up watch. These are hard to find now-a-days, and so it makes it very unique.The style is very nice, setting/adjusting the time is easy to do. Winding up takes a little getting used to, and I'm still trying to figure out how long the watch will run before it's critical to wind up again.So far I have noticed that it does run a tad slow, about 5 min in 24 hours. that's not too bad, but in a week's time, that's a half hour off. Pretty serious if you're a punctual person. Thus the 3 stars.I'm going to keep watching it and comparing it to the actual time, and see how it does over time. I'll update my review as I learn more.A free sample was provided in exchange for an unbiased review.Update 08/24/15:I fully wound the watch at 8am yesterday and let it go to see how long it will last on one winding. The watch completely stopped at 12:10pm today. So almost 28 hours. I'll keep checking it to see if it's consistent. On the flip side, the watch seemed to keep better time this time around, maybe it just needed to be used? I'll keep tabs on it and post an update as appropriate.Update 08/26/15:I decided to see what happens if I wind the watch every 12 hours, rather than 24+. So far, the watch keeps consistent time. I think the trick here might be to wind itKU6WN6HH twice a day rather than once a day. Yes, more work in the long run, who wants to remember to wind their watch twice a day, but so far this seems to be a good solution to keeping time without electricity.

When I first received my kitchen silverware drawer organizer I was excited and couldn't wait to unwrap it and re-organize my drawer. I love bamboo products, as it is a natural and renewable resource, and I find I enjoy the bamboo look in my kitchen. This expandable drawer was going to be a very nice touch.However, upon closer inspection, I noticed it had a coating on it of some sort, and there was a single sheet of product description and cleaning instructions included. On the cleaning instructions, it states that "if the bamboo starts to 'look tired' we suggest to apply any food safe mineral oil to board." I immediately decided to contact the manufacturer and inquire what this was coated with.I was extremely disappointed to find out that this "top quality organically 100% natural Eco-friendly bamboo" is coated with lacquer. It was not specified what type of lacquer, but it wouldn't matter. I wouldn't put lacquer in my mouth, ever, so I won't be using this as a silverware drawer.I was going to give this two stars instead of one, simply for the ingenuity of the design, however, I was able to find a second use for it, and this drawer organizer has now graduated to the garage, and because the sides expand and contract, I was able to add this to one of my cabinet drawers and it is now keeping all my nuts and bolts organized.I realize that staining with natural oils such as walnut oil can be extremely expensive, but if anything, the manufacturer should at least offer a non-coated version so that  buyer can choose for themselves if they want to coat their bamboo with a protective layer. If that option were available, I would give this 5 stars.A coupon code for a free sample was provided in exchange for an honest review.

If you like to cook from scratch, and prefer using ingredients that are fresh, having a quick and easy to grab hand grinder is a must. What I like about this hourglass 2 in 1 salt and pepper grinder, is that it has a very unique look, doesn't take up much space, but keeps a descent amount of raw material ready for grinding.I don't care for pepper all that much, so don't bother with it, but I do use one end for my Himalayan salt crystals, and the other end for my xylitol which I use as a sweetener. The gears area adjustable, so I was able to set them to grind at the fineness that I prefer for each side, and now have a handy tool in the kitchen for quick access to add my two favorite ingredients.I gave it four stars instead of five for two reasons. One, the part that I wish was glass is acrylic. I much prefer glass and would be thrilled if a glass version came out, and two, it would be nice if it came with a hook of some sort that would allow you to hang this on the wall. With out a way to hang it, you're stuck having it take up kitchen space, and although it has a stylish and classy look, it would be nice to be able to hang.For those that care, made in China. (What isn't these days?)A coupon code for a free sample was provided in exchange for an honest review.

2:29 Mins This luggage scale can be used for more than just luggage, the limit being the 110lb capacity, or how much you can really lift.As shown in the video, this unit is very small, fits comfortably in one hand. Pros:Quality appears to be highOptional USB plug to charge other itemsIndicator light to let you know it's doing its thingCord is nice and long (almost 38")Compact, can keep it in your center console or glove boxCons:If you don't have the right iphone, then you only have one USB port to use and a dangling cord that is useless. This is important, as you might end up switching phones at some point, and the permanently attached cord might not be the right size.Overall, I'm extremely happy with this charger. My goal was to use it to charge my kindle. I knew my phone would not work, as I'm one of those that still uses a dumb phone, but my kindle doesn't hold a charge, and my spouse and I like to read to each other during long drives (which we take trips often). So having a way to re-charge the kindle was the goal, which this charger accomplished. I just plug in the USB end of the kindle charging cord to the car charger, and the other end to the kindle, and the kindle indicates it's charging, allowing me to use it.I would like a way to remove the permanent cord that has the plug for the iphone, but it's not that big of a a deal.A free samples was provided in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

In my mind, if you're someone that is storing food for whatever emergency, then you are someone that also cares about surviving an emergency, and to do so, you should be in optimal health. While I realize that our current education system does a horrible job or explaining proper nutrition, there is not a lack of resources to learn such for oneself.With that said, I find that proper nutrition should be included in every food storage book, as that is part of survival. Unfortunately, the recommendations in this book of what you should store are sadly lacking in proper nutrition, especially the vegetable aspect. While you might survive on beans and potatoes, you will not be in the best of shape, nor will you be able to function at your best.I was extremely disappointed that just about every recipe in the beans, soups and stews section called for a large amount of potatoes. That's great if you're a potato eater, but if you choose not to eat them because they are extremely unhealthy for you, then most of the recipes do not apply to you.  The wheat section has many creative recipes, but again, if you eat nothing but wheat, you are depriving yourself many nutritious ingredients. There is no mention in this book about supplementing with a multi-vitamin, which you absolutely would have to if this is all you ate. And the fact that there is not a section in using your dehydrated vegetables, or even canned vegetables, is extremely disappointing, especially since there is a snacks and treats section.If you are a meat and potatoes person, along with lots of bread and crackers and such, then these recipes may do you well, though I can't say if they taste good as I eat just about none of the ingredients from this book. If you are a health nut, or someone who doesn't care to add pork to every recipe, then this book will not work for you by any means. I also have no idea how the author determined the amounts of these foods to store per person. The author actually suggests that you store 40 lbs of sugar per adult! 40 lbs!!! And that's per adult. And how much vegetables should you store? As per family needs? Unbelievable.Sure, this book will help you store food and survive an emergency, but you'll die from a heart attack shortly after.

3:20 Mins This aroma diffuser does a wonderful job or helping to give your home a scent of your choice. There are various essential oils you can use, such as lavender to calm the mood, or even citronella on your porch to keep the mosquitos away. You do not have to use any scenting oils, and can use it as just a simple diffuser as well. However, do note, that this requires power, and does come with a power cord.  So don't let the picture fool you, I did let it fool me, regardless, I'm still extremely happy with the diffuser.Instructions are plentiful, including troubleshooting instructions. You basically open the top by unscrewing just slightly, (a little clumsy at first until you get used to it), then take off the cover. Add water in your measuring cup that is included, then add 3 to 5 drops of essential oil of your choice. Place the lid over the water, followed by the cover which has notches that align with the bottom. This is actually kind of tricky as the lid is very smooth and round, and you have to keep the unit on a level surface once the water is in since really don't want to get water in certain parts of the diffuser.You have a couple indicator lights which tell you the unit is plugged in, and that it's functioning properly (labeled as W and P retrospectively). You also have two buttons, an on/off button labeled as "M" for mist, that allows you start the unit by pushing it once, turn to the second mode by pushing it a second time, or to stop by pushing a 3rd time. The second button labeled as "L" for light, allows you to change the mood light from automatic changing colors (what it defaults to), to a solid color of your choice, or completely off.The machine powers off by itself when it runs out of water, so you don't have to worry about watching it. Cleaning is simple but don't get the power cord wet obviously, and don't use any abrasive cleaners to clean with nor would you want to submerge this under running water. Just use a damp cloth with maybe a little gentle dish-soap. Takes a little bit to get used to opening and closing the lid, but otherwise it's great. I only gave it 4 stars because the box is deceptive and implies you don't need a power cord, which you do need a power supply (100-240V/50-60hz), which is included. The cord is roughly 54-55" in length.It looks very classy and is small enough that it won't dominate any space you might assign to it. Just that darned power cord...As always, I'm happy to answer any questions.A free samples was provided in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

So it should be safe when exposed to outdoor elements.At this point I have no complaints.A free samples was provided in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

I ordered this as christmas gift for a friend of mine who had been wanting a trapper hat for quite some time. When it came in the mail I tried it one to see if the fit was any good. To my dismay it is a bit too large for my average sized heat so it seems that the hat was made for people with larger heads in mine. But I ended up stuffing a beanie in to make it tighter and what do you know that seemed to do the trick. I will just let my friend know that she might have to stuff something in before wearing to make it fit properly. A minor nuisance that I would prefer not to have altogether. The color is true to the one in the picture and the quality is quite great. However, the clip in the bottom is quite terrible and low quality so that is something to definitely mention. I love the suede feel of the hat however and I wish that I would have bought one for myself. In the end even with its nuisances, this is a great trapper hat. If you can overlook the problems that it has, you will definitely be satisfied with your purchase.

* I received a free unit of this device in exchange for an honest review and I want to emphasize that al opinions expressed on this review are solely mine and not influenced by others in any way shape or formLong story short these earbuds for the price were passable for me. The sound was what you would expect it to be from an $15 and under pair of earbuds. The bass is underwhelming which to me was a bit of a disappointment but on the other hand the mids were present and quite decent. The highs were little too sharp for me and did often get somewhat tinny in certain songs. There was a bit of muddiness to the sound overall but not to the point where it made the listening experience bad. These are not bad sounding headphones at all but for an audiophile like me, I tend to want a bit more. For the everyday casual listener who wants a cheap pair of buds, these are great. They are versatile and quite comfortable as well.

* I received a free unit of this device in exchange for an honest review and I want to emphasize that all opinions expressed on this review are solely mine and not influenced by others in any way________DESIGN: The design of this neckband is similar to all the others in the market at the moment. This one in particular does have a little bit of added glitter to it that I did not notice in the product picture on the amazon page. Unfortunately the glossy/ shiny design of the device is still prone to fingerprints like many neckbands out there but of course no one will notice that unless they take the neckband in their hands and observe it themselves._________DURABILITY: The construction of the neckband here is actually a lot better than a lot of the other neckbands that I have reviewed recently. Most neckband have the back are that sits on the neck be quite flexible and flimsy but this one in particular is made of a hard plastic and a lot more rigid. I actually enjoy this design choice because it increases the durability of the neckband itself. The retracting mechanism is an ABSOLUTE monster. Once you click it in place, it retracts the earbuds very quickly back to its resting position. I am very impressed with the quality of the retracting mechanism. Unfortunately for me however, I found that the wires attached to the earbuds are way too thin for my tastes. Whenever I extent them from the housing to increase its length, I am extremely concerned about damaging the wires since they are so thin. They literally feel like they are about to break every moment that I pull on them.____________BLUETOOTH: Connectivity is a breeze and took only a matter of seconds to set up. This neckband has by far been the audio device that has the longest bluetooth range out of all my devices. They even far out competed my $200 Sony XB950BT headset and I even managed to walk around my whole house without having a problem with drops in connectivity. Bass is present although I would prefer it to be a little more punchy but overall it is quite great for the average consumer. The mids and highs are present as well and they sound pretty smooth throughout all the tracks I used to determine the sound quality. There was no muddiness nor tinny sounds when listening to music and overall they delivered pleasant sound._____________CONCLUSION: This neckband has the whole package but with one major drawback. The thinness of the wires is my primary concern as far as longevity and that is why I took off one star. It is such a great headset but I feel this one flaw might shorten its longevity greatly. Please keep this in mind when determining whether or not to buy this neckband.

* I received a free unit from the company in exchange for an honest review and I want to emphasize that all opinions expressed on this review are solely mine and not influenced by others in any way shape or form.___________________DESIGN: The design of this headset is edgy albeit a little generic but I can look over that. It still looks pretty cool and the blue light that emits looks absolutely stunning in the dark. It really is an eye catcher. The top headpiece is comfortable and adjusts to the head size that you have. The ear caps provide great insulation giving comfort to your ears and keeping outside noises out. You can wear these for hours and not have a problem with it. My favorite design choice however is the microphone piece. When not in use, you can snap it into the indentation of the ear cup and it will loo like there wasn't a microphone extension in the first place. Very stealthy and I like it very much. However, the primary concern that I have is the fact that the material is black plastic. These guys catch fingerprints like no ones business so please be aware of that._____________DURABILITY: The headset itself feels really good in the hand. It's heavy and has a lot of give to it. The construction is solid despite the plastic build. The wire is thick and reinforced. It feels good handling the wire because you can really tell that they are really sturdy. I am happy in the durability department and I expect this to last at least a year.______________SOUND QUALITY: For the price this headset is well worth is. I compared these to my $200 Sony XB950BT's and it was definitely a close contender to them. The bass is rich and the vibration feedback (which my Sony's do not have) is an absolute joy when gaming and watching action flicks. The sounds are distinct and I noticed a very faint muddiness to them since I am an audiophile but for the masses, the sound is excellent. My main gripe however with the sound is that the high's can get a little bit too sharp where it kind of hurts my ears. But then again I want to emphasize that for the price, you are going to be getting $100 sounding headphones and by that it is a definite buy.______________MICROPHONE: I had high hopes for the microphone quality so when I tested them out I was a little disappointed. Overall sound quality of my voice over was excellent. My voice sounded clear with no noise or static in the background however the sound was very quiet. I had to speak rather loudly to the microphone and crank it up to 75% to actually hear myself. I know for most people they can change the equalizer but it is just another hassle I would have liked to avoid. As far as background noise reduction it did a pretty good job. I give the microphone a pass but with a little bit of disappointment._______________CONCLUSION: For the price, you are getting one of the best gaming headsets there is. The build is good and the sound is just superb. I can overlook its shortcomings because this is a truly exceptional headset.

All in all you kind of have to sacrifice quality for the price. If that is not an issue for you, go ahead and check this out.

I had been using Nike Free runs for over 2 years and it was high time that i got a new pair of running shoes. I was ready to buy a new pair of free's until I stumbled upon these shows on amazon and fell in love. I have slightly small feet so I am down to buying kids sizes since they cost much less than adult sizes. So I decided to give the new boost foam shoes a try and this is my review:_________DESIGN: What can I say about these shoes. They are definitely a looker. The brilliant electric blue color along with the the well accented black and white really do catch your eyes and the eyes of others as well. I have no complaints about the design. I love the blue and they will be the envy of other runners in the track.__________COMFORT: These are a bit heavier and more restricted in movement than my Free Runs but the flexible upper helps in increasing flexibility even though its not a minimalist shoe. This shoe is more of a hybrid between a minimalist and stability shoe. The ankle area is a but tight for me but I am easily adjusting to them. My biggest complaint as far as comfort goes is that they do end up getting hot in the long runs. Please be aware of this.___________CUSHIONING and PERFORMANCE: The boost foam is remarkably pleasant. It really does feel like memory foam for your feet but as far as making my runs more effective, I found no difference between these and my Free Runs which means the performance is great and definitely worth the price that they are being sold for. And the cushioning of course is phenomenal.____________CONCLUSION: I love these shoes and recommend these if you are considering them. Give them a try.

I had previously tried the Acqua di Gio Cologne by this company from the local walmart and I have to say that impression had great sillage, projection and longevity not to mention it really did indeed smell like Acqua di Gio. However, Abercrombie's Fierce is one of my favorite fragrances of all time so I really wanted to try this out. Needless to say this satisfied my expectations. The fragrance has good sillage, great projection, and 5+ hour longevity. The only downside is that I wish that they offered a 6.7 oz bottle! It is a very good investment of 10 dollars rather than paying about a 100 for the original Fierce.

I sampled this item from the neighborhood department store expcting much out of this since curve fragrances tend to smell great but still be affordable. However, I was extremely disappointed by this scent. The top notes are a more alcoholic version of abercrombie's fierce but then it quickly dissipates into the mid and base notes which are very soapy. Soapy to the point it reminded me of laundry detergent. I don't know about you but I really would not like to smell like that. Projection was less than average and longevity is actually pretty good. The only thing this scent has going for it unfortunately is longevity. Apart from that it's a pass.

The top notes of this fragrance is very putrid in my opinion. It seemed like a concoction of every manly scent out there but not in a good way. However, I found the dry down to be quite pleasant although a bit too soapy for my tastes. Longevity is great for the price you are paying for it and projection is moderate. It leaves a very light but present scent trail. I would much rather prefer Drakkar Noir to this scent and the women that I know who have smelled it agree. It's decent but I would not add this to my fragrance collection.

* I received a free unit for review and want to emphasize that all opinions expressed on this review are solely mine and not influenced by others in any wayI thought I already had tested enough headphones in this price range to know what under 50 dollar bluetooth headphones can offer, but I was wrong. As a user of high end audio products, this unit surprised me for being the best under 50 dollar bluetooth headsets to date. Before this, the Soundpeats QY7 held the throne but these headphones easily dethroned the QY7's and here is why:_________________DESIGN: Design of these headphones is sleek and versatile. They fit almost all workout environments and the structure of the headphones do well to wrap snugly around your head to prevent them from falling off during your intense runs. I do have to point out that outside of the workout environment, they do look quite dorky especially for the younger generation so please be aware of that. I wore them around my friends once at the university and lets just say their comments have made me decide to only use them in my workouts._________________BUILD QUALITY: These headphones were made for the athlete in mind. They can take quite a beating, ample amounts of sweat, and lots of rustling around without falling off your years. The tension around your head is just enough to keep them snug and secure for intense movement but not tight enough to make them uncomfortable. I did however found that after an hour of use, my ears did start to hurt a little bit but that could be just my ears adjusting to in ear buds. Also, the ear cushions on these are a joy to interchange. They come off rather easily and provide no hassle when switching them out. Sometimes I get really frustrated with changing ear buds because they are such a hassle to put back on but these were by far the easiest to apply.____________________SOUND QUALITY: Now here is the ultimate make it or break factor of almost all headphones. The sound quality in these are GREAT for the price that you will be paying for them. The buds provide a great neutral sound with no forms of distortion. Bass is a bit punchy and will satisfy the average joe but not people who want really good bass. Mids and highs are satisfactory and overall I think these are quite pleasant to listen to. There are no harsh notes or muffling sounds. I have been listening to these for the last three hours and I could see myself buying these headphones for a friend looking for a well rounded workout accessory._________________BLUETOOTH: Pairing is a breeze and links up in a matter of seconds and range is quite average.  I have had not had any drops during my testing and am very happy with bluetooth responsiveness._________________CONCLUSION: I love these headphones for the price that they are being sold at. Of course they won't replace my choice headsets but still these are quite impressive. They are now the reigning champion of my list of under 50 headsets/buds and I definitely recommend them for the fitness conscious person on a budget. Great sound, Great Durability, and Great Responsiveness. BengirlxD Approved.

My sister had bought me this box of candies as a birthday present for us to share and looking at the packaging and the presentation of the chocolate pieces, we were hoping that it would taste magnificent and delicious. This is a great summer shoe for men and women (with big feet). It is a canvas style shoe with a design unlike others that I have seen on the market so it will definitely help yo stand out from the large amount of people purchasing TOMS inspired canvas shoes these days. The material is comfortable on your feet and fits nicely. I certainly do love the pattern on the canvas and it complements the designs near the stitching and sole. The shoes is well made and comfortable and the sole is definitely built to last. The design of the shoes reminds me of a cross between classic vans and Toms if you want a good visual. I recommend it especially if you are into unique patterns.

This is a great entry level Turf shoes made by Nike. It is lower priced than most Turf shoes out there in the market but that does not mean that it is bad. With the lower price you are going to have to make some slight sacrifices however. The upper is a bit thicker than the the higher end ones of the hypervenom line is probably the most noticeable difference. The shoes are extremely light, with a great textured pattern on the upper. Overall the design is great and does provide pops of color that other can marvel at. It is durable and will satisfy your casual indoor soccer needs.

Wow this game is actually pretty terrible. This is game a a carbon copy cut the rope clone that has a minion as the monster that eats the candy in the game. Absolutely no effort was given into polishing the game because if the person new anything about minions, their favorite food is the banana so I found it odd that you have to feed it a mint candy. Also the game suffers from severe framerate issues and ads popping in left and right. The animations are incredibly choppy with no attention to detail and the minion sprite looks like a terrible drawing of someone who really wanted to make a quick buck making this game. Do yourself a favor an avoid this game because it is just another ploy to make a quick buck using  ads.

This is pretty much another serving game very similar to diner dash but just as fun. In this games you are both th server and the chef so be ready to multitask. You can tell the makers of the game actually did put a lot of effort into making the game because it is fully fleshed out without annoying pop up adds being splashed into your face every thirty seconds. Levels get harder and harder as the game progresses and if you are a fan of restaurant themed multitask games that challenge your mind nd finger dexterity, you will definitely enjoy this game. Recommend it.

Beautiful watch with a bluish purple dial and time marks that are subtle and elegant. Metal band finish that looks smooth and links of course are easily removable and adjusted to the size that you would like it to be. One thing that I have to point out is that the case size is 41mm and though I would assume that the watch will more likely attract females looking for a watch, take note of the case size. It is quite large and will not fit women or men with smaller than average wrists.

Can mission impossible get any better after having 4 former movies behind it? Fortunately for this series, Tom Cruise is the gift that keeps on giving and that is a good thing. The story is over the top and still down to earth in the typical Mission Impossible fashion, the characters are likeable and overall the action scenes are still heart pumping.It seems that with every iteration of a mission impossible movie, it just keeps getting better and better. This movie in particular had a pretty great story that was easy to follow even for those who are new to spy films though there might be some confusion if someone isn't aware of the former mission impossible installments. There is humor to keep things light every now an then and take a step back from the thumping suspense, and of course the action scenes are still pretty amazing.The actors have really good chemistry between themselves and it really feels realistic. Tom Cruise takes his stunts very seriously and it really does well with selling the intensity of those really dangerous stunts that were done. If you are into action movies, this is a great movie to add to your list especially if you have seen the previous films. Rogue Nation takes bits and pieces of what was great in the previous films and fine tunes them to ultimately end with a bang.As a casual fan of action films, I found this movie to be gripping and entertaining. I definitely recommend it.

Incredibly detailed and well made leather bracelet for men or women with bigger wrists. Please check the diameter of the bracelet before purchasing because it might not fit everyone. It certainly doesn't fit my small tiny wrists but definitely fits my brothers. It is made really well and the dark blue color is gorgeous. The Fossil emblem is quite a sight and the only downside is the price which I felt was a bit too much for what it is. I guess that is the price of purchasing a name brand piece but overall a nice and bold bracelet.

Really awesome Winnie the Pooh print to the classic van design. Pooh bear just pops out of this print and the designs of Pooh bear vary instead of being a single generic drawing copied and pasted everywhere. The only downside to this shoe is the fact that the tan backdrop might not please everyone especially for guys. I love and recommend it.

Classic vans that are comfortable and has good stitching. Lasts for years and you can wear all day long without getting tired. A timeless piece and now with the iconic timeless disney characters. A wonderful addition to any vans and disney fan. I definitely recommend.

This brand is one of my favorite bubble gum brands. It is the shredded kind that you can get at stores and provides succulent juicy flavors that just feel great in your mouth. You definitely can make some giant bubbles with these and overall it is a really good quality bubble come that has lots of fun added to it. I definitely recommend these if you want something that can make huge bubbles.

These are actually a lot shinier than they look here in the product page and a bit more lighter in color in real life. The leather is of good quality and comfortable enough to wear for a couple of hours. I also like the blue accents in the lacing and side of the sole. Overall a good shoe if you like em a bit shiny.
