This fuchsia colored wedge adds a really nice pop of color to a classic staple. I do have to point out that the pink is a little darker in real life than it is pictured here. The buckle adds support to your ankle and the sole has just enough cushion to keep you comfortable for a couple of hours. A nice threaded print goes all around the wedge which I really liked but I do have to point out to be careful with your balance while walking on these. The area around the toes is a little arched so some women may need to get adjusted with the slight wobble. All in all a really cute wedge that adds a touch of fun.

These sandals in my opinion is not for extensive use but for casual beach ware. It has a thin sole that does offer a bit of cushioning but at the same time not enough for it to be comfortable for hours on end. The straps are made of rubber with a nice design to add a little bit of flare but the rubeer too is not comfortable to have stuck between your toes after a number of hours. Overall, if you get these sandals for its intended purpose then it is a great cute sandal with a very nice design. However if you are looking for an everyday sandal that you want to wear to school,these might not be enough.

Inside is another stellar movie created by Pixar animation studio and it centers around a young girl named Riley who just moves to a new town and a new school. And then she begins to have a myriad of emotions due to the fact that she feels alone and friendless and begins to lash out in emotional ways. We then see that inside her head there a personified versions of her emotions that are interacting with one another and how these interactions affect her behavior. As far as story goes, I am going to stop here to prevent any spoilers.The story here is very well thought out and can range from heartfelt to deeply emotional. Pixar create a great movie that not only is funny and attractive for kids, but still doesn't stop itself from becoming extremely thought provoking and serious. There is a message here in this movie especially for kids who are going to start going into their preteen years about what it feels like to be growing up and the inner struggles that kids at the time go through. It is cleverly interwoven to a great story and I personally loved it.The animations here are great and wonderful. Colors just pop and the 3D animation schemes are displayed really well in true Pixar fashion. The cast of characters are greatly designed and overall this is just another beautiful piece of animations that you don't see many animators get does but Pixar does.This is yet another Pixar movie that knocks it out of the park and I encourage kids and adults to watch it together for an unforgettable experience.

My brother got these just couple days ago since these wing tip shoes are in style these days and I gotta say that these actually look pretty sharp. I really like the suede upper material because it feel nice and comfortable without being too formal and giving lots of shine. The sole has a unique texture in the bottom and it does have a little bit of flex to it for comfort instead of being extremely rigid. The heel isn't that big to begin with but it was just enough of a heel to give a nice look. Overall these heels give a really nice look to the wearer especially with chinos or dark wash skinny jeans. If your a guy looking for some comfortable wing tips, I recommend these.

As far as energy I don't think it helped but it has tremendously lessened the amount of soreness post workout and I am doing Insanity at the moment which is famous for making people sore for days at a time. You can definitely benefit from these supplements if you are tired of feeling that your muscle soreness is keeping you from being at the top of your game in later workouts. I feel like one pill a day does just the trick for me but then again I am more on the petite side. I am quite happy with this product!

* I received a free sample of this product in exchange for an honest review and want to emphasize that all opinions expressed on this review are solely mine and not influenced by others in any way shape or formGarcinia is one of those new "revolutionary" weight loss supplements that have been on the market for a while made famous by endorsing celebrities, so when this product came to my door I was rather skeptical of the product. I had consulted a dietitian who is a a lab partner of mine at my university and she informed me to take the product and hype with a grain of salt because it might not work for everyone. So for every meal for the last two weeks I have been using this product to see whether it will work for me.I am a 5'1" person weighing just under 100 punds and to be honest I am at the top of my physical game at the moment. So when I saw that I hadn't lost much weight after taking these, I wasn't very surprised because to be honest, how much can I lose being the weight that I am now. However, I am very happy to say that this supplement really has helped me in my workouts. I have been taking them with a meal before my regular insanity routine and these guys do a great job of keeping my energy levels up. I have a much smoother workout session using these pills and I am really satisfied with the performance I get on my workouts after taking these in. Just for that I am giving these pills 4 stars because if an overweight person took advantage of the workout enhancing effects of these pills, then they would surely lose weight.The only drawback I have with these pills, is that they are incredibly expensive if you are taking them before every meal. Definitely consider how much you have in your wallet before investing in these because they go pretty quickly. Overall, these supplements are a great addition to your workout routine but definitely not replacement. Give these guys a try if you have the spare cash to keep a steady monthly supply.

* I received a free unit for review by Etekcity and want to emphasize that all opinions expressed on this review are solely mine and not influenced by others in any way shape or form. Now on with the review______________DESIGN: The design of this unit is sleek and metallic and does well to fit into any office type environment with an addition of a touch of professionalization in mind. I really like the look of it and it really does give off a premium look to it._______________DURABILITY: The sharpener here has a good bit of heft to it but not to the point where it is overly heavy. It is light enough to be easily carried around, but sturdy enough to feel like it is made of good durable material. There are rubber grips on the bottom that keeps the unit from sliding about everywhere especially in slippery wooden tables and that is a major plus. My only concern in terms of build quality is the fact that the plastic housing that keeps all the pencil shavings can be a little flimsy. For that price that you will be paying for this sharpener, I kind of expected it to be a little bit better in rigidity than it is. Other than that one flaw, the unit is definitely durable._______________INSTALLATION: Etekcity includes a manual with this device but technically there is not need for it. You just plug in in and it works like a charm without any other necessities._______________EFFECTIVENESS: When you put the pencil into this machine you kind of have to actually push in more than the average electronic pencil sharpener. The pencil goes pretty deep into the device but after you take it out, what do you know you have a perfectly sharpened pen. I really like the strength of the blades because it got me a sharpened pen every time that I stuck them in and pulled them out. I recommend only using this machine for pencils however and not crayons and colored pencils because it may break your machine or make it less efficient than it originally was. You can tell this one is only designed for pencil use.As far as the sound, I found it to be a lot quieter than the average automatic sharpener. It isn't too loud and a lot easier on the ears. Another plus to the already great product. It isn't completely silent though. It is loud but it is a lot easier on the ears than many other ones out there._____________CONCLUSION: If you are looking for a heavy duty pencil sharpener, I definitely recommend this guy. As a college student, I need pencils for test taking so it is nice to quickly push a pencil in before test day and have a well sharpened pencil ready. BengirlxD approved.

This game has cool animations and overall good atmosphere when it comes to games but the main place where it lacks at is probably its biggest fault. The gameplay here is very tedious and lacks any sense of depth. You just drag your finger across the screen while these animations happen but most of the time you are just guiding your finger in the surgery without actually doing anything important. So much potential but ultimately a disappointment. Give this game a skip.

So I have never watched Clarence before but I saw that this game app was very similar to this game I played about ten years ago that had the same premise but with Lilo and Stitch and it was very popular with my friends back then. This game is essentially a rebirth of that game but Clarence edition and I couldn't be any happier. The premise of the game is to stack as many desired ingredients as possible to make the largest burger without grabbing any of the unwanted ingredients such as the bombs. Every time you progress it gets harder and harder to stack them up and that is the most addicting part of it. It is a very fun game and I am glad that cartoon network has made a newer version of it for newer generations. BengirlxD Approved.

* I received a free unit of this product in exchange for an honest review and want to emphasize that all opinions expressed on this review are solely mine and not influenced by others in any wayThis phone mount holder is a great accessory to anyone who likes to use their phones as a means of a gps instead of buying a standalone gps. The whole unit is made of a hard and sturdy plastic that seem like it will definitely last a while. There are knobs that allow your to adjust the position of how your phone will look once it is mounted so there is great room for flexibility here. The latches that hold the phone can extend to accommodate an array of phone sizes. I personally used a Motorola Droid Turbo with a protective case around it and the phone fit perfectly with the latches. I do recommend the use of a rubber band to safely secure the phone onto the mount however for extra protection in case there are any heavy jerks during driving.The Suction works really well and lasts even in hot 80 degree summer days. There are times that it will come off due to temperature but I found that using alcohol to wipe down the area and the suction helps in retaining the strength of the suction cup. Overall this is a great phone mount for anyone looking for a holder for their gps needs.

This canvas shoes is of the higher premium canvas shoes out there compared to the much cheaper vans or Keds but there is some differences to these shoes that "Kind of" justify the premium price. The whole shoe is covered in a textile fabric lined with genuine leather accents. The textile here is a lot thicker than the average canvas shoes that you can get for 40 bucks.There is a gold trimmed leather line that appear on the front and back of the shoe to add a little pop to the overall look of the shoe. The sole is a bit larger than the average but provides lots of shock absorbency and it is quite comfortable to wear all day. The heel has the iconic Ted Baker T with the rubber bottom of the sole decorated with T's as well. Overall is a really well built canvas shoes with an adorable flower print. To justify the price however, it up to you and your tastes.

This tote has a really interesting pattern that most young women may be drawn to due to its abstract nature and pop of color. I truly think the color is really nice and adds a bit of personally compared to other totes out there in the market. It includes a small pocket on the side to put knick knacks in but I wouldn't put any valuables in there since it is a button closure. The inside is large and spacious to put whatever it is that you need in there and even includes a zipper pocket to put keys and your wallet in there too. Overall for the price, you are really getting a good tote bag out of this purchase.

~*Contents*~-Acid Reflux Escape Plan Cook Book~*Pros*~-Very Informative-Easy to follow-Effective Recipes-Recipes are sectioned and categorized wellThis cookbook is the perfect guide to really taking back your life if you are someone who suffers from acid reflux and/or GERD. This lead is fantastic because the material around the hand/wrist is soft and malleable to whatever way it is most secure and comfortable for the human to hold. The material isn't just one width all the way around the handle, it's tapered in various spots to make it the most ergonomically comfortable to hold in certain places. I really like this handle over my other leashes that I have to bunch and unbunch in less comfortable ways to get nearly as good a grip on my dog as I do with this lead.

I was a little disappointed with the size of the casserole pan. It holds about 11 cups of water when filled to the brim, but given the need for some space at the top when actually cooking simmering things, it is more of a two quart pot if you're going to avoid spillovers. For a two quart pan, it's not much different in shape, size, or capacity to the largest sauce pan. I would have liked the casserole pan to have been at least half a quart larger. Since the size is so similar to the larger sauce pan, I tend to just use the sauce pan instead of the casserole pan when cooking since it's easier for me to clean the sauce pan with the one handle instead of two on the casserole pan. I feel the 7.9-in casserole is a bit of dead weight in this set of pans.The pans heat up fast and I love the nonstick coating. I don't even need to grab a spatula to help get out things like oatmeal. It just pours right out from tipping the pan contents out. It's just a little thing, but one less step I have to go through in preparing a meal is appreciated. I've had no problems washing these in the dishwasher.

I like how this fryer has a clip on the fryer basket that allows hands-free draining of the fryer basket contents. Often the oil will pop occasionally if I try to hold the basket over the oil myself, so I really like this feature that helps avoid some small popping oil problems. I've cooked tempura shrimp and chicken wings so far and have been satisfied with the results. The fryer is easy to take apart to clean and use. There aren't any unnecessary frill features to this fryer that just add bulk to the fryer dimensions. This fryer is a great size to make dinner for my two-person household.

The product packaging indicates the width to be 5-3/8". The width of the main writable part of the paper of the planner is 5-3/8", but because of the tabs on the paper and the width of the cover, the actual width of this planner is about 5-7/8". This makes a big difference to me as it's just enough extra width to make it uncomfortable for me to flip open this book with one hand easily. To have to maneuver opening and closing with both hands makes it a bit more tedious than I would have been able to manage if the width of the full planner was in fact 5-3/8". My cover split on first opening it into two pieces of paper - metallic pretty paper over cardboard stock. The cover is also too thick to make this an easy flip-through type planner. I like my planners more bendy. You kind of have to handle this like a hardcover book. The federal holidays are not marked in a different color than all the other random holidays listed.

The sweetened condensed milk flavor really comes through in this chocolate. In fact, in my initial bite, I thought I was eating not just plain milk chocolate, but a chocolate caramel since the condensed milk took on a rich sweetness much like caramel. I felt like the taste of the sweetened condensed milk overwhelmed just a bit to make this chocolate a lot sweeter than I would expect of a premium milk chocolate.

I'm having a lot of fun playing with this set with my dogs at low speed. I think if you tried to get them moving at the speeds you need for contests and such, this set would start falling apart since the connections are not that tight and the force of the dog would dislodge things too often, but for a beginner working at beginner speeds, this set works. I actually like the fact the pieces come apart easily so it's easy to pack up when you're done at the end of the day. None of the pieces connect or disconnect in a confusing way. Everything is straightforward so it's quick to pack up when you're done. Nothing packs up in a bulky way either. It's easy to pack up everything in an organized fashion so it fits in the container bag. I took a few measurements: jumping hoop ~16" diameter, tunnel ~24" diameter & ~27" long. I have dogs of different sizes. One dog is too big for the jumping hoop, but the set still provides two other tasks he can perform. Even the biggest dog can take a try at the weaving poles so this set has something for every dog to play at.

I like that the bag material is not bulky. The bag material feels slim and lightweight, but it's still very sturdy. The bulk of the bag is only from its contents. I filled it to near capacity with a load of copy paper from office work, and the bag held up to the weight just fine. Since the bag material is rather slim, I can even fold down this bag when not in use. Though it can be folded and hold heavy loads of paper like my old tote bags, it's clearly more attractive. I love that I don't have to give up style for utilitarian substance.

Living in the Western United States, I always had a curiosity of Old West history, but never got taught much of the history specific to the West in the standardized classroom. For example, my history books skipped over entirely the happenings during the Civil War in the West - we only ever learned really of happenings of the North/South along the East Coast. In this book, I happily read more description of the Civil War in the West than I had ever been able to find in all my assigned classroom history books combined from middle school through university. I also loved that this book seems to pull together all of the photos relevant to the Old West that you've ever heard about but never seen. Some pictures in my classroom history books would only be talked about in words, but the National Geographic book actually shows the pictures that history books never seem to have the space for. The mountain of slaughtered buffalo skulls is way larger than I had ever imagined having only heard of it before this book. If you've ever been frustrated by academic history books' ways of skimming details about the Old West, this book will finally satiate that desire to learn quite a bit more about it.

Of this brand, I've tried the Wolf King and Holistique Blendz varieties. The Wolf King kibble is larger and round. The Holistique Blendz kibble is flat and square. I like the Holistique Blendz kibble for my household since I have multiple dogs - one being very small - and the kibble works for all sizes of my dogs. Luckily, my dogs seemed to like the flavor of the Holistique Blendz better than Wolf King anyhow. I have in the past, selfishly, stayed away from fish flavored kibbles to avoid the humans having to deal with the smell of it, but I don't mind the smell of this fish blend. It's not as pungent as other brands I've bought in the past and I hardly smell anything when I open the bag up for feeding time. I'm glad I can get back to giving my dogs a flavor they clearly seem to enjoy.

These cups hold up well to being used over a long time squeezing them, making the plastic bend inwards, etc. The plastic of these Hefty cups never cracks or feels brittle like cheaper plastic cups. The one issue with these cups is the logo coloring on the outside of the cup rubs off fairly easily once there is some condensation covering it. With the water, it takes a very light rub of your finger for the logo to come off.

The seat is a lot larger than folding chairs I had purchased many years ago. These measure roughly 15" deep and 16" wide. There is no part of my behind hanging off the edges since everything fits on the main surface. The seat is big enough that even when I wish to slouch on the chair, which pushes your rear more forward in the seat, there is still solid surface underneath to support.There is a slight dip in the plastic toward the backside of the seat so it feels somewhat like molded seating. Due to the dip, your rear will tend to slide to the back of the seat whether you want it to or not. It's comfortable to sit in, but I do prefer a more flat surface that makes it easier to sit on the edge of the seat without sliding back. Because you're somewhat made to sit in the back of the seat, it can be slightly difficult for shorter people and children to keep their feet on the ground if that is what they want.There was no wobble to the legs when sitting. Everything felt secure and stable. The leg ends had good grip on my hardwood floors. They didn't scoot around unintentionally when people got on and off the chairs. The legs are nicely unobtrusive. The front legs are well behind where the front of the seat is so when moving the chairs around, the legs do not tend to be a hindrance bumping into other furniture.

Hamster pellet food is twice the size of this dog kibble! It's like grape nuts cereal. I do hear a crunching when my chi-mix eats this food, so he is managing to find something to crunch down on. When I put this kibble next to regular small-dog kibble, however, he always goes for a the bigger kibble where he has something to bite on more easily. My big dogs seem intrigued everytime I pour this down on my small dog's plate. They always crowd around wanting a taste. I use it like a sprinkle topping for my big dogs too to spike their appetite when they seem a little tired of their own food. The flavor seems appealing.

This card has worked smoothly for me shooting panorama shots and quick-succession action photos. No delay issues whatsoever. A simple bonus for me with this card is that it is not all black. The card has a bright green top half to it so it is more visible to me and reminds me when I have a micro SD card laying out on my table and such. I've vacuumed up and lost plain black cards before because I didn't notice it in time. A simple thing like the green strip actually helps a lot.

If you wanted to make an equivalent of this canned food in your home kitchen, all you'd have to do is take a little boiled chicken and rice and thicken up the stock for some gravy. There are no vegetables. My dogs usually inhale any kind of wet dog food, and they had to be prodded to finish this up by the second day. The meat pieces did not look like natural pieces of chicken. They were rectangles cut from a large pan of remolded chicken/liver mash so the texture did not appeal to my dogs. The texture and shape of the straight-sided rectangles also made the meat pieces stick more to the sides of their food bowl so it was not as easy for them to get it out.Overall, my dogs looked a bit miserable eating this diet food. I imagine the same kind of feeling runs through humans when they're faced with a stack of rice cakes.

I like that there are ridges along the ball surface so even my small dog can grab the ball by the ridges and carry it around. The plastic used for this ball is heavier than the Hartz DuraPlay balls, which my dogs love, so it's a little more hurtful for my dogs to get smacked in the face when they miss catching it (sadly, quite often). The plastic is thick and durable so even my Golden can't seem to destroy it, but harder to compress to make the squeaker sound. The squeaking sound is half the fun for my dogs. The Nerf football-shaped dog toy squeaks a bit better since the shape is oblong instead of perfectly round, so the structure tends to give way with less force. I will probably stick to the football-shaped toys since my dogs love the squeaking so much.

This shelf can be set up anywhere. It doesn't hold much weight if you don't have the legs squared against a surface that it can't move so they can't be bent outwards, such as in a locker. If the shelf is freestanding and you try to top it with a bunch of textbooks, the legs will fold out and the shelf will collapse, but by itself it's still sturdy enough to handle a handful of drinks and minor knick knacks for an impromptu meal. It's a fantastic minimalistic, functional design.

It has been an exceptionally rainy growing season this year where I live. Areas in my yard that would normally stay barren soil have sprouted weeds everywhere. I was going out every week to weed where it seemed as if full grown weeds popped up every time in the same spot I cleared just before. I finally decided to try spreading some Preen around, and noticed the areas were not sprouting new weeds. The product works as advertised for me. I've finally been able to take a break from weeding every week. The Preen is great in that it doesn't have some weird color to it, so it doesn't stand out at all in the soil. There's no way you'd notice it's even there so it's not going to make your yard unattractive.

I have a recipe I make often where meat marinates in a rather sugary sauce. Whatever method I use to cook it up, the sugary marinade left on the meat always burns onto the cooking surface and is usually a bit tough to clean up. When I cooked it up on the highest heat on this George Foreman grill, the marinade that cooked off the meat looked burnt on the cooking plates and impossible to get off, but once I scrubbed lightly with some warm water and soap, all the mess came right off. I've never been able to clean up the mess for this recipe that easily before using other cooking methods. It even comes off when I leave the plates for a couple of days before cleaning with the same ease as if I had cleaned it right away when the plates were warm. Between the easier clean-up after cooking and the splatter it contains during cooking, this machine saves me so much time from cleaning in the kitchen.I like this no-handle design better than my older George Foreman grill with handles. The plates come off and on so much easier. You only have to press one button to remove the top or bottom plate and it unclasps both sides for you at once instead of having to deal with unclasping the handles on both sides. I would sometimes struggle with the old design because I would fumble for nearly a whole minute trying to get the plates to line up correctly to where the handle clasps would catch and keep the plates on the grill. These plates line up better, faster, and click into place easier. It also saves on counter/storage space to have the handles gone. The space used up by the machine is nearly all for the cooking surface, not awkward handle space.Having this George Foreman lets me eat the foods I love a lot more often. Before, I would take into consideration how hard it would be to scrub down the kitchen and cooking surfaces, but now I don't think of it as much of an obstacle.

I have a lot of fun playing with this football toy over regular round ball toys with my dog. The football shape makes it so the direction of the bounce is never predictable and my dog gets excited trying to look everywhere at once for it after it bounces up from the ground. This seems to make it more fun to play for a longer period of time for my dog. When I play with regular ball toys, my dog can get a little more bored since it's too easy to know where the ball is going to go. My dog never seems to stop bringing me the football to toss again and again.

It doesn't take much of this to get my dogs' appetites going. I used roughly a quarter of a pack to top ~1.5 cups of dry kibble my dog just didn't seem to want anything to do with. Once I added this on top, my dog ate all the way to the bottom and licked his bowl, and then looked at me for more food. The cap is resealable, so you can easily save the remainder for another day. I also like that the product is relatively thick making the flow rate out of the pouch controllable, so you can squeeze just a tiny bit out over the top of the opening and let it dangle to let the dogs lick at as a special treat.

I love the original Burt's Bees balm formula so much that I'm always eager to try the new flavors hoping there'll be something as good, but there really isn't anything better than the original peppermint. The original balm strikes a good balance between firm wax and softer oils used so it doesn't feel too slick or soft going on, but still feels very nourishing to the skin. Of course the cherry on top being the perfect dose of peppermint oil that gives a nice smell and tingle to the lips.I like the fruit flavors less. The fruit balms are definitely more oily, but they still feel nourishing to the skin, and don't make my lips break out, which happens with some oily-feeling balms, particularly those with petrolatum in it. All the Burt's Bees balms seem to provide protection for a long time. At most, I only have to reapply once for the entire day.My least favorite flavor in the Tropical pack was mango. The fruit essence seemed lost in it to me, and instead I felt as if I was smelling crayon the whole time I had it on.

One of my dogs can be difficult to entice with packaged treats. He generally reacts only to treats of fresh meat, but really came around when I opened this pack of raw boost mixers. It's sufficiently meaty and tasty to have him jumping at my hand for a taste when I have the bag out.The kibble-sized pieces fall apart into a sawdust consistency if squeezed a bit, so it's not the best treat to travel with in case it gets squished, but being able to turn this into a powder does work well for mix-in purposes to get my dogs to eat some less than desirable kibble. If I leave the treats whole, my dogs tend to pick out the raw boost mixer pieces only and still leave the less tasty kibble in the bowl. Since I can turn these into powder and sprinkle it over kibble where it can spread and stick to individual kibble pieces, my dogs are more inclined to eat the kibble the powder is mixed in to.

The headphone frame is all one piece and there is no adjustability to the band or earbud length from the main headband. This makes it difficult to keep the earbuds/headphones placed firmly on the sweet spot that gives me the best hearing. They always tend to slide down after moving my head around a bit. Since the headphone stays put based on pressure against your head, where you place the earbuds really does matter since it is on that spot that all the pressure is placed. If you're forced to deal with the pressure in a spot that is not ideal, these headphones can be more of a pain to wear than they would if they could stay where you placed them.I liked the open-ear feature to these headphones, but the volume is seriously compromised. I never felt as if I got anywhere over 50% the volume level I would have gotten with regular headphones, so these headphones are really only good for casual listening or when you're in a space that's quiet around you to begin with. If you want to really dive into music and hear every word and/or beat, these headphones probably won't work too well for you.

Passing out these treats among my three dogs created a bit of a battle to break out as they tried to steal each other's piece after eating their own. Luckily, there were plenty to pass around to bring back the peace. I liked that these treats worked for my different-sized dogs. The treat rectangle is roughly 1" x .75". The treat can be easily broken by hand along the longer edge in half for me to give to my smaller dog. There was a crisp crunch to the treat as my dogs ate that they seemed to enjoy. As their human, I liked that the treats had no unpleasant odor. It smelled like a simple granola bar to me.

This speaker provided a nice sound amplification to my videos and music over what I can usually hear with my ordinary laptop speakers. I really liked that an aux cord is provided to go into a headphone jack so you can still quickly set up the speaker if your Bluetooth is acting up on your device. I wish the provided cord was longer than 14", however, since the short cord really limits the positioning of the speaker when attached to something like a computer instead of a phone. I also really appreciated the feature that the speaker/sound turns off completely upon closing the cover over the speaker. If there's a reason you need to quiet down things really fast, there's no fumbling around for buttons, simply snap the cover shut.The one negative for me is there are no simple volume control buttons on the speaker. You're supposed to hold the speaker's forward/back button for three seconds to control volume, but it never did work for me that way and I had to change the volume through the actual device the speaker was connected to.

The frame and actual rubber part of the wiper are all very slim - much slimmer than the wipers I've been picking up at the store before. I really like the slimness since it makes it so I don't notice the wiper as much in front of me while in use. It's not bulky, but it's still very effective at wiping off the water droplets.

This is a nice human-quality blanket that I would happily steal from my dogs. It is a single layer of fabric, but the fabric is plush and the edges are finished cleanly so there is no fraying when washed in the machine. The fabric has a bit of a slippery, cool feel to it, so it's better to use this blanket for my dogs during the hot summer days.I like that the bones are not embroidered on with some thread. The bone pattern is just grooves made from cutting the fabric fibers shorter at those points. This makes it so the overall layer is not bulky with extra thread. It feels smooth laying on top of the blanket and you hardly notice the grooves being there at all.

I like sweet/salty combinations and was hoping to get some of that with this salted caramel bar, but the cheesecake bar is so sweet, any saltiness in the caramel is pretty much lost. I would have liked more caramel than the one small stripe down the middle, but the little bit that was there was tasty. The texture reminded me more of a soft cookie with a slight chewiness than a cheesecake-anything. I'm still willing to eat this snack, but it's so sweet I'd probably have it with a cup of black coffee to offset the sweetness of the bar.

This review is for the orange grater with an extra coarse and ribbon grating side.So many times I cook a dish where I need to mince just one clove of garlic and I hate pulling out the cutting board and knife just for the one task (and having to clean it afterward). It is so much easier reaching for the extra coarse grater and quickly making a rough mince with the grater instead. The extra coarse grating hole on the Joseph Joseph is about 1/4" x 1/8". I actually prefer using this Joseph Joseph over smaller grater holes for garlic since I've realized the larger bits of garlic I get with the Joseph Joseph don't really impact my dish negatively anyhow, and I can get through grating faster. The extra coarse grater is also a good size to produce things like shredded carrots. The grating width is just enough to handle the fat end of a carrot, a little over 1-1/4".I like the reversible cover to catch what you grate, but with some fine particles, such as when I grate chocolate and wind up with some dust-like bits, when I stand the grater on end to move everything to the end so I can read the measurement of how much has been collected, the finer bits sometimes escape the cover and make a mess on the working surface. The grater is easy to clean with no hard to reach crevices on the underside.

I like that panning & tilting on this camera actually means the camera face moves around in different directions to get a better view instead of just zooming in on different areas of the same flat picture as some security cameras I've had in the past have touted as their panning ability. There are tradeoffs for that, however, and as a result, this camera is a bit more clunky than some cameras and harder to tuck away into a discrete spot. The camera is not detachable from the circular base, which moves it around, and requires about 3.5" diameter space on a flat shelf. You can also mount the device to a wall by hanging it over a nail head. From the wall, it juts out about 4".The camera is not the best choice if you desire hidden cameras, but it is easy to use and keep maintained since the system is compacted into one device instead of having to deal with an extra base station and cords for other parts of the system. I love the microphone and true panning ability.

I was pleasantly surprised to find the "puppy formula" food was shaped like Cheerios instead of a flat hard disc food pellet. I think the Cheerio shape of the kibble with the hole in the middle of the food disc makes it easier for the food to be broken apart by little mouths. My little puppy visibly/audibly struggles a tiny bit less eating this Cheerio kibble instead of regular puppy kibble that's just solid the whole piece through. I appreciate that little bit of extra thought that went into the design of the food. I don't have to worry about him being turned off from hard kibble due to the fact of it being a struggle to bite down on harder bigger pieces. I can instead worry about ingredients and taste, which my puppy approves of so far in this product.

I love the internal tension spring these wipers have. It doesn't press too hard against the windshield that you hear the wiper drag or squeak, but it gets a good amount of pressure against the windshield so there are no streaks and everything is wiped very evenly. I installed two new wipers on the front windshield at the same time that were comparable in price - this Bosch on the driver side and a different brand on passenger side. The other wiper did not have the same degree of internal tension spring as these wipers do, and I did notice the difference in the quality of clearing the windshield, even brand new. I am almost looking forward to the day the wipers on all the other family cars become hopelessly in need of replacement so I can replace them all with these wipers.

These are large, very hard, thick cookies for dogs. They're so hard and thick, it is extremely difficult to spontaneously break one of these up by hand on the spot to share among smaller dogs. I definitely need a tool of some sort to help break these up. Despite that difficulty breaking them up, I am very happy these are so thick and crunchy to give my dogs something to really chew on. They line up whenever they see me pull this bag of treats out and so far have had no complaints.

I found the taste very mild. Put another way, somewhat bland. This sauce isn't much worth eating on top of chips or pasta on its own. Your eating experience will be improved dramatically if you consider this sauce a mere base for the sauce you really want to eat and tweak it with your own additions. One way I use up my cheese sauce is take about 2-3 cups of it mixed with a can of Rotel tomatoes and use that for nachos, etc. The sauce mixes with other items seamlessly, no separation. It never hardens into an unmanageable lump, it has always stayed fluid.I kept the cheese in the can in the refrigerator instead of removing it to another container. I did like the fact the can seemed to have a bit of interior coating to keep the metal from oxidizing and affecting the taste/quality of the food product. The product lasted about a month before it went bad.

This meat log was a lot harder than I expected. It's like a hard cheese. I cut mine into 1/4-1/2" cubes just fine with a serrated knife. There was some minor dust coming off the ends of the cuts, but the product kept its form for the most part. It is a bit of a hassle to cut by hand, but it really doesn't work any other way. I thought I might see how it would do getting pulsed in a food processor to try to get it to a size something like a small chop or ground meat. The meat roll is too hard for the food processor to chop up so by the time it manages to break up the large bits, the smaller bits that have been shaved off previously by the blade are a fine powder. I like to make my dogs an oatmeal in the morning (1/3 oats, 1/3 veggies, 1/3 meat) - this is a good meat alternative for me to keep on hand for the times I find myself out of fresh meat to serve. These are stable at room temperature so I don't have to use up precious refrigerator space to keep these and they have a longer expiration date than fresh meat so it's easier to hold onto one or two rolls without wasting money. I am happy as long as my dogs seem to like it. So far, they have no hesitation gobbling it up.

This lotion actually absorbs into my skin - it doesn't just smear over my skin and sit on top indefinitely like some lesser lotions. I know this because I can feel the difference when it absorbs vs sitting topically. My ultra-dry skin will tingle with pain when a lotion gets applied but not absorbed. I feel actual relief in my skin when the lotion gets absorbed as with this Eucerin. Besides general moisturizing, it smoothed down some dry scabby skin so it didn't catch on clothes. It absorbs quickly. I feel able to put on clothes and brush against objects without smearing things with lotion just a minute after application. That isn't to say it feels completely clean. There is a very light waxy-coating feeling that takes a little longer to dissipate. A little goes a long way. After using your hands to apply everywhere else, you will definitely feel a greasy build-up on your hands. I liked that with just one simple wash instead of multiple soapy latherings, I was able to get the gunky feeling off my hands.One negative aspect for me was the pump the lotion comes out of. It squirts out a lot at a time. It seems equivalent to some wide-mouth pump hand soap bottles. This is fine if you're applying over a lot of skin, but often I just want a really tiny dab of lotion to cover the back of my hands or some other small spot. Even pushing as lightly as possible to get the littlest amount, I still get too much and have to find other areas to spread the excess lotion. If you want more control over how much lotion comes out, it may be best to stick to the squeeze tubes.

This corner shelf is unobtrusive and has a simple, yet practical design. The front edge of the shelf is set back far enough from the grab bar so that even though you might load things up against the very front of the shelf, the shelf items won't obstruct your hand from grabbing the bar when needed. I like how the shelf doesn't use an overly-tight snap fitting to the metal frame and just requires a sort of soft snap to fit in place. It's extremely easy to remove the shelf portion to clean. The shelf plastic is sturdy and will not bend under the weight of heavy bottles.

The materials used are all sturdy. There is little doubt these handles will last you a long time.The length of the handles and the carabiners do not suit me particularly well. Sometimes the ends of the carabiners smack me in the elbow when I'm getting my band into place.The strap material is surrounded by rubber where you grip the handle. The rubber is fastened to the strap material so the strap cannot move/rotate under the grip material. I think I would prefer the strap material to be able to move underneath the grip rubber since it would be easier to work out bulky bends that form in the strap around the handle as I move my hand/wrist in varying ways.

I am absolutely thrilled with the look of this faucet. All the lines are so smooth and there is no sudden increase or decrease in the girth anywhere. It all changes subtly - it makes me think of the smooth flow of water. I especially like how the handle at the side looks like a small splash of water.I've banged a few pot edges into the faucet while washing, and have not noticed any scratches to the finish. Everything looks as beautiful as new.The one thing I would consider a negative is you cannot lock the spray to be on constantly. You have to press down on the button on the pull-down part for the spray to work, otherwise it reverts to normal flow.

This microwave introduces elements most of us microwave users have not seen before. Besides the usual microwave capability at varying power levels, this microwave has a grill heating element at the top of the microwave which you can use independently of the microwave, or you can use the "Combi" function which uses the grill element + microwave at 30% power. There is a grill rack you place on the regular turntable that stands about 4.25" high so your food is lifted close to the grill element on top. You also get a "crusty plate" that you put food on on top of the rack that gets well-heated to help crisp up the bottom of foods touching the plate.- Cooking with Grill/Combi -One thing to note is you cannot change the temperature the grill element heats to. It doesn't get as hot as I need to get the foods really crisp. For example, I tried the recommended settings for frozen pizza (Totino's) and the result was a very lightly crispy crust - nowhere near the crispness from cooking in the oven. It did do a very good job cooking up crisp fish sticks from frozen. I was very happy with the way they came out. I was moderately happy with how the grill function managed to toast some bread. Though it was evenly browned, it seemed drier than toast out of a regular toaster. The grill element is good for drying things out, such as if making croutons. The grill element is only over the back half of the microwave. The food moves in and out from under the direct heat as the turntable rotates food around.- Dish Size -The grill element juts out about 1.75" from the ceiling of the appliance so there is less room for dishes when using the regular microwave. Your dishes need to be about 7" high or less to fit. The turntable has a diameter around 12.5".- Other Comments -¬∑ There is a mesh lining to the door of the microwave but food is still viewable through it as the microwave cooks so I have no problem watching for spillovers.¬∑ This microwave has a +30 second button to easily add 30 seconds cooking time.¬∑ The ceramic interior retains heat well. I opened the microwave door 40 minutes after cooking something previously in "Combi" mode and felt a wave of warm air when I opened the door. I can see using this microwave as an excellent spot to leave dough to rise.¬∑ The door doesn't open past 90 degrees so it may stifle access depending on your kitchen layout.¬∑ The grill element is not removable and makes cleaning the ceiling above the element a tad cumbersome.¬∑ There is no note on the display nor backlit button to indicate and help remind you when you've pressed the "Grill" or "Combi" button to use those functions. There are days when I am so absentminded that though I pressed a button a fraction of a second in the past, I can't remember if I pressed it or not. Pressing "Grill" or "Combi" is pivotal if cooking with the metal grill rack in place since those settings do not use full microwave power. I would appreciate a reminder so I don't constantly second-guess myself and have to clear/redo settings to make sure as to avoid the mayhem of setting off a full power microwave with metal inside.I am loving the additional capabilities of this microwave. I sometimes wish for more variability in the "Grill" or "Combi" setting, but the settings provided are still useful and help me avoid firing up other bigger appliances to prepare my food.

I enjoy the many textures in this Hello Kitty case. It makes the case more interesting to look at and feel. All the materials used feel high quality. The main outer red covering is canvas, the white face is a furry fabric. Facial details, pink bow, and outline are thread. The "HELLO KITTY" beneath the face is a raised hard rubber. The inside lining is a soft microfiber. A minor complaint I have for the case I received is the white furry face fabric has a few wavy ripples in it that comes from the way it was sewed against the red canvas backing. Either one of the materials was stretched or it was never laid out completely flat against each other before sewing together. The ripples are probably negligible to most people, but can drive a perfectionist mad.This case can accommodate a number of devices within a range of measurements since it uses elastic bands in the corners to hold the device instead of specific snap fittings. As long as your device is close to 4.5" x 6.5", you should be okay. The elastic bands are tight and hold my device very securely. The case allows for about .5" thickness without affecting how the cover will lay flat. This is more than enough for my Kindle and I can still stuff a fair amount of notes in the front pocket without making my case look overstuffed.

I was really pleased with the shade of purple. It's not an overly dark shade that would get lost amongst black cables. Nor is it too light that you would have to call it pastel. It's a true purple for purple-lovers. The shade that shows on my computer screen for the stock photo is pretty true to what I received.The cord quality is as good as I've ever used. The micro B end sits securely when connected. There is no wiggle or unintentional disconnection. The cord feels sturdy but remains pliable.

I really love being able to spot this USB cord quickly when it's running along a handful of other black cords. I have this connected to an AC adapter so I can charge my micro B devices. It's usually laid next to a couple of power cords to miscellaneous electronic equipment but I no longer get confused with which cord is which. It's also refreshing to add a spot of color in something most people are unused to seeing in anything but black.

I had no problem with application. The material is a soft rubber so it is extremely easy to handle. You aren't constantly fighting against it trying to curl up on itself. It readily unfurls from the coil it's packed in and it is easy to get it to stay flat. The material is no more difficult to cut than a bit of thick fabric. The color is unobtrusive. No one ever notices it's been applied, but everybody feels the difference.

I like that these have a bit of raised textured plastic along the side edges of the pick on both front and back. It acts as a bumper and helps to keep my sweaty fingers from slipping off the edge of the pick.

It is a fun novelty to see the kind of things happening around the world at any time. I was expecting more specific events to the days, but a good amount was dedicated to seasonal sightseeing of general geographic locations. Some events also were impractical to expect a visiting tourist to be able to participate in with the locals (fight in a loincloth for holy sticks, anyone?). The reality is the travel costs will keep the average person from checking out more than a small handful of the events noted in this book, but it is interesting to flip through.

This worked well pruning harder stems and branches but when I try to cut thinner fibrous stems, it gets crushed instead of cut.I did not like the opening/locking mechanism at all. It requires you to stick the tip of your finger into a recessed area and pop out a sort of latch. It requires a decent amount of force and is a design made for chipping fingernails. Larger fingers may have difficulty reaching in. Also, once the latch has been opened, on my pruner, there is an exposed wire end that sticks out where it was not trimmed short enough from the coil that winds around the metal around the latch area so it can easily catch and scratch at skin.

I had no problem applying this screen protector. I forget it's ever been applied to my device. There is no weird feeling underneath the stylus I use against the screen and the surface has kept a clean look.

These replacement pads are the same quality as what I received with my Bissell vacuum/steam mop. The fabric is not overly heavy and never feels too clingy against my tile floors, even when it is moistened with steam. The pads hold up well in the wash. After many months, I've never had to trim out strings falling out, etc. Everything has stayed intact.

I am one of few that has never fully seen a Star Wars movie. Of course I am familiar with the images of characters, but knew nothing really of the plot. This book allowed me to skip through and get a general idea of the entire saga without having to commit myself to hours of watching video. I liked that the book focused on details of the fictional plot instead of being bogged down by trivia of the real world actors, etc. There is a little of the behind the scenes stuff, but not enough to distract from the fictional narrative.I appreciated that the book wants to give pictures of the many fantastically imaginative creatures and locations of the Star Wars universe, but was frustrated with how small the inserted pictures of such things were. The picture inserts were no larger than .75" x 1.5" at most. For items that are made to show off creativity, you could not make out any detail in the pictures and at times wondered why bother inserting the pictures at all.

This is a really nice Logitech speaker system.1. What's in the box?:  You receive the speaker system.  This is a three piece system consisting of the subwoofer base, control system and the two speakers.2.  Aesthetic?:  The system is nice looking, but larger than might be anticipated.  Unlike the other two systems I have previously used, the system is not huge, but is aimed at providing sound towards the front.  The speakers system are not huge, but are not small.  This is a nice looking  system.3.  Use?:  This is entirely easy to set-up.  Simply plug the system together, and the system uses a headphone jack plug for a output.  The control panel is a big improvement from a previous system.  Why?  This is because my previous logitech system had a simple on/off button and a side dial.  This system uses a dial for volume control.As to the sound, it it quite good and there is lots of volume.  The sound is not the best speaker sound I have heard, but measures up quite well to superior computer speakers - surprisingly so.  The sound provided is quite loud as well.  In fact, the sound is so much, I do not havr to turn up the speakers very high to get lots of sound.Overall?:  This system is ideal for a simple solution for adding good sound to a computer or other system easily.  Since the output is just a jack, I would think any system could use this speaker system.  On the other hand, the decision is whether you require lots of sound volume.  If you don't require much sound, then this might be too much sound.  On the other hand, this provides lots of good sound.  The decision is whether the price point meets your need for a good system and very good sound.

This is a good basic cover for the Samsung Galaxy S5 (previous version of the Samsung phone).  Since this is Otterbox, the protection is expected to be good and tough. From that standpoint, this offers good protection.  The bumpers are adequate and are, in this case, a nice red color.The version I received has red bumpers, and is clear.  I understand there are covers available, if desired.  The cover has a nice lip on the front to protect the front screen.  I tried this, lightly, to drop this on various surfaces and there was no problem.  I did not purposely try this on straight concrete, but this does seem that it will provide protection if dropped on the corner or on the front.I like the cover.  I will state that one design flaw is tactile.  Since the read is clear, the back is slippery.  As well, the sides are slippery as well. From my perspective, it would be better of the sides had more tactile response (i.e. not as slippery).  This would this  great choice rather than average.This is by no means a bad cover at all.  It is good, not great.  I think if this was more non-slippery, it would be great.  Protection is certainly Otterbox, this will not break it seems.At this point, 3.5 stars with more use continuing.

I am old enough to remember Burt Reynolds the movie actor, though the era when his career was near it's zenith and decline.  That being said, he has always been an interesting fellow.This book looked interesting.  It is.  Though this book is organized as a series of vignettes of about various people Reynolds has worked with and encountered.  For me, knowing many, of not all of these people, it was really interesting to read through these pages.  Reynolds does not really pull punches, and this makes the book as honest as I could probably expect.  There are more than a few surprising people in the book I was not expecting.This is not a conventional biography, and those expecting such a read will be slightly disappointed.  On the other hand, after reading through various sketches, I really liked the narrative and ended up enjoying the book.A really interesting read, worth the time.

This is a really interesting backpack.  First off, this comes in a neat little package.  This is the neat part. You can use this for a little storage, or open the zippers and a nice backpack opens up.The backpack that is revealed to be a regular backpack.  This means the backpack has two nice straps (with some lining), a main compartment, plus a smaller compartment, the outer pocket (described above) and two side enclosures that can be used for water.In other words, you can pack this away in your luggage for a trip, and if you need a daypack for use, this is definitely the thing to get.  You can easily store all the things you need for such a trip like a pull-over, camera gear, an whatever.I was somewhat skeptical about this item.  But the build quality shines through easily, with good construction, good zippers and an overall nice build.  This is a great little item. Easy to carry, easy to pack up again into a nice little package.All the positive reviews are not wrong.

These ar.e basic wood hangars.  I bought these primarily based on price and previous good reviews.  I got 20 of these well packaged and ready to go.My main concern is basically whether these will last, are able to handle some weight and also the surface is smooth such that more delicate clothes.  These are not the highest quality hangars I have seen, but they are finished well enough.  If I was hanging some delicates like silk, I would recommend using  better quality hangars.  This is not because these aren't good enough, but rather because there are not really meant for delicates.  However, for most items, these will work just fine and do the job.

This item is a compact USB charger for a car.  The best two aspects of this charger are the small compact size and the neat design with the band of color rather than the simple point of light.This charger comes with a USB Micro-USB charger for Android phones and similar, although that is irrelevant because the cable is detachable.  Plus, this charger has two ports.  One port is a regular port, and there is a second quick charge port.  When the unit is charging with power, here is a nice blue glow around the band.  I like this touch a lot.Charging is easily done and without any problems.  I tried this with both micro-USB and Lightning cables as well and had no problems.For the money, this is compact, nice-looking and squat and does the job.  Worth the money for the easy use.(I received a sample of this item in return for an objective review, which I have provided).

This is a Lenox ornament that is shaped like a heart and has the word LOVE on one side.My first concern is whether this would be worth the money being charged for the item.  In this case, this appears to be a quality item used infrequently (during the holidays of course) and whether this will last.  On this score, I think so.  Provided no one drops this on the floor, this is going to be around a while.The ornament itself is pretty large, with the heart being probably the size of a hand palm.  It is larger than expected.  The words are printed in gold leaf (or something else resembling gold leaf - pyrite?) and it is nice looking.Overall, this is a neat looking ornament, appropriate for the season and considering the overall quality, designed to last for more than a few seasons.

I enjoy musicals both live, although I attend infrequently, but also from an affinity for the classic film musicals as well.  So, I thought this would be a great book both because of the subject material and because DK rarely disappoints.I was not wrong.  This a spectacular book.  Colorful, informative, well printed and a really expansive book.I am not enough of an expert to suggest whether the choices are the best ones, but from my perspective, these are mostly the obvious choices.  Whether the choices are definitive, that is a matter of view.  From my perspective, there really wasn't much missing here.I am really enjoying looking through this book, and am finding the combo of Broadway musicals, film musicals (including through the present) and bios of influential figures is great.  Plus, the pages list the songbooks and placement in a neat graphic as well. Sometimes standards are from musicals and I didn't even know it.  It is pretty neat to look through and find the music here.If you like musicals or know someone who does, this is a great book.

Nice ornament.  Lenox is a good brand so I was excited to try out this item.  Obviously it is a bit before a tree is available.  However, this is a nice looking ornament that will last unless it drops onto a hard floor.  The angel is about palm size (perhaps a bit smaller) and is held by a gold twine line.This is a nice looking ornament that will last for a long time.  It costs about 10 dollars, but this isn't bad for a good porcelain ornament that is expected to last for years.  I love  it.  I can't wait to hang it up in a few weeks.Nice.

These are liners for a refrigerator that could really fulfill a good purpose, which is to put a nice liner in the refrigerator.I received the version of this in red.  At first, I thought this was going to be too bright.  But this red is really, really nice.The liner can be cut to size and this is easily done with a good pair of scissors.  It appears that the liner can be washed, and while that it true, I would only wash this by hand in the sink.This is a really good product that fulfills a good need in showing a liner that is better than just having something.  This helps a lot.  I cannot speak as to whether this prevents bruising of fruit, but this does provide a nice item for the fridge.

Who can't use a bunch of cups like this?  I was offered the chance to try these cups.  I am not a fan of the university team I was offered, but who cares?These are well made cups that can hold beer, or whatever else floats your boat.  They work, and are good basic pretty tough cups.The team logo is a cool idea and I hope more teams are offered.  They work for all kinds of things and are cool!^^^^^UpdateGreat cups.  I also received University of Michigan and University of Tennessee.  The logos are wonderfully reproduced these are a great party idea.  Cool item!Good luck.

Well, I really like my Brother printer.  However, I really dislike the cost of the high-quality but certainly very expensive Brother cartridges.This brand was not known to me, but I took a chance.  Considering the cost, the print quality is very good and it gives more than enough copies so that this is an excellent alternative.  A very good choice.

This is an item that may appear to be redundant.  However, upon receiving this item and using it, I am really impressed.First off, this box is a lot smaller than it may seem.  It so about the size of your palm.  It appears well-made and secure.  The box has some weight to it.  This is not a battery pack, so it must be plugged in.  Once plugged in, this box has 6 ports for charging items.  The 6th port is a quick charge port identified by the blue USB chip.I immediately used this on various items including three IOS devices and an Android device.  My first impression was that the items certainly did charge faster than the default USB ports.  This was especially true of the Ipad, which really charged very quickly.  The box handled the items very well and it did not feel hot after some hours of use.  That is a huge plus!I was really skeptical about this item at first, but I find myself wanting to use this instead of the Apple bubble for sure.  Secondly, I haven't really found this to get hot after charging items which is another huge plus.I can think for multiple items that need charging, whether cameras and associated equipment or for a family or simply something that allows 2 or more items to be charged this is a great little item.(Note: I did receive this item in exchange for an unbiased, objective review). That being said, this is a great little item!

First off, these are really cool-looking swim goggles with the reflective design on the lens and the neat black appearance.  these goggles feel like a quality piece of hardware.Second, the important thing beyond the great looks is the performance.  Here, these googles have a great and comfortable fit on the lens with a nice silicon pocket. That is I had zero problems fitting these on my face and getting a excellent seal. Plus, the googles are really comfortable as well. Moreover, the goggles have a nice comfortable fit.  The band is a nice feeling silicon as well and the dual band system is easily adjustable.  However, there is a nice plug that allows the user to simply remove the plug and put the goggles around the head without having to pull these over the head, which would be really excellent for a female or those with long hair.Use?:  These are very nice goggles.  There are not competitive use goggles, but for daily swims, or for recreational use, these are really an excellent choice.  The lens are nice. I am not sure about anti-Uv protection per se, but the use is easy and the seal provided by the excellent lens rims are fantastic and eliminate much water coming into the eye socket.Overall:  Although I was not previously familiar with this manufacturer, I am very pleased by the quality construction and the easy use of these goggles.  Water does not easily seep into the eye socket, the wear is easy for most work-outs and these look great.Great item.(I did receive a pair of these goggles in return for my unbiased, objective review).

This is a good read if you have an interest in animals.  The author is a vet in San Diego, CA.  This book is about her life, her path to becoming a vet and about how animals have a transformative power.This is an easy-read and a very good read. I really liked the book and I didn't necessarily learn anything, but I did enjoy the stories.

Thule.  Probably the first thing that used to come to my mind is the great bicycle racks and similar items for kayaks and whatnot.  However, after buying and trying a few different backpacks, this company also makes excellent backpacks as well.This item is called a 'daypack' and it certainly is.  Why?  Because this item is fairly small in comparison to other Thule packs available.  This doesn't mean it isn't good, it juts means that it is smaller than most.First off, I received the 'Miami Dolphins' color scheme.  Okay, this has nothing to do with the Dolphins, but this pack is teal with orange accents.  It looks great, but it is not subtle at all.The quality of the item is terrific.  I was impressed how well things are put together and the little touches that exist.  Now, this is said to be a 21 liter pack.  Inside it has a main area with a small seperate pack area for pencils and other little items if you need that.  As well, there is what is called a crush-proof area for glasses and phones and the like.  There is no separate reservoir area for a waterpak in this model.There are some side areas and the back of the pack can be used to slip in a jacket or something similar.  There is also a nice small rear pocket as well.Since this is a real daypack, there is enough tight room for a small netbook or Ipad and similar items.  The pack itself is again not really built for long hikes, so the straps are nice, but this doesn't have lots of padding for items you might use on a long trip.  I do really like that you can slip water bottles on the sides as well.This is an excellent dapypack for a trip around sightseeing on a trip or similar type journeys.  In fact, it is pretty ideal for such a trip and just about perfect.  This is to lug around stuff for short trips and to do it easily.  Other more involved journeys would require a larger pack and this isn't suited to the job.Yes, this is an expensive item, and I might look askance at the price given the function.  On the other hand, this is the kind of purchase that will last forever with minimal care as my other Thule items have shown.  So, in this sense it is money well-spent.  Well-spent if you understand you are getting a daypack!Great item.

This is another Amazon Basics product, in this case a lightning cable for Apple products.The question for a purchase is whether this is worth buying instead of the full-priced official Apple item.  Here, it seems that this is worth the purchase.The cable itself is quite robust, especially with the cable connections.  In other words, at this point, it doesn't seem that the cable will simply fall apart and be pulled with consistent use. It feels robust.The cable works, feels like it will last (can't specify this quite yet) and it looks like a quality product.  Nice.

This book was right in my wheel-house since the book discusses classic films and World War II.Mark Harris has written a book about a subject that needed to be written.  The five directors discussed here were well-known to me as a film buff because they all made some of the greatest films of all time.  I was also generally aware that all these directors had made various films in advancing the Allied cause.The five directors, Wyler, Stevens, Huston, Wyler and Capra all made pretty incredible films (incredible in the sense in these films are still watchable today (thanks youtube).  The narrative here is largely about Hollywood and the reaction to the buildup to war and then how the government, military and Hollywood moved forward to produce films and documentaries showing the Allied war effort.The risks that were taken are hard to be believed.  Wyler flew bombers to bring us the story (amongst others) of the Memphis Belle, for example.  Stevens entered the Dachau death camp and recorded such horrible scenes that those who saw the raw film were not only sickened but believed they had been there themselves such was the immediacy of the film.Overall:  I really liked this book a lot.  I ended up buying Harris' other book about the 1967 Best Picture nominees.  For those who enjoy stories of Hollywood (actual Hollywood - not the simulacra that passes for it now - with moguls, strong-will directors and stars) and enjoy watching TCM, then this is a must read.  Those interested in World War II may be slightly disappointed only because this is not really about World War II military history, but still worth reading, especially of you have seen the various films made by these directors (and again most are readily available on the internet).  Imagining actual combat being shown during the war and the horrible aftermath must have been a shock to the sheltered American populace during the war.  It is discussed here.A recommended book for film buffs for sure, and those interested in knowing more about the war effort.

This was not initially a book that I wanted to read because I am pretty familiar (I thought) with the three generals discussed here.  But I went ahead and read this book anyway.The author, Winston Groom, is the author of numerous books including Forrest Gump, which was a work of fiction.  However, what I didn't know was Groom has written a number of popular works of history and these have typically been well-received.The narrative here is about three important generals.  George Marshall, George Patton and Douglas MacArthur.  What I really liked about this book is the approach of discussing their biographies and their background before the Second World war even broke out.  I learned or was reminded of all kinds of interesting facts about these men.  MacArthur grew up on the plains with his father fighting the Indian Wars, Patton fought in Mexico, and all kinds of interesting little facts. Plus, I loved the discussions of the Mexican-American War, and World War I, plus the inter-war period.  There was so much history that was covered that is not part of any general discussion anymore.  For example, I learned about the bloodiest battle of American history - the Battle of the Arne forest - in which 27,000 Americans were killed.  There are lots of discussions of this kind of history in this fine book.Groom is clearly an excellent writer.  Why?  Because I read a significant portion of the book (the book is about 450 pages) without being cognizant of it.  This is an excellent general lay-readers history.  It is not the excellent Manchester book about MacArthur, nor the D'Este book about Patton. This book doesn't have to be, but those are excellent books about their particular subjects with lots of detail.  I only indicate that this is not a detailed work of biography aimed at those wanting a detailed read.  This is a work of general history that should appeal to a very wide audience that wishes for learning about these men in context of the history they lived through.Groom has given the book footnotes which is a good approach and gives the variety of books consulted.  As well, there is a generous number of maps (and there may be pictures but I reviewed an ARC so I can't state that definitively).Overall?:  There is a lot to like here about this book and narrative.  Groom is a good general historian and brings a very good approach to his subject.  I read through this book quickly and enjoyed it thoroughly. Well recommended for a general audience.

First off, this is a modem.  A basic piece of equipment absolutely needed, but basically it is like getting excited over a car axle when you have a car.That being said, this should be compared to two popular modem models that you can buy on Amazon.  Both of those I have actually tried and work well.Here, this modem is quite small.  Much smaller than the other popular model, this is about the size of a paperback book.The inputs are the ones expected.  The power adapter and the wall blister is one input, with the ethernet cable and cable connection being the others.Set-up:  Similar to other modems, you usually have to call (as I did) the provider and give them the MAC address and similar to provision the modem.  Then the modem is synced and should work.  This shouldn't be an issue with the provider but may depend on the carrier as well (Mine was certified for use by my provider however).  Once this is all done, take the ethernet cable and plug it into your router system.Use?:  This provides good speed and seems stable.  I can't really comment as yet as to overall performance, nor can I give an assessment as to long-term use.  But, I will provide an update(s) as I continue use of this item.  At this time, this modem, and TPLINK seems to have increased the quality of its items significantly.Overall:  So far, easily worth the money based on not leasing it from a provider.  Secondly, the items seems like a quality build as well.  Updates to be provided with more use.  So far, good speeds, no real heat with the number of open vents this has, and I have has a steady connection, stable connection.

In received the opportunity to review this item.  I like the concept, and the execution is pretty darn good so far.1.  What's in the box?:  You receive the headphones, plus instructions and extra earbuds and ear plugs of various sizes.2.  Aesthetic?:  Well, first off, these are not headphones like I am used to because there run with Bluetooth and therefore have no cable running to the phone or other device.  So, these are functional items and therefore aren't really designed for looks per se.  However, these look well enough and the yellow hints here and there are nice enough.3.  Use?:  First off, after removal from the package, I like to try to use items without instructions.  This worked easily as I only had to press the control bud and the earbuds activated. The connection with my IOS phone was easy through bluetooth.  I heard verbal confirmation and everything was set.The first thing I did was listen to music.  The music soundstage was good, not great.  Therefore, I began to play with the various different earwings for inside the ear and different plugs.  The sound is good, not great.I downloaded the Jabra app and this provides a real in depth workout coach.  There is way more here than, say, Runkeeper os similar.  I am still working through this app and its application.  This app provides cadence for running or walking and other verbal clues for enhancing a work-out.  This app seems to provide a lot of support for various exercises and is something that appears to be very good.  (I will update this as I continue to try out the app during work-outs).  By the way, charging is done by moving the silicon cover and placing the micro-USB port inside.  Battery life is supposed to be about 5.5 hours, and this seems pretty accurate.  I must mention I love how I can listen to music while working out, and take and make phone calls by manipulating the control bud.  This is a great item for a busy active person.  Plus, I love the Bluetooth connectivity.  No more cable pulls and problems.Overall:  At this juncture, I really like the bluetooth connectivity.  This is terrific for an active person because no longer do you have to deal with the cable getting tangled during a work-out.  The app appears after some use to be useful.  This model does not have a heart-rate monitor (though personally I use another item which has this feature - if you don't be cognizant of this fact).  On the other hand, everything works well and easily.I wish the sound was better and more live.  The sound is not loud enough, which is okay for certain applications, but in some ways is disappointing.  This is a high quality item, clearly, and I have enjoyed using it thusfar.I am giving this 3.5 stars so far, it is probably 4 stars but I will update this with more extensive use.  There is A LOT to like about this item, however.

I was offered the chance to review these Wrangler shorts.The shorts themselves do not have any d-ring, so that picture I saw is inaccurate.  These have an elastic waist so that is a nice feature.  As well, the material is a lightweight canvas feeling.  These are relatively inexpensive shorts, and they are not the nicest shorts I have ever had.  However, these shorts are a good value for the money.  The matierial is lightweight, but tough.  There are the cargo-like pockets and these have velcro pulls to open and close.The shorts feel is true to size in that the waist is pretty close to what it should be.  The elastic provides a good cinch, but not too tight.  The feel is nice, but not a luxurious feel that might be offered by more 'cotton' shorts, for example.I have worn these a few times, and like the shorts.
