The feel is basic, but the shorts seem like they will last.  For the money, the quality is excellent.

I was familiar with the author and his father, as they both have written books about the Civil War and World War II.  I am a history buff, but I have never really read much about the Civil War itself.  This book, which is part of a series, and is really about the end stages of the war looked intriguing to me for a variety of reasons.First off, this is what I would call a massive novel.  It is really not a quick beach read over a few days.  But what is here is well worth absorbing.  What Shaara has done has taken both the federal side, from the general (in this case Sherman, down to individual soldiers and done the same for the confederates.  The reader gets the perspective of what was happening from the end of Sherman's March to the Sea, and the pursuit of the confederates through Georgia and the Carolinas.The book does not really require extensive (or really any knowledge of the end stages of the Civil War.  Yet, I did fell inspired to look to the internet to see how the end came for the confederates.  The book does a good job of taking the reader through this period and does so in a convincing manner.  It took me a bit of reading to 'get into' the book, but the narrative is more than compelling enough to have kept me reading through.  This was personally a fascinating bit of history for a variety of reasons, and Shaara has enough characters to be able to relate the story very well.Worth reading.

This is another book I was inclined to want to read through about how Navy Seals are put through their paces and are able to speak to accomplishing goals.Of course, this book discusses a variety of battles in Iraq as illustrations of dealing with various issues while trying to accomplish various goals.What is interesting about this book, and the others in this genre, is that the authors are typically able to relate the discussion into a larger point of leadership.n here, the authors do a nice job of doing this frequently.This book has plenty of discussions of battles in Iraq that should capture attention.  But, the larger points of leadership, group ethics, accountability and the like are also well discussed.  This book is well worth reading on leadership and is also an exciting read as well.

The Wright Brothers are such an inspiring story, an inspiring American story.  I recall reading in awe of their efforts as a kid, and the discussion of their efforts in the age of invention along with Edison and others at the turn of the century.  Truly, I am astonished about how they applied ingenuity to their efforts and designed something so brilliant and yet something so simple, like many great inventions.The great writer David McCullough has written a relatively short (for him) biography of these two brothers, their family,  and their amazing invention.This was a book that I blew through in just a few sittings.  This is not a boom fills with technical details on the engineering or the flights, so if that is what you want look elsewhere.  Instead this is a story of how this family invented something we take for granted today.As with most of McCullough's books, this is a well-written account of history that you may know something about, but you will still learn a lot and enjoy it thoroughly.  I would recommend getting the hardcover version for the many fine and well-printed photographs in the book.Well worth reading and recommended.

I have read a few books by Robert Reich and generally enjoyed them.  His book "Locked in the Cabinet" is probably one of the greatest expositions on serving as a secretary (in his case in Secretary of Labor during the first Clinton term) and dealing with a government bureaucracy as exists.  Moreover, his book The Work of Nations was also a very interesting book about how the economy was changing on the 1990's.  And, a lot of his descriptions have turned out to be accurate.  Of course, I also read a book he wrote on the 1980's about how Japan was going to rule the world.  That book was a product of it's time and was pretty incorrect in many ways.In that context, I was offered the chance to read through and review an advance copy of the book.  If you have an interest in economic issues that is aimed for the general lay-reader, this is a valuable and interesting read.  Reich's critique is aimed at showing how the American landscape is changing in ways perceptive people realize or perhaps don't realize.  This includes the real implosion of the middle class, the rise of tremendous economic inequality and the changing American economy.In addition, Reich discusses the financial system as benefiting the investment class and the idea of the rigged game.  Finally, Reich offers ideas on how to counteract this system that he believes is failing the bulk of Americans, such is raising the minimum wage.Now, personally I would agree with many of Reich's descriptions and I enjoyed the narrative.  But, I largely disagree with his prescriptions on addressing these issues.  But, I think if you disagree with Reich (and he is often skewered), this is still a worthwhile book.  It isn't 800 pages (a very manageable 200 + pages) and I still was challenged and learned things.Overall, this is a valuable read and a good critique of what certainly is affecting the economy and how a large segment of Americans are suffering.

I previously tried another type of dog food from Honest Kitchen for dogs.  I thought my dog really liked that type.  Here, this is a similar type of food and here my dog had a similar reaction.This food is turkey and parsnip plus other items.  The food is essentially freeze-dried and offered so that you simply add water, or I have added the food to dry food as a supplement as well.  As with any food, my dog did not immediately react as if this was a great addition.  However, after a few tries my dog did respond and seemed to enjoy the food (although it does seem that the dog prefers the other flavor more).  Though this is alleged to be human-grade, I didn't try it myself.  But, perhaps in an emergency, it is comforting I could eat it. I am not planning on it!The bag is sufficient for a number of meals and this manufacturer really does seem to be cognizant of the ingredients.  Therefore, there is no filler or unnecessary grains or other such stuff that lesser brands put in.  Also, this is made in the US and apparently does not utilize anything from non-American sources.Therefore, this is a good value on several fronts.  Also, I think that this is a great item to carry on hiking trips because you can carry this food and simply add water to give your dog a good meal that isn't as heavy as carrying around kibble or cans.Overall, this is another very good product from this company.

The new rage (and in many ways this is a positive thing) is the way of the Navy Seal.  No, this trend is not about becoming the next warrior, but it is about the various leadership techniques that the Seals seem to impart.That being said, this is not your usual book written by a former CEO, but rather by a former SEAL.  Therefore, the leadership discussion involves dealing with issues like accountability, team, ethics and other items which are about how to advance a group towards completing a goal.The book has plenty of discussions of various 'adventures' in military objectives that provide learning lessons.What I appreciated about this very well-written book is the various discussion about how these warrior teams accomplish goals.  The book IS inspiring, and besides implementing these techniques in a professional world, these are items that also are helpful in a personal context.I greatly enjoyed this book, I felt inspired by the stories told, and the leadership techniques are very useful.  This is not the only book I have read in the genre, but everyone I have come across is helpful in its own way and that should be instructive on its own.

I am a huge fan of Sennheiser headphones and have purchased this brand for a while, including a previous iteration of sport headphones.This headphone is for sporting activities such as running, hiking, walking and the gym.  The particular model I tested was for Iphone and IOS based systems.1. What's in the box?:  You receive the headphones, which are wrapped up and ready to go, plus instructions in multiple languages that are really graphics-based, plus a attachment clip and a really useful mesh bag.2.  Aesthetic?:  Since there are designed to be for sport, these headphones are really designed to be sporty.  Therefore, I received the jaunty grey, white and mint green version.  As far as the design, there are really quite nice looking and feel like a quality construction.  The cord is green, which in my mind helps with night identification along with rear headband which is white and is probably reflective (though I cannot confirm this at this moment).These headphones look like what they were designed to do and look nice.  I like the chrome touches inside the earbuds as well!3.  Use?:  Well, my first impression was the flat cord which is a good length for putting the phone in the pocket while doing activities and it is long enough for even taller people (though not NBA types).  The cord is tangle-free apparently, and it appears this is accurate.Fit?:  I suppose I have regular dimensions because I found the fit to be comfortable and fine in terms of placing the band around my head and putting the buds in my ears.  There is a slight pinch, but I found this to be minimal and not the worst I have experienced ever.  However, of you are very sensitive to having even the slightest pressure around your head, you may want to try a different approach.Overall, I found the fit to be more than adequate and to my mind necessary to ensure the headphones don't just drop out during use.  I haven't experienced the idea that this becomes painful, but perhaps others might.Sound?:  I consider myself sensitive and wanting good sound.  On the other hand, I also consider the standard Apple headphones pretty adequate for sound so judge my opinions accordingly.  Here, these are sport headphones, so I want good basic sound, but I do not want isolation because that could be dangerous.  Moreover, these phones are not for an audiophile experience.I tried the sound out using the music on my phone and Ipod.  I found the overall music quality to be more than adequate.  By that I mean I found the quality to be pretty excellent with most every form of music considering the purpose of the headphones.  The music sounds live enough and on listening to music without activity, the quality is pretty excellent considering.  I would expect that the phones require some burn-in period and I have not reached that yet (some hours of listening) but based on initial listening experiences, the music is well-distributed.  There is not a excess of bass (hip-hoppers and metal-bangers should look elsewhere), but rather a pretty good balanced approach to the music without moving into the audiophile category.IOS controls?:  The controls here work well for the IOS system.  I found no issues with manipulating the music and voice control in whatever method I wanted.  The instructions were pretty clear in terms of the various button presses, but if you have used these controls before, the responses are pretty standard as here.Overall?:  My only concern about these headphones are given the price.  Sennheiser is probably the best brand I have found for headphones (though Klipsch and others are very good as well) so the quality seems like it be present.  However, these are might expensive.  There is one cable point with the tangle-free cable to the left ear and everything seems like it is built robustly.  So, this is a choice of price point. On the other hand, since the active headphones are typically a purchase needing some quality, this is not way out of line.On the whole, these are an excellent pair of headphones.  I will update this review as I continue to put the headphones through their paces with lots of exposure to tough conditions.  So far, I would be very happy if I had purchased these phone,  It appears that there is a good balance between sound and use.

I was not previously familiar with this brand.  Upon receiving this case, my impressions were that the case is very nice, robust and can take some damage.1.  What's in the box?:  You receive the case and that is about it.  There is no screen protector.2.  Aesthetic?:  The looks of the case are quite nice.  This is a two part shell, with a tough silicon inner protector and then the external second shiny plastic shell.  The item looks nice, to be sure.3.  Use?:  Placing the phone into the inner shell is quite easy.  Since it is silicon, it just slips into the shell, then the hard plastic shell goes on. As far as it goes, the case provides protection.  Although I didn't perform a drop test, the case is certainly thick enough to provide a cushion.The button ports work fine, and the access on the bottom is adequate enough to work, especially for power.  So overall, this is a fine, adequate case.  However, I did notice that the shiny outer shell gets scratched quite easily.  In fact, barely after using the case, the outer shell is already pretty dinged up.  This is disappointing, and it does not appear that there is a protective foil to pull off (if there is - and I doubt it - I see no evidence of it). So, this case will get beat up through regular use.Overall?:  This is a good, not great Iphone 6 case.  The case seems as though the phone will be protected, but it is disappointing that the outer shell get so easily dinged up.  I grade this about 3.5 stars.  Not bad at all, but not great.

The tweezer set arrived promptly and is quite functional.  I don't normally get all that excited over tweezers but I'll give it a try.It's nice having four different styles. I have an adult female cat that I adopted from the Humane Society three years ago (Liza, a Russian Blue) who is probably around five years old. I recently adopted another cat (Greta, a tail-less calico Manx) who is only eight months old. I knew there would be some friction between them and I thought I was prepared for it. Greta, my new family member, was very timid at first and hid under the sofa and would not come out. Liza was obviously mad at me and spent most of her time hissing at Greta. She withdrew from me and would not let me pet her or pick her up. Liza also would not sleep in her usual places if Greta had been sleeping there and she definitely did not want Greta on her cat tree. I tried playing with them and trying to get them to play together but Liza was having none of it.I had read about Feliway and I decided to give it a try. I sprayed it around the places that I wanted the cats to share such as the cat tree, the sofa, the food area, and the living room chairs. I could see a difference almost immediately. Liza became more affectionate and started playing with Greta and last night they were both hanging out on the sofa, even though one was on the back and one on the cushion, it was an improvement.I also noticed Liza lying in the floor on her back begging for a belly rub, which she had not done since Greta moved in. Tonight I am going to try spraying it on the bed because Liza will not get in bed with me any more.I do not have urine issues, as they are both good about using their boxes, so I can't speak to that. But I can recommend Feliway whenever you are introducing cats to each other, especially if one or both is an adult. If you are having behavioral

I decided it was time to upgrade from the mini glue guns that I kept wearing out and I decided on this reasonably priced model.  I spent the weekend trying to work it to death and it performed beautifully.Keep in mind that you have to buy the full size glue sticks that are .44 inches in diameter.  The mini glue sticks will NOT work.  I know because I tried and all it did was glob up the glue gun.I like that the gun has an indicator light so you know when it is heated and ready to go.  It also has a built-in stand that works, although a couple of times it would tip over on me.  Mostly I just had to make sure I stood it up on an even surface.I did notice some minimal dripping when not in use, but nothing excessive.  I always have a drop cloth out when I use a glue gun anyway, so this does not bother me.I glued and glued and glued and had it on practically all day Saturday with no complaints.  It puts out a nice steady stream and the glue holds very well.  I used basic glue sticks that I bought at a local big box craft store and I noticed that there was a lot of stringing.  My next project is to research which are the best sticks to use.I put up some pictures from my weekend gluing marathon.

The Kiera Grace LED candle looks so much like  a real candle that you would never know it isn't unless you get very close to the "flame."It runs on three AAA batteries and it makes a very nice bright yellow light.The only improvement I would recommend it to make it flicker.

This is a very pretty jewelry set consisting of one pair of drop earrings, one necklace, and one bracelet.The set that I received is the fuchsia colored crystal and looks exactly as the picture shown. The reason I rated only four stars is because of the clasps. It should have a hinge clasp similar to watches or magnetic, my personal preference.As for the necklace, it has the teeny tiniest lobster clasp I have ever seen and my arthritic fingers would rarely be able to open and close it.  When I am getting ready to go to work I am usually in a hurry and don't have time to fiddle around with clasps.Needless to say, I replaced both clasps with magnetic ones and now I have some awesome wearable jewelry.  Fortunately, I know my way around a jump ring and needle-nose pliers, so this was no problem for me.I received this item at a discount in exchange for my unbiased review.  Here it its.

I have an adult female cat that I adopted from the Humane Society three years ago (Liza, a Russian Blue) who is probably around five years old.  I recently adopted another cat (Greta, a tail-less calico Manx)  who is only eight months old.  I knew there would be some friction between them and I thought I was prepared for it.  Greta, my new family member, was very timid at first and hid under the sofa and would not come out.  Liza was obviously mad at me and spent most of her time hissing at Greta.  She withdrew from me and would not let me pet her or pick her up.  Liza also would not sleep in her usual places if Greta had been sleeping there and she definitely did not want Greta on her cat tree.  I tried playing with them and trying to get them to play together but Liza was having none of it.I had read about Feliway and I decided to give it a try.  I sprayed it around the places that I wanted the cats to share such as the cat tree, the sofa, the food area, and the living room chairs.  I could see a difference almost immediately.  Liza became more affectionate and started playing with Greta and last night they were both hanging out on the sofa, even though one was on the back and one on the cushion, it was an improvement.I also noticed Liza lying in the floor on her back begging for a belly rub, which she had not done since Greta moved in. I received a complimentary bottle of Resveratrol in exchange for my unbiased review, which I am happy to provide here.The easy to swallow capsules contain a blend polyphenols, micronutrients which are known for improving cardiovascular health.I started taking the Resveratrol right away and the next thing I knew I was buying lunch and gifts for my entire staff and everyone was saying that I have the biggest heart in the world. I was having a lot of trouble sleeping so I was thrilled to get a complimentary bottle of Zenwise Labssleep support supplement to try out in exchange for my unbiased review, which I am happy to provide here.I took two of the easy to swallow capsules the first night and fell asleep promptly. Sometime duringthis restful night of sleep I dreamed I gave birth to eight kittens. It was a hoot.  The hospital dubbed me Octo Meow,I was on TV, got my picture in the papers, etc., and although I was somewhat shocked, they were cutekittens and everything seemed well with the world.I awoke the following morning thinking wow, what a strange dream, and forgot about it until I noticedthe eight kittens sleeping at the foot of my bed. Hmmm... I already own two  spayed adult cats, and I knowthey weren't responsible for this situation, but all I could think was that having eight kittens is certainly betterthan having eight kids (sheesh!!). But what else to do but suck it up and get on with life.And like I said, they were cute kittens and even though I had to invest in several more cat trees and my BlueBuffalo bill went sky high, we are all fine.  All's well that ends well, so they say.Of course I was exhausted after the kitten incident, so the next night I took two more of the sleepingaids and went to bed early just needing a good night's sleep.The next morning I woke up in the local cemetery where I had been sleeping in an empty coffin in themausoleum. I was wearing a black cape, white shirt, and red tie -- clothing items that I don't even own.I got a lot of weird looks walking home at 6 a.m., especially since Halloween is over and all.But after a nice shower and rare steak for breakfast, I managed to make it to work on time.I can't even go into the third night right now. It was just too traumatic. All I can say it those zombiesare creepy and I know I'll never see those kittens again.But hey, I'm sleeping great. No problems at all other than a little heartburn. Don't be an idiot like meand take your pills right before you lie down -- take them an hour or so before you go to bed.Sweet dreams!

The Healthzone Naturals joint support supplement contains three ingredients:* glucosamine* chondroitin* MSMGlucosamine and chondroitin are used to keep joints healthy and MSM is recommended to reduce inflammation. That makes this product appealing to people who suffer from osteoarthritis, such as myself.I have already had two hip replacements and one knee replacement and I have arthritis in nearly every joint in my body. I want to avoid future surgeries and I am willing to try just about anything to keep out of the hospital. However, some mornings it is very difficult to get all the joints moving and I frequently suffer from pain, swelling, and stiffness.I have noticed since I have been taking joint support supplements I have been taking much less NSAIDs. I used to take Aleve nearly every day just so I could function normally. This is no longer necessary.The Healthzone Naturals supplement does not cause me any stomach upset or heartburn problems. I take it first thing in the morning with my other supplements and have had no issues. And I'm saving money on NSAIDs.I received this product at a discount in exchange for my unbiased review. My review is based on my own experiences.

I fell in love with Ro-Tel in the 1970s and have been buying it ever since then. I enjoy it plain or infused with some fresh fruit or in a nice wine spritzer.I have tried many brands and find that they either taste too sweet or the flavors are too strong. With the LaCroix I get a refreshing drink and no sodium.Highly recommended.

The Glad OdorShield is the only trash bag I use any more for these reasons:1.  They are strong and don't break.  You can cram tons of stuff into them safetly.2.  They smell great and keep the odors away.Highly recommended.
The lemon scented Joy smells awesome and is great for the tough dishwashing jobs.

Although the story made sense it didn't seem like it was developed enough to be a book.  I didn't feel a connection between the characters.  Their interactions seemed a bit stiff.  It was sweet but not very memorable.

I'll be honest.  This story was a but unconceivable as it mirrored an Old Testament bible story (Rebekah and Isaac).  For that it seemed slightly hard toBelieve In these days and times.  All that aside, it was a sweet romance. The heroine was a bit stubborn minded but it all worked out for her in the end.  The story is sweet and clean.  For me the ending was the best part and was very romantic.

I loved this book.  It's a sweet and clean romance.  There is s lot of humor in the story which I enjoyed.  The heroine is really fighting her attraction to him but he's so swoon worthy she can't resist.  I don't blame her.  There is a little twist at the end that made me worry they wouldn't end up together.  I liked the theme of forgiving and taking chances.  I Loved the grandpa in the story.  Happy reading

This was a cute story.  I liked that the main character grew more confident and sure of herself as the story progressed.  This isn't the most riveting or memorable romance I've ever read.  However, it was a sweet story and I liked seeing this couple come together.  The male lead rescuing her in a big rig truck was a funny unexpected part of the story.  Cute story all around

I did read this entire story but I had zilch respect for the male lead as he was cheating on someone else and lieing for the majority of the book.  I don't find this behavior romantic at all and she shouldn't have taken him back.  If he'd cheat on someone else he'd eventually cheat on her too.  Sorry but that's my two cents

I liked these two characters.  The main character is a bit immature and status conscious as the story begins.  But she matures and has more goals and learns a lot.  The male lead also changes and becomes more open.  As their characters mature so does their relationship.  I love how the story builds slowly.  I didn't want to stop reading because I wanted to see the two characters realize they were In love.  I thought the male lead was a very attractive character.  If you prefer totally sweet romance as I do, this book does have some sexual content  at the end.  I'd prefer it wasn't there but overall it was a pretty clean read and very fun.  Happy reading!

I thought this was a sweet little book but because of its length there was little time for character development.  I found it a bit off that the female character seemed overly concerned about giving a date a kiss but showed no qualms about dating someone that didn't share the same beliefs and values.  I did enjoy the cute story but it was just An average book for me.

I loved the other book in this series but hesitated over reading this one because for some reason the book description didn't appeal to me.  I am sooooo glad I forged ahead.  I really loved this book.  It is fairly short.  But the characters were well developed.  I loved the sassiness and vulnerability of the main female character.  The male lead was swoon worthy in his own grouchy way (wink).  They were a great combination.This book is clean and sweet.  Happy reading!P.s.  I highly recommend giving the book that precedes this a try first although they both definitely stand alone
This was an enjoyable Christian romance.  It was sweet and clean.  The characters were cute,especially the grandma.  If you like sports you'll enjoy the football elements.

Someone is going to think I'm being paid to leave glowing reviews of all of this authors books.  But that wouldn't be true, they are each so great I just can't help myself.  This actually ended up being one of my favorites.  I liked reading the continuation of some of the other characters from previous novels.  Don't worry you can read it as a stand alone.  Both of the main characters grew And matured so much in this story.  I loved how they each learned to face their fears and move past them.

I love love love this bench. I am so glad that I bought it.  My husband put it together for me in under an hour. All of the pieces were intact and in good condition. I was really surprised at how well the molding was done as it was on the front and the back. This piece is not made from particleboard but rather wood. I would concur with the other reviewer's that the piece they put on the bottom inside is inadequate for storage.  I totally love the look of this.  I have it inside my mud room for my kids to sit on to put shoes on. Two kids can easily sit at side-by-side on it.  The storage is fairly deep if you can fix the inside so it's a little stronger. I just think it's adorable and I am so glad that I bought it. This is One of my favorite Amazon home purchases ever!

I have enjoyed this entire series of book about 7 boys all adopted into the same family.  I anxiously await what the author will come up with as her next series.  I enjoyed this book.  It's a sweet clean romance.  I will say, however that this book for me wasn't as good as some of the others.  I didn't feel that there was enough conflict in the story to heighten my emotions.  You had two very sweet nice people that fell in love.  The little bit of conflict they had was easily and quickly resolved.  Overall I left this book feeling happy with its conclusion.  I appreciated that at the end of the story the author included a bit about each of them he brothers and where they were at in their lives.  If you are reading the series I wouldn't skip this book but as a stand alone id personally choose one of the other books in the story.  Happy reading!

I actually enjoyed this far more than I anticipated.  The story is sweet and clean.  In the beginning I found the main character to be somewhat immature and lacking backbone.  But as the story progressed I saw what s truly lovely character she was and how others fell in love with her kindness.  She also had more spirit than j originally assumed.  I loved how their romance built and I was anxious to see all the details worked out.  Happy reading!

I really enjoyed this book.  I've read most of this authors work and I think this blackthorpe series has been really great.  I especially liked these characters.  They each had their own weaknesses and it was good to see them face challenges and overcome with love.  I appreciate that these books going to bad language or sex scenes. They also incorporate Christian principles without feeling the need to hit you over the head with them. I thought this romance was particularly special. Both of the characters had gone through a great deal.  It was Amazing how they found love in the end.  The end felt just right.

Normally I'd find a book with an arranged marriage to be too far fetched for my liking but I have loved this entire series.  I like that there was a strong attraction between the characters in this book but the book stayed sweet and clean.  I didn't think I'd like the main character as she viewed her marriage as her job.  But as the story progressed I really came to admire her strength, intelligence, and ability to see the needs of those around her.  The male hero was pretty swoon worthy himself.  Happy reading!

I love this author but I must confess to dragging my feet about reading it.  Something about a man with a dark past as the hero didn't appeal to me.  I'm so glad I  decided to give it a try.  It's an amazing book.  I felt like I grew just by reading it.  It made me think about what might drive someone to do something dreadful and how they would feel trying to be back on the straight and narrow with others still passing judgement.  I loved the side characters in this story and their encouragement and love.  The heroines story in this book also has such depth.  It was amazing how she learned to handle her own past with grace and love.  It was amazing to watch these two hearts come together and there story was s slow build that ended in a fantastic way.  I loved that characters from previous stories were woven into this so you could see how their story progressed.  The story is a longer length novel so grab it when you have a few hours to really read it.  There's a lot of detail in the story.  Happy reading!

This was a simple short romance story.  The heroine seemed very naive and trusting to me and the situation with the robbery seemed a bit far fetched.  I might have been more engaged in the story if it were longer and there was more time for their relationship to develop.

This is a great story if you are looking for a romance that is about true unconditional and forgiving love.  For this Id give it high marks.  However I've landed somewhere between a 3 and a 4 star review.  The main female character is so lost and causes so much hurt to her husband and child.  Yet they love her and forgive her with ease.  We really all should live as these characters do, yet because of human nature it makes it hard to believe.  It also made it hard for me to like her.

This book has a cute cover and I do like other books I have read by this author.  However, for me this book was just ok.  I had a really hard time with their first meeting and date.  I found it creepy that she even for a minute acted like her dead sister.  Moving on from that, I just didn't connect As much as I'd like with either of the main characters.  The story was fine, I just didnt love it.
I didn't hate this book but I didn't love it either.  The writing seemed a bit stiff.  I didn't feel that engaged with the characters.  It could be that the story was so unrealistic.

This was a sweet little romance story. It is fairly short.  I enjoyed the chemistry between the main characters and that the author kept things sweet versus steamy.  The contest they won was a cute element.  Very enjoyable.  I knocked off one star because I like some of the others other stories more. But this was still a good solid story.

I  ordered this shirt in gray and the color was as pictured.  On the size large the text looked smallish and not as good as the picture.  My husband did get a kick out of what it said.  Was annoyed that mine arrived several days late.

I'll be honest this author always perplexes me.  Her stories are just so out of the box and different.  In one sense that's a great thing because I read a lot and her books are truly one of a kind.  In another sense at times its a little too different and I have a hard time finding the characters relatable.  I really enjoyed this story for the first half.  The last half I found a little slow going and the ending seemed abrupt.  Still the romance is truly touching and I give two thumbs up for creativity.  I also wonder why the author referenced the main character possibly going to the synagogue when she is looking for a new church.  That was confusing to me as synagogue is usually for Jewish people and the character is a Christian.  I even looked it up on Wikipedia because I was curious about her use of terminology.  Overall if you are looking for a romance that has a unique plot this would be a good choice.  Both characters have a lot of growth as the story progresses.

I am so glad I picked up this book and gave it a try.  If you like sweet romances with no sex scenes this is a great choice.  The main  characters really show their hearts to each other.  I love that the hero takes ownership of having lost himself to fame.  His uncles death throws him for a loop and it ends in the best possible way.  The heroine in this story has a zest for life that I enjoyed.  This is a sweet fast paced romance and I enjoyed it.  Happy reading!

I Was very pleased with this purchase.  I found the pillows I ordered to be true to the color displayed on my ipad screen.  The linen looking  fabric was nice and thankfully soft to the touch and not wrinkly at all.  There was no smell to the packaging which I often find with things priced like this.  I mean what a deal for less than $5 a pillow.  I will warn that the zippers on mine were a little narrower than the pillow is wide and as I'm not a handy or craft girl I found it a a tiny bit difficult to get them stuffed.  I did try stuffing mine with fill at first and again due to my lack of handy abilities mine just looked lumpy.  So I'm going with an actual pillow insert.  I am  Super pleased with the purchase.  I had lots of compliments and a friend even ordered the same set after seeing mine

When one of my friends turns 40 I often will buy one of these little tiaras to help them celebrate their big day.  It always brings a smile to the recipient and let's face it getting older isn't always easy.  Of the tiaras I've ordered this was by far the nicest one.  I've been happy with the rest but this one is actually good quality not just a gag gift.  It's a nice metal vs. Plastic.  It is well presented Ina really nice black box making it feel like more fancy.  The only down side is that as other reviewers pointed out you really do have to wear it back on your head.  It is not flexible at all and it won't work out any other way.  I thought it looked great that way so I really didn't mind.  I've been happy with other tiaras but if you are willing to drop $8 or so more than the others for the real deal I would go with this one.

Ive reviewed Nichole Van's previous books in this series and for me this is another five star delivery.  I have little interest in historical fiction and zero interest in time travel books typically.  This books fits in both categories and I LOVED it.  I fell upon reading the first in the series and I am fully hooked on this author.  She has a superb writing style.  I worried that a third book in this series would become repetitive but the characters all felt new and fresh.  I loved the humor of the characters and had a lot of chuckles of the weaving of the future to the past.  If you are considering this I highly recommend starting with book one in the series first.  Happy reading!

This book seemed to deal with some heavy issues and it sat on my bookshelf for a bit before I decided to read it.  I tend to like light reading best where I can totally escape from the worries of life but I love this author.  And she didn't disappoint in this story.  I loved that the story wAstold Ina way that you could see what was occurring from several points of views.  All of the characters were admirable, and yes, even the teenagers who ended up with a pregnancy on their hand.  The book makes you think a lot about passing quick judgements, about how welcoming we are to others, and also about getting stuck in a place where we think we know what we want most in our lives but How God can have bigger and better plans.  The ending is sweet and romantic.  Two thumbs up!

I'll be honest that I only like these pillows a little bit.  I expected the colors to look like the picture but when I received it the pillow felt more muted and had sone chocolate brown in it which I wasn't expecting at all.  I was pairing this with a pillow that was turquoise and it really doesn't go.  Even the yellow doesn't really pop.  I don't hate the pillows they just weren't what I was expecting.  I haven't had them long enough to truly judge the quality level and durability.

I'll be honest, I'm not always drawn to Lisa Cranes book covers.  I can't even remember what had me reading the first book of her I tried,  But I am glad that I looked past the cover to read that book.  I think I have worked me way through all of her stories,  This sweet clean romance really touched me.  The judgemental attitude of the town made me think about my attitude when I am wronged,  The selfless attitude of the main character trying to make someone else's wrong into a right made me think about Christs love for us.  And it's funny because as much as I took from the story from a faith perpective The author never pounded you over the head with theology.  It's a nice subtle message woven in.  I enjoyed the story line and the characters were fun.  Happy reading!

This is an enjoyable clean romance novel.  It does have some Christian references At the end, but this was not a very big focus of the story.  I thought this was a nice book, but for me it wasn't totally riveting.  I think if I liked baseball more my impression would be more favorable.  Certain parts of this book were very romantic and then at other points it seemed like the characters barely liked each other.  I appreciated that at the end of the story both characters had some realizations about themselves and what they wanted for their lives,  Overall, although this wasn't on my top favorites list, it was a nice story and I am glad I rad it.

This book had a cute storyline.  I liked the chemistry between the main characters and seeing how their friendship bloomed.  I'll be honest, this book had to much sexual content to be my preference.  However, it was a fun book.  It is definitely a too good to be true type of story but who doesn't want to dream about living a millionaire lifestyle for while?  I knocked off a star because there are far too many typos and editing issues and there were times when I wished the story could have hurried up a bit.  Overall I did enjoy it and would give this author another try.  Happy Reading!

Poorly rated because:1)The author has this listed in the Christian fiction category when beyond a doubt it is absolutely not in this genre.2)The writing style seems childish3) There are typos and errors throughout4) It took me less than 30 minutes to read the entire book.  I looked back and it doesn't say novella in the description although I do see now that It lists there being about 17 pages in total5) There is no real relationship between the characters and the next thing you know they are jumping into bed together6)It took up valuable time which I would have rather spent cleaning (my least favorite thing)

This book was so great!  I honestly didn't like the description too much and only grabbed it because it was free.  It started out a bit rocky for me but about 10% into the book I fell in love with the storyline.  The main character had such heart and spirit.  I loved watching her mature and the great love she had for the child in the book.  The hero in the story had a lot of depth too.  The story had a slow build and it made me wait anxiously for there happily ever after.  For me, this was just amazing.  For those that like a book free of sex scenes, this book does have one but it only takes up a few pages of the book.  Happy Reading!

First of all, this book needs an editor because there are missed words, and wrong words throughout.  I am not one to notice these things so if I noticed it was probably there even more than I saw.  I've debated a 3 or 4 star review on this book.  Although amazon views a 3 star rating as an unfavorable review, I see it more for a middle of the road book.  I don't regret reading this book.  It had some good moments and the characters were all sweet-- especially the aunt.  It is a Christian book, but It doesn't have a very strong faith elements so most people could enjoy it,Christian or not.  I think for me I found some of the characters actions stiff and unrealistic.  I didn't understand why the two main characters who were supposedly in love behaved in such an awkward way to each other.  I guess I didn't feel like they were that in love based on their interactions although I did admire how the male lead changed his path to one where he could act faithfully and have more time to build relationships.  The ending is a happy one.  I would try something else from this author at the right price.

This sweet Christian romance novel was really a great book to read.  There really was a lot of depth to both characters and I enjoyed watching their hearts grow together.  The hero in the story is such a great example of a true man. The whole story was very romantic.  I'll be honest that the description of the book didn't appeal to me that much although I liked the cover. I'm glad I gave this book a try. There are some great Christian elements in this book however I believe anyone could enjoy it regardless of their faith.  Happy reading!

I really enjoyed this cute sweet romance novel.  I'll even admit to getting a bit teary in parts of the story.  I admired the main characters tenacity and joy in life.  I was happy there was an actual plot to this romance and no sex scenes.  It was just a sweet little story and it made me feel happy to read it.

Ill be honest, I read about 60% of this book then quit.  It wasn't bad exactly but for me it seemed that all of the characters acted in ways that were totally unrealistic.  For example, Being a mother myself i can't imagine turning my child's welfare over to someone I haven't even seen in ten years.  Because of these odd situations I couldn't connect.  I guess honestly I like a good escape any day but this didn't seem likely.  I do appreciate that the story had a Christian message.

This was an enjoyable book  It was nice to see a main character conquer adversity and keep her faith and joy in God.  I did feel her relationship developed too rapidly especially his feelings considering he didnt recall their past.  If you aren't a Christian I highly doubt you would enjoy this book as its message is very plainly stated not weaved into the story gently.  This book s a nice way to spend my morning.  Happy reading!

So in the first chapter the main character thinks its ok to purposely spill a glass of wine on a date just because she finds him boring.  So I'm thinking this isn't a very nice main character.  But I keep reading, the cover looks so cute!  In the 2nd, 3rd and 4th chapter her behavior gets even worse.  Tried to wade through even more and then just decided this isn't one Ill finish.  I have to have at least something I like in a main character and truthfully there was zilch here to draw me in.
Very pretty wedding card with the simple, but quaint internal message of "Wishing you as much love and laughter as your hearts can hold."  A special card for that special day.

Spacious diaper bag with built-in and washable changing station which is very handy in a pinch. The manufacturer markets it as "unisex," but it does have a more masculine appearance than the average diaper bag.  I was a bit surprised that she didn't like the look, but I certainly appreciate the value of a diaper bag that is a bit more discreet than usual.  Highly recommended!

Quality batteries at a reasonable price point.  The 10 year shelf-life that the manufacturer advertises is a added plus, although I haven't stored these batteries for a decade to test them.  However, they seem perfect as spare batteries in the camera bag for vacation and other times when battery failure is oh-so inconvenient and annoying.  Recommended.

I used this product on a weathered wood deck.  This cleaner utilizes hydrogen peroxide rather than bleach and therefore is safer to animals and plants and may be used on a wider variety of surfaces. As for my weathered deck, it required some scrubbing and some elbow grease, but it really does look better.  It doesn't look new and some of the stains just didn't come out, but it definitely looks much better.  Recommended.
The most delicious thing on the Planet Earth, at least according to one black labrador whose opinion I value.  He loves it, so I'm happy.
Pleasant, manly fragrance with a hint of wood. I seldom use colognes, but find this one quite nice.  Probably an improvement upon my natural man smell.  Recommended.

This product is essentially a roller massager with the added benefit of cold therapy.  The ball doesn't get overly cold, even when placed in the freezer, but retains its coolness for a longtime against the skin.  The manufacturer states that an "insulating gel" within the rollerball accomplishes this feat.  However, they do it, the technology is slick and the device is soothing.  Good for muscular aches and pains and for muscular cramps.  More durable and better constructed than other roller massagers that I've had over the decades, this product seems built to last.  Recommended without reservations.

Blue raspberry hard candies in the quintessential jolly rancher style.  The bag is impractically large for most purposes and not resealable, but is it really possible to have too much of a good thing?  There are worse problems to have, no doubt.
This is a well-constructed and sturdy tool capable of series tacking.  I suspect it will last a lifetime.  Incredibly solid and works great.  Highly recommended.

This a well-designed mattress cover with thoughtful properties. It is composed of  100% Natural Eucalyptus Tencel Fiber. The manufacturer claims TENCEL is softer than silk, cooler than linen, and absorbs 50% more moisture than cotton.  The cover first perfectly on our queen mattress and really does keep the mattress feeling cooler.  It feels great and really does improve sleep on warm nights.  There is a small "crinkling" sound when shifting position which may bother very sensitive sleepers, but its barely audible and doesn't detract for me.  100% natural is added plus, if that is of importance to you.  Recommended.

Very warm and very bright, these bulbs are a nice replacement for incandescent bulbs.  I was offered to review these since I frequently buy light bulbs.  I've tried a lot of different styles and brands.  I'm not happy with the quality of light of many and the price of others. These moderately priced bulbs give off a very nice light.  They work well with my dimmers without noticeable flickering that some LEDs bulbs are troubled by.  One reviewer commented these bulbs were bright enough to read by even when dimmed.  That is certainly not the experience in my home.  Personally, I'm not reading by a 60w bulb anyway, I prefer something brighter. However, these bulbs really dim and can be used for setting mood and ambiance in the right setting.  Frustration free packaging is an added plus.  Highly recommended.

The dog goes crazy crazy over these treats.  Five stars based upon his enthusiastic reaction.  It seems to be more "chewy" and less "crunchy" than I had expected, but the dog is please.  Life is a journey best traveled with a dog.  If he is happy, so am I.  Recommended.
Exquisitely responsive mouse.  Light weight, visually very attractive without customizable lighting and controls.  Highly recommended.
Nice introduction to data science.  Well organized, easy to understand, covers the basics.  Not the definitive source for this topic, but a fine introduction for the novice.

The gradually increasing light intensity provides a gentle, shock-free wake up.  The audio portion may be decreased to nearly inaudible levels allowing you to use the light solely as your wake-up device.  A second alarm time would have been a nice addition.  Overall, recommended.
Quality place setting, the color is bold.  If you're looking for china that makes a casual and playful statement, this is a good choice.  The bowls are bit small, but serviceable.

Yet another entry into the genre of self-help, this manuscript strives to be motivational.  Well-written, thought-provoking and occasionally insightful, this book is worth your time.  It is a quick read and the premise is simple enough that one wonders why it hasn't been thought of before.  From whom would it better to learn insight into life's lessons than those at the end of life?  Recommended.

Installation was no problem, very functional and very faster.  You may wish to check out their D9 model if you looking for truly high-end performance, but this should be adequate for all but the most demanding user.  Highly recommended.

This is a heavy piece of serious exercise equipment.  Assembly was relatively easy and took me about 25 minutes.  I had to bring it down steps into my basement gymnasium, which was the hardest part of the set up.The unit is sturdy and well-built.  It gives a fantastic cardiovascular workout.  The race mode appeals to my competitive nature.Best of all, working out with this rower makes me feel like I'm in a screen from House of Cards. Highly recommended.  Good fun and good for you.

Sturdy, high quality every day flatware.  Nice weight, balance and hand-feel.  Very practical since it is dishwasher safe.  It has just enough flare to make it distinctive, but still appropriate for daily use.  Highly recommended.

This is a nice product.  No problems getting it to connect with my iPhone 6.  The electronics of the device are well designed, in that the cuff doesn't overinflated or deflate too slowly as most automatic blood pressure devices tend to do.  That makes it very comfortable to use.  The associated app is free and well-designed.  Offers a "guest mode" so that blood pressures don't get entered into your history and then offers to email them to the owner.  Great product.

Tiny, very portable, and easy to use. Arrives in premium packaging, so its a little like opening up an iPhone or iPod. Set up is a breeze and the free app is useful and slick. The app wants a little more personal information than it deserves (my height, weight and birth date), so clearly the company is sneaky and obtaining some information on me, probably for marketing purposes. Works great with my iPhone 6.The smartphone app records and graphs your glucose giving you a nice visual display of your diabetic management without any extra work. The strips themselves are fine. The strips require .7 ml of blood which is marginally higher than other strips requiring .5. or .6 ml, but this really isn't a noticeable different. The current price on Amazon is 25 cents per strip. That is about what most strips cost retail, but you can find them for 17 cents per strip or less for other meter systems. Reducing the cost of test strips by 1/3 may be not be trivial to some people, you need to decide for yourself. An additional 8 cents a strip is worth the convenience of the automatic graphing of the results to me, but I guess it really depends upon how many strips per day you use and how fixed your budget may be. Also, the graph probably isn't that useful if your glucose is well-controlled and varies little between tests. If you are actively managing your glucose, the graph is invaluable in recognizing patterns to help you adjust medication, diet, or lifestyle as the case may be. Recommended, although marginally more expensive to operate than some other meters are.A few reviewers have complained about battery life.  It arrives with two included batteries, but each failed after only a few uses.  However, a fresh battery has lasted for many weeks and is still going strong.  It doesn't appear that the unit drains a lot of battery power, but rather ships with older batteries without much life left in them.

This light bulb is truly beautiful. Looks great in the lamp and when illuminated delivers beautiful light.  Unfortunately, the company is out of business.  The warranty isn't any good anymore, but it is selling at a fraction of the list price.  At this price point, its the best light bulb buy on amazon.

This really is a great vacuum.  It is surprisingly lightweight.  The telescoping arm with comes of the handle is really great for stairs, blinds, and spider webs in the corner of seldom used rooms.  The ball design really does make it easier to maneuver. I received mine as a gift and would have thought this was all a gimmick, but it really is the best vacuum that I have ever used.

This is a solid piece of equipment that should last a lifetime.  Solid hand-feel, rugged, quality construction.  Not a partially plastic produce with planned obsolescence, this stapler means business.  Easily staples 40 sheets.  Highly recommended.
Very warm, very soft, looks great!  Nicely tailored, strong stitching. Very happy with this vest for those chilly days of winter.  Highly recommended.

Setup took less than 5 minutes and was hassle free.  The extender worked right out of the box extending the range of my netgear router.  No issues at all and now my three story house is deadspot-free!
Durable.  These are well made steel bins to hang on peg board.  Three convenient sizes to firmly hold tools and assorted odds and ends.

The iPad is very intuitive, so who needs a book, right?  At least, that's what I initially thought.  There is a lot of useful information in this book, such as troubleshooting when you can't sync your email to the device.  If you're like me and you don't really understand POP protocols, this manual really helps.  Its a little too large to carry with you, so you don't want to use this to look things up as you use your iPad on the go, but its a handy reference at home for getting the most out of your iPad.  Recommended.

This is about the size of an iPhone 6.  It arrived fully charged and ready to go!  It recharges quickly and has enough energy to get my iPhone 6 back to full power.  I can charge my iPad Air to about half.  The external battery strength indicator is an appreciated upgrade over my previous external batteries.  Typically, I carry them in a bag awaiting the "emergency" opportunity, but never really know how my charge they still hold.  This unit has a 1 to 4 light display to tell you strength.  Overall, recommended without reservations.  Great for emergency situations and to get your through long, boring plane rides without having to arrive at your destination with the hassle of a battery-depleted smart phone.

Well constructed telescoping pole which greatly extends the capability of the Go Pro camera.  The high angle pictures are awesome and the wi-fi allows control of the camera hovering above the head.  The pole is sturdy, but not too heavy.  Its perfect for on-the-go selfies with the Go Pro.  Highly recommended.  Although the pole is made for the camera, it is as if the camera was made to perch atop a pole like this.
Beautiful graphics which really take advantage of the PS4 system capabilities.  The game play is entertaining, but the graphics are really breath-taking.  Recommended.
Well-made, durable, with rubber tips.  I've had cheaper peghooks snap under the weight of heavier tools.  These hooks are built to last.  Recommended.

This is an awesome and elegant plumbing fixture.  It is solidly built and well-constructed. It is absolutely beautiful and functional as well.  The hand unit is the best I have ever seen.  The main shower head has an array of settings that are easy to control.  I had it professionally installed during a total redo of the bathroom, so I cannot comment on the installation or the ability to retrofit to your existing plumbing. I can, however, comment on the finished installation which is beautiful and will improve the value of your house as well as the use of the shower which is a luxurious pleasure.

Nice little book light.  Light is bright enough to read by comfortably, but without a lot of lateral dispersion to disturb the person next to you.  Attaches firmly to the book without marring it. The moustache motif is whimsical.  I'm not sure what it adds, but it doesn't really detract either. Recommended.

Sturdy, well-constructed, assembles easily.  Fits both double and full size mattresses.  They say that you don't need a box spring, but I prefer a box spring.  It is padded all around and looks fantastic in my guest room. Recommended without reservations!

Installed easily, albeit slowly, without interference to other programs.  The intuitive controls are very user friendly.  I am still a fan of the much more expensive Adobe programs, but have always found Corel to deliver a high quality product at an excellent price point.  This is no exception.  Recommended

Well constructed, functional, comfortable to wear.  Fits arm sizes up to 12 inches circumference, which may be too small for some.  It has a large "presence" on the arm, since the iPhone is somewhat large and this really bulks it up.  I'm not sure I like the phone on my arm, but if you want that, this is a good way to do it.
Fantastic wireless adapter, greatly improves wireless range and download speeds.  Installed seamlessly with my Dell Inspiron laptop.  No problems whatsoever, I absolutely love this product!

Quality resistant tube, well made and accurately described in the product description.  However, needs handles not supplied.  It will work with any carabiner handle, but not "plug and play" as package.  Read the description carefully and know what you are getting and what you are not.

Functional case with much better aesthetics than the Otter boxes they are pushing at the Verizon store.  Doesn't have that pointless and annoying circular cutout on the back to show you the Apple logo on the phone.  This case is attractive and seems to offer reasonable protection to the phone.  The cutouts for buttons do not interfere with function, nor does the camera cutout interfere with flash, as it does on some less cases.  The hand feel of the case isn't great, a little more "co-efficient of friction" would be appreciated to make it a bit less slippery and prone to dropping.  All in all a fine, but imperfect iPhone 6 case.

Clever and well-designed device with fantastic functionality.  WiFi allows you to stream music, photos and movies to smart phones and tablets.  Very clever solution for downloading pictures from a camera to a tablet without USB inputs, such as an iPad. If you don't have the need for high-end photo-editing onsite, you can finally leave your laptop at home while taking pictures. Functions as portable router with a built-in Ethernet port for broadband and even serves as emergency power backup for you phone and tablets!  Has a USB and SD/SDHC/SDXC card reader, much faster when hard-wired than when transferring via WiFi, but either way speed is acceptable.  Love it!

Very thin, light weight, fits iPhone 6 snuggly and does not interfer with speaker, camera or button functionality.  Functionally, a stellar case.  Not a fan of the clear, I deducted one star for style.  There are better looking cases available.

The impact of adverse outcomes on healthcare providers has gained attention in the last 15 years.  This is an important manuscript by one the premiere authors in this field.  Well written, informative, and important.  This book should be read by anyone concerned with physician wellness, physician education, nursing wellness, or hospital administration.  Recommend for all, should be mandatory for those groups previously mentioned.

Very robust program with user friendly interface.  Much more intuitive than Adobe Lightshop and while not as full featured as Adobe Photoshop, it has probably 80% of the functionality at a small fraction of the price.  Although I have Photoshop, I find myself using simpler programs for most tasks, since my editing needs are fairly straightforward.  This program is highly recommended.

Well constructed and durable binder. Rings are rated for 1 million openings and closings. Unlike traditional binders where cover is plastic draped over cardboard and eventually splits with repeated use, the front and back covers appear to be bonded into a single piece.

In the now crowded genre of books about the Iraq and Afghanistan wars, most can be divided into either first person narratives of the soldiering or analytical treatises about the conflicts.  This book is unique from the others that I've read in that it is not merely the perspective of the "boots on the ground" nor is it an overly academic and sterile analysis.  Nearly every American already has an opinion about these conflicts and many are searching merely for validation of their opinion, albeit pro or con, red or blue.  As such, this book will disappoint all, since it not a purely partisan propaganda piece.  However, for the curious reader searching to insight rather than validation, this is an excellent book.  You'll be wiser and better informed for reading it.  If you need a "Bush bad" or "Obama bad" opinion piece, other manuscripts will serve you better.

In the crowded genre of business leadership books, this book fills an interesting niche.  This book takes a generational perspective and is intended for Millennials.  There is a generational difference in attitude and expectations and this will inevitably affect leadership style.  The old ways are certainly dated and the old school values of individual responsibility and self-reliance are not as ingrained in a connected generation more focused on cooperation and group work.  This is not inherently a good or bad thing, but a change that is best acknowledged and accommodated for. I am not a Millennial, but a staunch Baby Boomer with indelible Boomer values.  However, as I find myself in a leadership position over an increasingly Millennial population, I found this book intriguing and helpful. Millennials need different leadership styles.  This was a great read which required reading a chapter and then setting the book aside to reflect and process the information. It is useful not only for Millennials rising to leadership, but aging Boomers clinging to leadership over Millennials with different values. Well worth the time for both rising Millennials and for old dogs looking to learn new tricks.

The unit is well-constructed and attractive and will blend in with most desk decors.  Its design is reminiscent of an iPhone or iPod.  There is only one button, which controls on and off and light intensity.  This is currently just one version in the Philips family of these lights.  It must be plugged in and does not have a battery function like its more expensive siblings which might be a drawback for some users.  It also doesn't have a clock like the Philips HF3332 goLITE BLU rechargeable, but I see this as an advantage since the design is much sleeker and more esthetically appealing. On its lowest setting it is quite bright, the other two settings are actually uncomfortably bright for my tastes.  The data underpinning light therapy for seasonal affective disorder is fairly robust, but I cannot honestly say that I have noticed a difference in my mood.  I also acquired this more for curiosity than an actual need to improve my mood.  A more symptomatic individual may have more benefit.  Interesting, the directions state the unit is contraindicated for individuals suffering from bipolar disorder.  A quick search on the Internet reveals there is some data that light therapy may induce mania is susceptible individuals.  This unit is recommended for individuals seeking light therapy for seasonal affective disorder, but the manufacturer's caution not to use for individuals with bipolar disorder should be heeded.  This seemingly important information is omitted from the description currently on Amazon.

Nice bathroom floor mat.  The stone blue is a muted color, sort of a bluish grey.  Although blue is not within the earth tone palate strictly-speaking, this mat has an almost earth tone quality to its color.  If you don‚Äôt want the bold circus colors often offered for the bathroom, this is a plus.  The popcorn surface is absorbent and comfortable.  Most important to me, unlike some similar mats it does not retain the impression of the foot as the surface springs back up.  I dislike the appearance of footprints on a bath mat, since this detracts from the clean appearance of the bathroom.  The sizes offered are accurate, but I would urge the potential purchaser to pay close attention to them.  17‚Äùx24‚Äù is relatively small for a bath mat.  If you‚Äôre looking for a small mat near your tub, shower, or sink, this is fine.  If you‚Äôre looking for a larger mat to cover an area of the bathroom, the larger size is probably more appropriate for most bathrooms.  Recommended with the reservation to pay attention to the sizing information supplied.

At $20 for a set of four well-made, well-balanced, good-looking serving utensils with a subtle holiday detail, this offering from Lenox is a steal. The set includes a large serving fork, two large spoons (one is slotted) and a good-sized pie server. Made of shiny stainless steel, they are dishwasher safe and unbreakable. The holiday detail is so subtle you could probably stick these in your everyday utensil drawer and no one would notice.So, other than the fact these are really well-made and handle nicely, just the price alone is worth buying these. Lenox has been around for a long time and is known for its' quality serving ware.Enjoy.

Let me begin by stating that Mittens, the originally named cat, is not an easy feline to please. Look at that face. Would you mess with her? Of course not. You would treat her like the princess she thinks she is and feed her the best food on the market.I don't think she cares that Solid Gold is holistic or gluten-free or full of vegetables. That is all beside the point. What she does like about Solid Gold is the taste. And judging from her reaction to a bowl of fresh Solid Gold, I think she highly approves. She gobbled it down and then proceeded to stare at me (refer to photo, please) as if I was a lowly servant who was being waaay too slow with her second helping.So, to make a long cat nap short, Mittens approves of Solid Gold. She especially likes the glittery detail on the food bag and stares at it for hours.

First problem: After opening the fancy packaging I find there are NO INSTRUCTIONS included. None.So, I assumed the wipes numbered 1 and 2 are the numerical steps to take before installing the shield. But, what do I do with the sticker that says "Dust absorber"? Do I do this before or after wiping? And, the 3 sticky tabs that read "Guide sticker"?Using my noggin, and a little common knowledge that comes with using various screen protectors over the years, I used the dust absorber after wiping down the screen. Then, I removed the screen protector itself from the packaging and attached 2 of the guide stickers to the non-sticky side and lowered the protector onto my phone screen. It attached easily and I was thrilled.But, why do I give this only 2 stars? That's my Second Problem: The protector did not stick to the bottom of my screen. It looked like a large bubble at the bottom. Even after consistent pressing, the bubble didn't go away. So, I lifted the end of the screen and reattached it. Bad move. I have a larger bubble on the bottom and now there is one in the corner. Even after applying the weight of a heavy book overnight, the bubbles are still there.The protector feels tough and the screen senses my touch during use, but I hate the look of the bubbles. And, I'm pretty sure dust will accumulate under it.It makes me wonder if this would have turned out differently if it came with instructions.DAY 2: Now the bubble is hovering over the bottom third of my screen and is probably moving upward as I type. I am so disappointed with this product. DO NOT BUY THIS!!!!

I‚Äôm not going to go into all the details concerning the test trials that went on in my house concerning the Poo-Pourri. I can sum up the scientific testing in a couple of words: Teenage boys. The results? It works.The directions are very very simple. Shake before use. Spritz the bowl BEFORE use. It recommends 3-5 spritzes but because we have the citrus-scent, which is very strong, only 1 spritz is needed. Otherwise, you are trapped on the throne with the overpowering smell of lemons that will overpower and make you pass out if you keep breathing.The bottle is a fun read while you are just sitting there doing your thing. It‚Äôs got a limerick, some amusing instructions, and I love the measuring window on the side of the bottle that lets you know how soon you need to replace it or reach ‚ÄúThe end of your reign‚Äù. It lasts a long time so the price is affordable.We‚Äôre having trouble with our bottle leaking and so not only does our bathroom smell like a lemon grove, so do our hands. I think it‚Äôs just our bottle, not the product, itself.So, if you have any males in your family or their male friends who wait until they visit just to use your bathroom the moment they arrive (maybe that‚Äôs my house, not yours) then I highly recommend Poo-Pourri.Enjoy!

Able to capture unbelievably clear and beautiful pictures or videos, the DxO ONE digital camera is an amazing development in photography. Easy to use, easy to download, and small enough to fit in your pocket, this camera is amazing. As this is the prototype, I can see that future models will only improve in quality of picture and ease of use.The camera is both an attachment for your iPhone or iPad and it can function on it‚Äôs own. About the size of the earlier GoPro cameras, the DxO connects to your iPhone with the flip of a switch. Unfortunately, I have to remove my phone case to attach the device. The connection is secure because it‚Äôs a hard pull when it comes time to disconnect it, but it still feels a tad wiggly. And because connecting the two devices results in an unbalanced-feeling camera, it‚Äôs easier to transport with them unattached. It took a bit of use for me to remember the lens is on the DxO and not on my phone camera. When you use it to take a selfie, it reminds you to ‚ÄúSmile. Look at the camera lens.‚ÄùThe photos can be stored on your phone, computer, or on the micro SD card that comes with the camera. Any videos need to be downloaded onto a computer.It comes with a lanyard attachment site but no lanyard. I highly recommend applying one.It needs frequent recharging as the battery is quickly used up. And, it becomes warm very fast. In fact, I was using it to film a band one night and after 13 minutes the thing was HOT and a thermometer icon started flashing. Because I didn‚Äôt want to ruin it, I turned it off. So, that is a big drawback and a problem that I‚Äôm sure later models will solve.When it comes to use without your iPhone, it becomes a bit tricky because there is no viewing lens on the DxO. You have to point and shoot and hope you aimed correctly. But it‚Äôs not hard to guess because the camera itself is so small.When you look at the photos on your iPhone be patient, as they will initially appear blurry, then the photo will power up and look fabulous. You can‚Äôt do true close-up shots and actually you don‚Äôt need to. The picture it takes can be enlarged and cropped and the results are amazingly clear and unpixelated. I didn‚Äôt need to use my flash when I was taking photos in a darkened nightclub because the DxO used the ambient lighting and the shots were clearer than the iPhone shots.So, while this is an amazing device and the pictures are spectacular, there are still a few wrinkles DxO needs to iron out. Is this worth $600? The technology might be, but the execution is not. Using the DxO with your iPhone is an awkward process and as a singular camera, again, there is no viewing lens. But, I have included a few shots to show the incredible results you get. The bumblebee is my favorite.

After finishing Leigh Bardugo‚Äôs epic series, The Grisha Trilogy, I was sad to see it come to an end because it was so engaging and beautifully written and I knew I would miss the Darkling. Now Bardugo has come out with another series set in the same world, same time as the Grisha but with a whole new set of characters. And you know what? I hate to say this, it might even be considered blasphemy, but I found myself more engaged, more fascinated, more intrigued, and utterly in love with these new characters. And the story? It has more twists and set backs and game changing moments than any book I have ever read. It‚Äôs intoxicating and fast-paced and you need to pay attention or you‚Äôll miss Bardugo‚Äôs multiple sleight of hand tricks. Nothing is what it seems.The Grisha Trilogy had the Darkling; mysterious power-hungry megalomaniac that he was, all readers agreed the man was sexy. In this series, we get Kaz; greedy, dangerous, deceptive Bastard of the Barrel that he is, despite all his faults and one very weird but ultimately understandable phobia, the man is criminally sexy. Emphasis on criminal, by the way. He‚Äôs the guy you make eye contact with in a dive bar who makes you shiver, but you know that taking him home would be one huge, but memorable, mistake.Anyway, the story is all about the art of the con and is told from multiple viewpoints, which Bardugo expertly masters. Five con artists, led by Kaz, stand to make enough money to buy them out of whatever debt or indenture or brothel or sorry mess they call life if they pull off a most impossible heist. Keeping all the details of the plan close to his ever-present vest, Kaz hires a spy he calls The Wraith, a sharpshooter with a gambling problem, a Grisha Heartrender, a soldier who wants to kill the Grisha, and a rich kid with a penchant for explosives. Combining their various talents, they intend to break into the world‚Äôs most impenetrable prison and kidnap the scientist responsible for the dangerous drug that I‚Äôll just refer to as ‚ÄúGrisha meth‚Äù.If all the main characters in Six of Crows weren‚Äôt teenagers, this would definitely read as adult fiction. I never regarded any of them on the same level as the pimply-faced immature high schoolers that run around in my house. All the characters have a hard luck story or monumental event that made them grow up fast. Throughout the book we learn their personal stories, some are incredibly sad and unfair. But, in the end, it‚Äôs what made them who they are: interesting, resilient, criminal and ultimately dangerous. Heartbreakers that they are, I fell in love with all of them.A masterful storyteller and creative writer with a clever sense of humor, Bardugo is one of my favorite authors. As much as I adored The Grisha Trilogy, I absolutely love the dirty and gritty beauty of Six of Crows. And, I need to have the next book soon.

This is an author I have just recently come across and I am enthralled with her writing. Her stories are creatively drawn with memorable characters and gorgeous prose. Her works are a fantastic mix of fantasy and horror with just the right amount of spiritual element that makes her writing beautiful and complex.I have already ordered the next novella in this series.

Apparently this is Bissell‚Äôs first venture with a robotic vacuum and although I am generally pleased with it‚Äôs performance, their prototype still has a few bugs that need to be ironed out.When the vacuum first arrives, the large lithium battery needs to be wall-charged for up to five hours. When it has been thoroughly charged, then you can set up the docking station, which contains a digital clock and can be programmed with a schedule for time and the days that you want the robot to automatically start cleaning. This is where I had trouble. The instructions are mostly geared towards how to use a remote control to do this, but this vacuum does not come with the remote. It took me a few days to figure out how to program it but I finally got it.Resembling a large crab or maybe a gigantic bug, the Bissell creeps along the floor with two rotating side brushes that sweep debris towards the undercarriage brush, and then suctions it up into a small removable case that reminds me of a Tupperware sandwich box. This needs to be cleaned daily or the vacuum will stop moving when it is full. Initially I found the motor to be quite noisy but I have since grown used to it. One thing to note is that this vacuum is not meant for cleaning enormous dust balls or large amounts of dirt. If your house is like mine, it was a good idea to first clean the floors with a regular vacuum and then use the robot for daily upkeep.There is a battery-operated monitor you can place on the floor in any area that the robot is not allowed; it‚Äôs like an invisible fence. But there is only one monitor available. It has a ‚Äúcliff-sensing‚Äù device on the robot that will prevent it from falling down the stairs and that works rather well except for the time it went out my backdoor and attempted to escape down the back steps. I have since learned to shut the backdoor.The robot itself can be programmed for two suction powers. It has four different vacuum patterns to choose from or you can program all four if you want.
