Update: Last night I updated the software on my Fire TV and played this game. I haven't played it enough to say it won't freeze again but last night it worked fine for the amount of time I was on. If it continues to run without issue I will update my rating. The last paragraph still holds but at least the game is functioning correctly at this time. Anyone else notice a difference??Not sure where the rave reviews are coming from. Worked great for a while then it started freezing and throwing me out of the fishing portion. Next I had a problem with the sound of the clicking reel refusing to turn off even after the program was closed. I had to reboot the whole system.I uninstalled the program and then reinstalled. It worked for a short while and then the same issues occurred.While it worked there were also some things that made it less than fun. Your line breaks constantly until you can win enough competitions to buy stronger line. When the line breaks you lose your lure. Winning is hard because your competition catches HUGE weights of fish. Your first purchase of line isn't that expensive (or useful) After the  first purchase, the price goes up to hundreds of dollars. Nothing about the price of things is even slightly realistic. About then you start getting the game glitches and the rest is history...see above.

Well made, sturdy metal construction does the job. Note that it does not contain any rubber parts to grip the scarves. I usually loop my through themselves to make sure they don't slip off. Nice to have everything in one place.

I waited eagerly for this film to come out.  The book was fabulous on so many levels. It asked thought provoking questions about the relationship between men and women, women and women, and humans and animals and it even included questions for discussion at the end. Everything that was intriguing or thought provoking in the book is missing. What replaces it is are shots of Scarlett Johansson staring into space, with and without clothes. Seriously, that is a major part of the film. This film goes beyond slow to tedious. The only thing that kept me watching was the hope that the story I'd read would suddenly burst forth...it never happened. You might as well turn off the volume and treat it as an abstract art film.Perhaps the biggest initial turn-off was the choice of Johansson. In the book, Isserley was not a beautiful woman, having been (painfully) engineered to feature the large breasts that would cause men to leer at a plain girl with the thick glasses she required to see on earth. That fact made the culling of the hunky men she chose much more palatable. They were to a large extent the victim of their intentions to use someone. The objectification of women was a large part of the story. Isserley was also constantly reflecting on her environment. Her alien insights were intriguing, something not captured by the dull stares they were replaced with in the film.In the end, what takes the place of depth and story line is a very slow and repetitive movie interspersed with a bit of fancy CGI. A group of alien men on motorcycles occasionally zip around to clean up any details left behind by her abductions but that is as action oriented as it gets. Forget this one...I already have.

I bought this to go kayaking after all the great reviews and own two of them. It is nice looking and well made but it rides up and ends up under my chin when I'm in my boat. I have to constantly lean forward and pull it down. The same thing has happened to other women who have used it to come out with me. The three side adjustments are great to get a good fit but don't help at all with "ride up". I am also a small woman. I don't think this vest would work as well for a large or large busted woman. Any women out there know of a better Kayak vest??

This stuff stopped my hot flashes cold in just a few days. No side effects at all. There are many issues that come with menopause like heart palpitations, dizziness and  insomnia. I didn't have any of the other effects so I can't say if it stopped those as well. I've shared this secret with friends and they rave about it.

With healthy ingredients like Chia Seeds, coconut water and blueberries, the book has a good array of healthy, nutritious and tasty smoothies. The smoothies are arrange by month of the year with winter months relying a good bit on hemp milk...which I could not find. One draw back is the use of orange Juice based drinks which can pile on the carbs. It has a brief glossary in the front that lists the ingredients but doesn't provide any help in finding some of them, specifically the "Holy Basil" which I can only find in capsule form. Emptying a capsule into your smoothie doesn't sound very appetizing. I would much rather add it to my garden.  It does provide info on how to process berries, basil and other ingredients.

This is not just another recipe book. If that is what you are looking for, you will find much of the book boring and/or lacking. It is an entire approach to creating a healthy alkaline system. There are recipe's in the back but most of the book concerns explanations of what alkalinity is and how to manage your eating by knowing not only what to eat but when and how much. It goes much deeper into the science of health than the average person may wish to delve and even includes a pack of PH strips to chart your progress. With so many "get well quick books" on the market, this appears on first glance to be the ugly duckling of the diet world. But the American obsession with instant gratification has not convinced the body to change its biology. Good nutrition and health take time. This is a system that builds health over time.

This is a fun little book. It gives you the original ethnic recipes for many of your favorite foods as well as where to eat them should you go to the country and want the best in town. Each recipe has an intro page composed over a color photograph and a paragraph or two dedicated to "What is it?", Origin, Tasting and Finding it. While this is a great book for travelers and the creator, Lonely Planet, is all about exotic travel, it would have been nice to include some links to local sources for the ingredients as not all can be found in the average store.

At first it at least worked on my Fire TV but then it started quitting and bumping back to the main screen once I bought lures. The game itself is very limited. You can't move the boat and have limited casting options and no speed reel-in when you want to recast. The first upgrade to lures and line are cheap but then the price quickly goes up to a ridiculous amount. $300 for line or a bass lure???Once you win enough to buy the good stuff, (and given the limitations- the win is more luck than skill),  all it takes is one broken line to lose the lure. You don't have an option to release the line, only lower the pole and reel. So a snag a big fish and your line with your $300 lure snaps! Skip this unless you really like to spin the right button with your thumb for hours on end.And one more annoying thing this is now doing...The line makes a whirring noise...When the program glitches and throws you back to the main screen...even if you EXIT the program the sound continues. Call up a movie the sound continues over the film. You have to UNPLUG your Fire TV and restart it to stop the App...Total pain!

I love Vimeo and watch it all the time on my Sony DVD player, which has internet and Wifi. The lack of a search feature on this app for for my Amazon Fire TV is a huge drawback. Youtube works fine and is searchable, but Vimeo, which in my opinion, has much better quality and caters to creative work, is a total dud.I would rather have paid a nominal fee for an app with a search engine than to get what amounts to a teaser of staff picks with an invitation to join Vimeo... and then still be extremely limited. I really hate those kind of "surprises". Don't waste your hard drive space.

Combine Super Mario Brothers with better graphics driven by the "idea" of Memory Control and you have Remember me. The concept of Memory Control is not a big part of the majority of actions you are asked to perform. They are a quick and easy button push on "missions" while you spend the majority of your time "fighting" without using your powers at all. That doesn't even make sense. If she is so good a memory blanking why doesn't she blank the memories of guards and other adversaries you are constantly meeting?And you spend most of your time jumping, running and fighting along a predetermined path while trying to get to the next cut scene..thus the Mario Brothers reference. Along the way you learning new fighting moves. How does that differ from even the earliest XBOX games?? So what are the challenges...when precision moves are required to travel between destinations (that don't really qualify as "missions"), the game suddenly skews your controls slightly to make it harder to get there. Add to that a few puzzles that involving moving across signs with flipping parts. Once you realize that moving along ledges IS the better part of the game, those are annoying enough to cause you to put your controller down and read a good book. This is fun????Fighting and killing is pretty boring at this point, especially given the advanced capabilities of platforms like Xbox and PlayStation to provide true character interaction and growth. And hey...you didn't buy this game with the promise of more head bashing. You wanted to use your brain more than your thumb. Forget it! If we all refuse to accept violence in the place of creativity maybe the gaming industry will wake up. I expected better from Capcom.

I haven't used all of the features on this projector but for projecting my art work and movies on my bedroom wall it rocks!! My bedroom is lavender and while a white background gives the best image, you really don't notice the tint at all. It projects a 4 foot by 7 foot image from about 8 feet away with great color. The only thing I wish it had was an audio OUT. Devices that operate only with HDMI connectivity often lack other audio options. Since I use Fire TV with this, neither of them offers an audio out other than HDMI No earphone jack means you are stuck with the sound from the projector.The sound quality of the unit is good for movies and light music listening but it is not engineered to provide superior sound. That isn't something you really expect from a projector. And one problem I found is that it gets louder in increments that are rather large so one level is a bit low and the next too high for late evening listening if others sleeping.

Quadrille pads can be very pricey. I don't need a high quality vellum for most of the projects and sketches I do, so this pack is great. You have the option of using 1/4 or 1/8 squares (front and back). The plastic reinforcement strip is also a very nice touch if you want to store things in a binder and use them often. One star off because some of the pagers are lighter than others. Every other page seemed to be printed slightly lighter though this should not present a problem to someone with normal or near normal eyesight. For what I do that kind of uniformity is not important.

This is handy for keeping track of student requests, and daily reminders.  The pages are also scored to tear out easily when I need to take a roll or attach a note to student work. The cover is heavy enough to keep the contents protected as my book bag tends to mash things up a bit. Good overall value, especially for the price.

I lost a cousin to AIDS who could have greatly benefited from the supplement regime in this movie. Sadly, his father worked for what should have been the best of all places, a major pharmaceutical company. He believed in the flawed system shown in this film. Watch this for the great acting and the great information.Our access to a variety of supplements and natural products like raw milk and cheese from local farmers is being taken away from us by an FDA/USDA run for the purposes of major drug, agricultural and biotech companies. This film shows one of the many tragic results. When it comes to food and drugs, I believe in informed consent, not bans and fines. Seeing this film will teach you a lot about the dangers of letting drug companies supersede human rights.  If you want more info on the plot, there are many reviews here that give you that. I think it is such a wonderful educational opportunity that I want to comment mostly on the FDA aspect. Please note that this review will likely receive negative comments touting  the wonders of the FDA . There are people paid to do that and I have seen them show up every time big pharma is questioned. I don't get paid to answer them and won't waste my time.I'm surprised that Big Pharma allowed this film to be made. They are THAT powerful. As coincidence would have it, I finally got around to watching it shortly after learning that it had long been known, in another country, that a substance in Soy could treat AIDS. Note that is REAL SOY, not the GMO, "Round Up Ready", stuff we have here which is rich in pesticide residue. Why were we not told about this years ago?? Who is REALLY protecting our health and well-being. Certainly NOT the FDA. As this film shows, it only protects the drug patents of major U.S. manufacturers and biotech companies and much of medicine supports it for financial gain.Only last week, the FDA had approved a pain killer so lethal that states are now moving to ban it. How protective of human life is that?? If you don't already know, the FDA with its Corporate Dons, like former policy maker for Monsanto Micheal Taylor, (over food) and  Virginia Weldon (former Monsanto VP for public policy) now on the FDA Endocrinologic and Metabolic Drugs Advisory Committee have been running a virtual war on supplements for decades.The reason is simple. Many of them work really well and most are from natural products which have to be synthesized to be patented. If they haven't figured out how to defy nature (the process of synthesizing often has side effects not present in the original) they don't want to see a natural drug that works on the market.  It is also easy to dissuade people from using them because most natural remedies work over time and don't have the immediate punch the pharmaceutical companies like to advertise. But your body doesn't like to be "punched". The movie illustrates that very well as the effects of AZT devastate patients in the early trials...This while the medical industry, which benefits financially from participation in these studies...gladly touted their worth...least they not be asked to do another.Symptomatic treatments that do nothing to enhance the body's immune system or replace vital nutrients do not create health. They create drug dependence. In a truly free society, informed consent would be the norm. Now go watch the film and tell your friends to watch it too.

This works on my Kindle fire but the interpretation is really very vague and it tries to function as an oracle telling everything will be fine in the future. So it says something like, you have had trouble with love (who hasn't) ,but in the future you will have much love. Not terribly enlightening.

Bought some of this last week and the buns loved it! It is probably a good treat for their teeth as well. However it makes a much smaller but harder to clean mess than hay. My buns own the kitchen and I always have hay in their bin. They love to scatter it everywhere but I can rake it up fairly easily with a fur broom. The problem here is that instead of rake ready hay, they reduce it to small bits of hay less then a half inch which is much harder to clean. They say on the package that it has 80% less hay dust...and it does, until they eat it. Not sure how this will work for hay allergies. Maybe someone else can chime in on that.
I got this to follow earthquakes and volcanos on my kindle Fire. It shows the earthquakes okay but when I ask it to show volcanos it immediately crashes.

I bought this game because it looked relaxing. I opened it and found I could use my game controller to start the game but it didn't affect anything after the game started. I sat there and watched the black things eat the white the things with no clue how to stop it or even what the objective or strategy was minus the controller working. With no directions to rely on I restarted the game several times hoping that my remote would finally work. I gave it one last go and figured out that I was watching an introductory demo. Would be nice if they provided a bit of instruction.

I bought this program from the Sony Website because I have Vegas Pro 12 and wanted to add more effects. I watched several promo videos and was impressed with what it could do.  So I downloaded it and went to the site, hoping to find a downloadable manual I could use to orient myself.  I found the only written material was comprised of short articles on the various parts of the program. Each was only a page or two long but contained numerous imbedded links. I've seen other online tutorials use this style and it is not a good way to learn. You can't automatically see what you are looking for without opening multiple screens. That gets very tedious and time consuming.There are many video tutorials available but all that I have seen suffer a huge flaw. The Hitfilm interface has too many small drop down menus which are nearly impossible to see on a video. I even enlarged some of the screens with my projector but then the menu items became too fuzzy to read. Going back and forth between youtube and your Hitfilm screen while trying to figure out which menu the instructional video just opened can drive you batty. It would help if the videos did a pop-up of the area being accessed so you can actually see what is being clicked....and SLOW down the delivery. It would also help if they don't jump from set up to finished render as if that magically happens! I hope the Infinite Skills company produces a training video for this at some point. They can at times go TOO slow but that is better than the unrelated bits and pieces approach provided here via videos.

What is Green Building? What materials have the best insulative properties? How do you control condensation when working with a highly insulated interior? What are the best kinds of green energy sources and what can you expect from them? Highly insulated buildings can have problems their less climate controlled cousins do not. Adding a new window? How much will it add to your homes heating and cooling bills?I have purchased several books on solar power and building energy efficient homes, but this one has the best range of useful information. Much of the book is dedicated to systems of heating and cooling. While the book discusses insulated concrete form construction I knocked off one star because I was hoping it would mention more about insulating container homes which are growing in popularity and are very safe and weather resistant, especially in areas prone to tornado and hurricane activity.

Anyone who builds homes, or is having a home built should have this book. It is filled with useful detailed information about everything from foundation types to wall construction and types, roof structures, HVAC, water and floor heaters and even carpet  and flooring installation. I have book on concrete, wood and steel construction but everything in them is right here. It even tells you where and how a well should be drilled.  It covers an amazing amount of information at bargain basement prices. I wore out my old copy of Architectural Graphic Standards, this is a great, up to date replacement.

I will have to now use my game controller and hope it works for everything. Never had a remote go out before the first battery change before... I also can't search Vimeo on this like I can on my Sony. The voice feature may wow some people, but do I want Amazon having a voice profile on me and my kids?...No, not in this era of privacy encroachment. They claim the more you use it the more they refine it. Guess that means that over time they could reverse the process and sound just like me?  Maybe for a fee they will one day make my unpleasant phone calls?Add to this the fact that it has almost NO memory 8G...So forget about having many games. You have to remove them to add new ones.Update:I've had to reboot the system once to fix an error message that said it could not load videos and one of my programs. I've started cutting power to it when not in use and haven't seen the issue again.I use the Fire with a projector upstairs and the fact that Fire only has one HDMI out means that I can't channel audio separately and must use the projector speaker since most projectors assume the device controller has the audio out. I still have my Sony Blu ray Wifi downstairs and like it better because I can also hit the net and play actual DVD's.And oh yeah....my remote died..

This book has two parts. Linda's description comes across as sincere and is told in story form as if you were sitting across the table from her having coffee. She is obviously a real person who experienced some extraordinary things. Her co-author may be a great guy but this is one of many books he sells and he doesn't have anything to say that adds to Linda's retelling. Great half a book!

Funky Slippin' like you have never heard it! Reminds me of the kind of New Orleans neighborhood singing that always gets turned to vanilla before it hits mainstream. They kept the soul, the sax, and the whole ball of wax here!

The program is useful and easy to learn as long as you want to build a conventional home with an ordinary roof. If you want to get creative and build a barrel roof you are out of luck. If you want a round concrete home like a monolithic dome with a half sphere roof...no go. I have had three versions of this program over the years and it amazes me that they seem to take away rather than add to the design features. I know my oldest, cheapo, Home Designer had a simple barn-like roof and a slanted roof you could just click on. Now you have to do 5 steps to achieve the slanted and I couldn't make the barrel roof I wanted at all. I've always wanted to combine a steel barrel roof with a container home...can't do it with this and I don't even think their full program  can do it. The roof is a general pain...it even auto assigns a roof to the first floor and it you click ceiling you auto get a roof...What if I want a deck above??? You have to remove the roof regardless of what you are doing on the second floor unless it is an exact copy of the size of the bottom floor. That gets old.  Yet, this is by far one of the better products for everyday use. I really wish they would add a few perks for the younger designer who doesn't want to live in a McMansion.

These cards would work better if they were oversized like the Starseed Tarot, The large color reproductions of the major arcana found in the accompanying booklet are very engaging but, even though the imagery is beautiful, there is too much of it and meanings tend to lose themselves in a sea of decorate patterns. This works well for the single oriental figure in the nine of Pentacles (and cards with only one figure in general), but not so well for the five and six of Wands. Aside from that the cards are thick and well made with gold edges.The box is sturdy and the 5" by 7 3/4 " full color booklet easy to read and well illustrated. The meanings are close approximations of the Rider Waite and four spreads are provided and explained. I have tried doing a few spreads with them but found them to lack the kind of instant intuitive connection I get with most decks. The reason for that is explained above. The decorative aspect is overwhelming. Depending on which cards you select you can find your eyes swimming in a sea of detail that takes a while to settle down into meaning. I'm sure anyone could get used to reading with these, but I have been reading for almost four decades have put them away for safe keeping as a collector's item.

When I first got this book I had a hard time making myself start the read. It is mostly writing with a few black and white pictures and when it mentioned Damanhur and Findhorn I began to assume that it was really a collection of well advertised commercial communities and didn't have much to offer someone wanting to start one. I'm glad I was wrong!She gives the location of the book's website where you can find lots of great pictures of each community and the information she discusses is not by any stretch of the imagination, a commercial. While she is an academic with credentials in the field of sustainability, the writing is aimed at the causal reader. It is very down to earth and deals with the real issues that affect starting an alternative community. She spent two week at each of these places and writes from the perspective of someone who learns not only about their culture, but about the very human problems that crop up when people attempt to live with more than 10 or 20 of your closest friends.The problems are similar in some ways. People who choose to live an alternative lifestyle have to be strong enough in their beliefs to walk away from the flock. That very strength can make them uncompromising. One community, "Earthhaven"  had 50 members when a major problem arose. The state of South Caroline closed its borders to over night guests because it was using water from a spring which it deemed to be unsanitary. Arguments arose from purists in the group who felt that drilling a water well was desecrating the Earth. Since they derived operating funds from their educational outreach this quickly led to financial issues. As you might imagine, people being passionate about beliefs can cause many issues. Can a Vegan eat next to someone who has free range chicken on their plate? Not always. As one director put it, they don't HAVE to accept compromise at this point. In a real emergency food and water situation people would probably be more accepting of each other. As things stand, people are still free to squabble, disagree and leave.The communities themselves vary greatly as well. Italy's Damanhur, a spiritual community led by its charismatic leader Falco, appears to be heavily funded and features smartphones for everyone and a molecular biology lab to test GMO food. While it does research into sustainable foods, I was glad to see she didn't fall in love with Damanhur. I was initially wowed by its underground temples until an Italian friend shared some not so spiritual information about Falco's financial dealings.Other communities, like Colufifa in Senegal, are on the other end of the spectrum, existing with very little in the way of funds. Colufifa represents an alliance of 350 West African villages dedicated to organic farming, adult literacy and microfinancing. Each of the fourteen villages she visits has its problems and perks, with most of the problems involving either groups of people within the village transitioning to different mindsets or collisions with existing laws and culture. It also seems that unless they want to make lots of money or take on a social problem...there isn't a lot of support for these groups in our corporate world.  Except for the well-established and funded like Damanhur, Findhorn and Auroville in India, most are finding their way a day at a time. Her discussions of the economies of the smaller ecovillages are well worth your reading time if you have any interest in creating an alternative community.

This turns my backpack into a mini file cabinet. I can easily access all 5 inclosed folders without having to pull everything out. The flip top filing is very convenient and each folder is open across the top and one side but sealed on the bottom so the contents doesn't end up slipping down and getting lost in the bottom. Great for students who need to keep work for several classes filled. The  thick plastic shell should hold up well.

LOVE THESE...Not only do they work as normal file folders but the three pockets inside work great to separate handouts from student papers and test keys when I take them to class. The genius idea of cutting a "V" at the top corner which can be flipped up and placed over the inner edge of the papers is a welcome addition as well. No tipping over your folder and watching in horror as everything tumbles out!!

I collect decks and have over one hundred. I like to purchase decks that are unusual in some way. Unfortunately, many of those are unusable because they stray too far from the original meanings of the cards without calling themselves an "oracle" rather than a tarot deck. So the question for me when purchasing a deck becomes; is the art work worth having regardless of its value as a tarot and does it pull off that rare combination of unusual beauty and insightful readability? I'm happy to say that Starseed does both with an added bonus.With many improvements geared to a more spiritual take on worldly events, the deck is still recognizable for those used to the traditional Rider Waite. The suits are changed as follows: Orbs=Swords, Chalices=Cups, Crystals=Pentacles and Fire=Wands but most of the cards retain the essential elements of their original imagery. This means it is accessible to fairly new readers and even beginners. One issue with the Rider Waite that can limit new reader's interpretations is its reference throughout the minor arcana to strictly mundane rather than spiritual events. If you want to know the basic who, what, and where of a situation, the minor cards and people cards will usually give you a fairly accurate description of an event. While this pleases and even wows most people who want a reading, those seeking to solve personal issues with a spiritual base will be less served. The non-material value of that event is usually lost unless the reader is astute enough to ask the right questions or intuitive enough to see deeply into the person's life philosophy.In most decks, while the traditional meanings of the Ace through ten cards focus on their value as external events, it is left to the major arcana to inject spirituality, and to the reader to figure out just what that relationship is. Experienced readers who have done their own inner work can usually bridge the gap, but new readers run the risk of adhering too literally to the card images and missing the "big picture." This disconnect is well bridged both by the cards and the booklet that Cori provides.A good example of the differences in Cori's cards and interpretations is the infamous Seven or Swords. It normally depicts a sly looking person running off with a bunch of swords. Its traditional meaning is duplicity, a thief in your midst who works behind the scenes to steal the swords, or means of victory. As morning dawns the opponent has no weapons with which to fight. Scenarios come to mind of everything from a lying boyfriend to the corporate espionage of Wall Street. It is easy to point fingers when this card comes up. We have a rogue in our midst! He needs to be discovered or something of value will be taken. What is left out of the discussion is the whole idea of grasping as a way of life.Cori's interpretation for the seven of Orbs (Swords) focuses on the weight of things being taken rather than just the taker.  In the Starseed we see a man in a balloon trying to grab all the orbs in the sky. He does not realize that this will surely crash his balloon and make him a prisoner of his own greed. So the meaning of the card is shifted slightly. Instead of arousing our need to punish a bad guy, we are asked to contemplate the spiritual weight of his greed. In this way we are both warned about the proclivities of the person in question and asked to consider the real cost to ourselves of hanging on to the thing we risk losing. Many of the minor cards in the Starseed have been given a similar twist from material to spiritual consideration.Changes to the major arcana are many and will delight readers who find traditional images like the Hierophant being depicted as a Pope limiting. Cori starts with a replacement for the Fool in the form of a ball of energy that looks like a meteor descending toward a group of crystals. I like this image better than the hapless, medieval image of a cosmic clown because it suggests the descent of an informed spiritual intention entering the world of matter (remember Crystals=Pentacles the traditional earth suit). It also transforms the Fool from a card of choice of paths to one of remembrance and reuniting with one's soul mission.The Magician is also transformed. Traditionally his raised arm channels universal forces to do his bidding in the world. Here he becomes an Indigo child with images of the earth for eyes. The Magician's dominion over all the suits has changed slightly. He has become the force the Magician conjured and is no longer beholding to rituals and manipulation of forces. There is no need to reach outside him, only to wisely use that which has been given. Other major arcana cards which have undergone name changes are Temperance=Alchemy, Judgment=Karma, Death=Transition, Devil=Shadow, World=Ascension, Emperor=Reason, Empress=Abundance. And then there is my personal favorite Hierophant=Guidance; the idea that we do not need human intermediaries between ourselves and the creator, nor a King-like god to rule over us is a concept whose time has definitely come.The main drawback to these cards, especially when being used to do readings for others is finding a space large enough to spread them out and having hands big enough to shuffle them.  Cori has stated that she wanted them to be large enough to use for meditation. They are that and printed on quality stock with a very nice slick finish. They also come in a very sturdy box all at a bargain price given the quality. However, I do hope that at some point this deck is offered in two sizes, one being a pocket edition, like the Thoth Tarot.

I wasn't sure what to make of "Book of Heaven" when I first started to read it. The language was a little too poetic for me. I was worried I would never read a sentence that flowed in a straight-forward manner. But after I cleared the initial description of the new constellations, the four stories flowed easily.  I absolutely loved the book and the deep insight the author showed into the human condition. Storace masterfully captures the arrogance that can accompany religious dogma and how it infects those who deem themselves "one with God". It shines a harsh light on the sins of patriarchy as well as those men and women who draw power from it.  It also delves deep into the souls and means of women whose lives depend on reading every nuance of their master's mood.  There are so many great quotes in this book that make you stop and ponder. One of my favorites is "For it is said we wait for God's judgment in the life to come; but our lives here are our judgment of God." And that is not to say that this book is for people interested in religion. It is about the ways in which various beliefs create culture and give rise to privilege.I don't want to include spoilers but the various races encountered in this book ask us to consider some serious questions about where our own culture is going, especially the Angelican's who destroy so much while calling it a quest for "Paradise."

In an era of superstar electronics that can make anyone sound like they have perfect pitch and allow them to sing in perfect harmony with themselves, the backup singer is being lost. What is leaving with them is the reason human's first raised their voices together, the musical soul. I loved this movie from start to finish. Everyone in this film has the voice of a megastar...but most didn't want to play the game and  lack the narcissism that often passes for talent. My favorite parts of the film were when they did short impromptu harmonies that you could literally feel in your body.

This beautiful illustrated and written children's book by Nancy Tillman describes how love will find its way to a child no matter wherever they are. Nancy Tillman's children's books are about love, happiness, and joy in the child's existence. No matter where you are in the world or universe, my love will find a way it to state that. No matter how far apart a child is away from a loved one, love will find a way to their heart.Separation makes the heart fonder when loved ones are apart whether on earth or elsewhere. It's a very touching book about separation between a child and parent or grandparent. Nancy Tillman sends positive, inspirational messages and illustrates loving portraits of life at large.

Nancy Tillman beautifully intertwines colorful illustrations and words to be inspirational to any reader when young or old. This book describes how the child's birth is special to the universe at large in the world. No child or baby is unwanted but loved, cared, and nurtured by the world around him or her. This book sends a very positive and inspirational message to the reader.

This book is for my sister's first baby and a baby shower gift. The book comes with a gold lace to tie the book together. The pages are beautifully designed to accompany the baby's arrival and first year of his or her life. This book covers the milestones in that precious first year of the baby's life. This book would make a great present or gift for shower, christening, or for the baby in the future.

You can use this tote for various carrying. You can use the tote for carrying laundry. It depends on what you want to use it for. I believe it's impractical for groceries especially heavy items. I would use it for lighter items instead. It's big and ideal for laundry, towels, and lighter items. Heavy items like cans and glass bottles depends on the user.

Melissa Manchester is a wonderful American female vocalist. She sings every song here with every breath and syllable into the songwriter's lyrics with clarity and brilliance. It is a shame that Melissa Manchester isn't as popular today. I always confuse her with Maureen McGovern (another great female vocalist). This collection of her recorded hits include "Through The Eyes of Love" for an ice skating movie. Every song here is sung with clarity, emotional, and passion with perfect execution from Melissa herself.If you want a great collection of Melissa Manchester's greatest hits, you will enjoy this CD. The hits are mostly here and others that you may have missed in her long career. About twenty recorded hits in high quality are all here to enjoy and listen too whether in the car or at home or at work. Melissa's voice will soothe and calm those stressful days.

Gerald McRaney and Jameson Parker played Richard and Andrew Simon, brothers and partners in a small private detective agency in San Diego, California. They were well-casted to play brothers who were opposites in personality. AJ was more straight laced and attractive while Richard was the older and streetwise brother. The series would last eight long seasons. The first season was only 13 episodes which signals that this series was a midseason replacement for CBS in the early eighties.The appeal of the series is both the believable relationship between the brothers and their cases. In 1981, crime dramas were less violent and mild compared to today's crime dramas. If there is any blood shed in the first season, it's minimal. Most of the episodes were surrounded by cases about robbery, burglary, stolen identities, kidnapping, and rarely murder if any in the episodes. The episodes were crafted to have a chase or the big reveal. The series has it's light-hearted moments in the first season.Gerald McRaney and Jameson Parker should have been nominated for Emmys for their performances. I enjoyed the supporting cast of Jeannie Wilson and Mother Simon played by Mary Carver. There were plenty of notable guest stars like Ruta Lee, Natalie Schaefer, Peter Graves, Markie Post, and others in the first season. San DIego played a character in the series and the location's appealThe four discs include the thirteen episodes and a special look back at television in the 1980s.

Mei Fong's non-fiction account of how the one child policy has effected China in all aspects of life. Before the policy was instituted, the Chinese population was nearing one billion. The Chinese government felt it best to limit a couple to one child unless they are twins or triplets. The government instituted the policy and had enforced it heavily. The book covers all avenues of the one child policy especially when a catastrophic earthquake wiped thousands of only children and their parents resort to reverse sterilization and have another child. The author also explains how the country has millions of eligible single men and a drought of eligible single women.Mei Fong fuses her own personal experience as a Chinese American journalist and woman in China. The horror stories of forced abortions and infanticide is barbaric even if it is policy or law. The Chinese have become aware of the ramifications for such harsh policy. Thousands of Chinese girls were adopted abroad and left a void in their population.If you want to know how the one child policy turned out in China, this book is informative and shocking to readers. But as a reader, you understand how a country wanted to control their population from spinning out of control. The government never thought about how and who would care for those growing older at a rapid rate and a birth rate lower than mortality rate.

Richard Briers and Susan Hampshire play Hector and Molly MacDonald, the Lord and Lair in Scotland. When Richard's Hector has a minor accident, Molly calls for their prodigal son, Archie, to come home to the Highlands from London, England. In a British television season, 6 to 8 episodes are the norm so the cast also get to have acting jobs in theatre, movies, or other television shows. Richard Briers was a British television icon known for his offbeat humor but you can't help but love his character. Susan Hampshire is regal, classic and a wonderful actress as Lady of the Manor.Archie is well played by an up and coming actor. He does a terrific job in playing the conflicted character between his London life and his Scottish heritage. Katrina is also played well by the actress as the local teacher who has a crush on Archie. His London girlfriend and business partner, Justine, conflicts the situation in a love triangle. The eight episodes feature the on location in Scotland and it is majestic beauty. You just want to visit there. Glenbogle, Scotland is the total opposite of urban London, England.The show would last for a few more seasons. The first season includes 2 DVDs and includes a tour of the estate set for the location. The drama is melodramatic and there is light humor along the way as well. There are serious issues like Archie's late brother, Jamie, and his death; Katrina's paternity; and local politics. You can't help but fall in love with the series and the location onscreen.

Katrina Nannestad was raised and lives in Australia with her family. She writes Inge Maria Jensen, a ten year old girl from Copenhagen, Denmark who moves to Bornholm island after her mother's death. She moves in with her grandmother.Inge Maria is like any other Danish girl in 1911 before World War I. She must first deal with getting to know her maternal grandmother all over again. They barely know each other. Inge Maria is a playful and lively child. She must adapt to her new home and new school and life without her mother.I enjoyed and highly recommend this book to young readers and even adults. The author writes with knowledge of life in 1911 and in Denmark. If you enjoyed reading Anne of Green Gables and Pippi Longstocking, you will immensely enjoy this book. It is only about a 120 pages and an easy read for all ages.

This adorable children's novel is about a four legged red earth monster living with humans. Ruffleclaw sleeps during the day and has a ghastly diet. Tommy, the young boy, who lives in the house with his human parents befriends him. The problem is his mother doesn't want an earth monster after he attacked her.Tommy misses his earth monster and will have to come up with a plan and reason to keep him. The novel is adorable and believable. Young readers will enjoy it immensely. The illustrations are also enjoyable too. They're lively and colorful.

Alex Haley wrote two best selling books, "The Autobiography of Malcolm X" and "Roots" in his lifetime. This biography describes and explains this complicated writer through good and bad times.This biography details his obstacles and tribulations in life becoming a writer and a best selling author. The biographer explores his critics and the accusations about plagiarism towards "Roots."Haley was a successful lecturer too and "Roots" took years to write based on research and his obligations. Some people especially critics and skeptics are going to tear into "Roots" about its flaws whether minor or major by does it really matter."Roots" changed American culture in understanding the past history of slavery and life for African Americans who were captured, enslaved, and brought to America against their will to be slaves. Haley's "Roots" was about the African American family experience and history. Not only was it a runaway best seller but "Roots" became television history. Despite the script and book differences, the main message of "Roots" remains the same.Sadly the outcries and accusations about plagiarism hurts Alex Haley's legacy. He deserves to be praised for his accomplishments. His two books have sold millions and deserves to be assigned reading African American Literature classes in colleges or high schools.I find this biography to be a refreshing account of an extraordinary writer and author. I found the writing to be honest, critical, and candid. I also felt the biographer enjoyed his subject as well. If only Alex had lived longer to see the first African American President to be elected to the White House.

Barbara Cook is better known for her concerts than her history as an actress and singer in musical theatre. She was one of the promising stars in 1954 and she has not disappointed audiences and listeners everywhere.Barbara Cook has recorded hundreds of songs and is better known for her renditions of musical theatre classics. When Cook sings a song, it becomes hers. She owns it all her own. She has a voice suited to express the songwriter's intentions in every syllable, breath or word.This CD may not be her best but is better than others out there. Her selection of music is interesting and even here. I'm not familiar with "She Loves Me" Broadway musical. I can't praise Barbara Cook enough.

Barbara Cook has led a remarkable career in music and theatre. This two disc CD set pays tribute to theatrical legend Stephen Sondheim, songwriter, lyricist and genius. With help from friends like Malcolm Gets, a guest vocalist, and Cook's professional musical partner and accompanist Wally Harper.Cook doesn't just sing but provides a delightful background in explaining the selections. She doesn't talk down to the audience but too them like friends. Cook not only performs each song with masterful precision but perfectly. Cook's voice alone has inspired other songwriters.Barbara Cook is every songwriter's dream to interpret a song particularly from musical theatre with depth, precision, and passion so effortlessly. Stephen Sondheim must have been honored to have Barbara Cook pay tribute at New York City's Carnegie Hall. It was one legend paying tribute to anotherI believe Barbara Cook's rendition of "Send in the Clowns" to be the best ever on record. If you love this song as much as I do, you will love her rendition.

Barbara Cook's Christmas collection is long overdue but a combination of warmth, love, and sound. Barbara Cook is one of America's most beloved female vocalists. She has been honored with the Kennedy Center Honors for a lifetime of music and theatre. She is better known for cabaret and singing worldwide.She became well known for playing Marian the librarian in the classic Broadway  musical, "The Music Man." Ever since then, Barbara Cook has been the ideal female voice for generations. She brings her passion, fire and love for music.This holiday collection has been added to my favorite holiday albums. Cook's holiday album was long overdue after a career onstage and teaching master classes at Juilliard School of Music in New York.

"The Hurt Locker" is a rare war film done by a female director named Kathryn Bigelow, James Cameron's ex wife. Bigelow has directed a war film about a team dismantling bombs in Iraq. Jeremy Renner leads the squad and his character has a record of dismantling bombs. Renner is terrific as the leader. His performance can be difficult to watch at times. He deserved his Academy Award nomination for Best Actor. The rest of the cast do award winning performances as well.The film has difficult scenes to watch for the squeamish. War is hell onscreen and offscreen but you can't help watching this film. It is bleak but not hopeless. They filmed Iraq scenes in Jordan. The film is about two hours long but engrossing to watch in that span. The film won 6 Academy Awards including Best Picture and Best Director. Bigelow was the first female to win this award.In fact, Bigelow is my kind of female director. She does difficult topics like war rather than traditional female subjects. It is nice to see a female director in charge for a change and win accolades for it.My biggest complaint is the lack of features for this DVD. There is only one feature behind the making of the film.

Barbara Cook is an incredible songstress and vocalist of the master class. She teaches master lasses at Juilliard School of Music in New York City. She has been performing whether in a cabaret or on stage around the world. Her voice is a treasured gift to be shared by millions of fans.In this recording, it is based on a live performance at the famed Cafe Carlyle room with her accompanist and musical partner, Wally Harper. She and Wally have comprised a tribute to the late great Gower Champion, famed Broadway theatrical director who died on the opening of the big hit, "42nd Street." Barbara is also a master storyteller in telling us tidbits about Broadway and Gower's theatrical influence. Barbara tells heartwarming stories about life on the great white way.Thirty five years later, most listeners have never heard of Gower Champion and its a shame. I'm sure Gower is smiling in heaven. His spirit lives on in the shows. Barbara selects songs and sings them with passion, love, and joy.To me, Barbara Cook is simply one of the world's finest female vocalists. Any of her recordings are first rate and high quality of music. When Barbara sings, she raises the bar of singing to a higher almost spiritual level. When Barbara played Marian the Librarian in "The Music Man," she became a Broadway star and a legend. Listening to this CD, you're right there in Cafe Carlyle with Barbara and Wally.

About a week ago, I woke up and watched a chorus singing "Jerusalem" for a British celebration. I wanted more and I alread have Lesley Garrett's recording somewhere in my collection. This CD includes the soulful anthem written by Sir Hubert Parry among others.Still "Jerusalem" is my favorite albeit it is only two minutes long. The lyrics are from Milton Blake's poem. I do agree "Jerusalem" is better than "God Save the Queen" in sound and passion. The recording makes me long to to return to England for a visit or to live there.

Yanni doesn't get the respect he deserves in the music industry. His music features his unique sound and voices in this compilation. The eleven recordings here are on this disc is soothing, comforting and inspiring for the audience.I always enjoy Yanni's music and sound. I do enjoy the vocals here on this CD. If you enjoy Yanni, you would love this collection. His music is perfect for easy listening, yoga and meditation, and even Pilates.

When I sit and work at one laptop, I play a DVD on my second laptop. For the past several weeks, I have played all 12 DVDs from this collection. If you're looking for high quality, look elsewhere. These 12 DVDs features hundreds of classic cartoons from decades ago. Perhaps they were last seen on television about thirty years ago. The quality varies from cartoon to cartoon. Since many cartoons are decades old,they might have some quality issues from preservation or lack of preservation.Disc One features 30 "Popeye" and 22 "Betty Boop" Cartoons.Disc Two features 5 "Tom & Jerry;" 7 "Mr. Piper;"14 "The Three Stooges;" 3 "Caspar;" 3 "Herman;" 4 "Gabby;" 3 "Little Audrey;" 2 "Little Lulu;" 2 "Felix the Cat;" and 3 "Mr. Bang, Katrinka, The Skipper."Disc Three features 53 Various Characters cartoons.Disc Four features 19 "Betty Boop;" 22 "The Three Stooges;" 8 "Christmas cartoons;" and 6 "Other cartoons."Disc Five features 5 "Tom & Jerry;" 8 "Felix the Cat;" 6 "Popeye;" 2 "Caspar;" 3 "Gabby;" 4 "Little Lulu;" 3 "Oswald Rabbit;" 2 "Little Audrey;" 1 "Molly Moo-Cow;" 3 "Alice;" and 7 Other cartoons.Disc Six features 6 "Hunky & Spunky;" 4 "Pied Piper;" and 41 Other cartoons.Disc Seven features 4 "Calvin and the Colonel;" 15 "Clutch Cargo" episodes; 10 "Aesop's Fables;" 11 "Felix;" 5 "Space Angel;" 2 "Blackie the Lamb;" 1 "Snack, Crackle, & Pop;" 1 "Cinderella;" and 1 "Little Gray Neck."Disc Eight features 9 "Fraidy Cat;" 14 "Gumby;" 24 "Hoppity Hooper;" 1 "The Wizard of Oz;" 1 "Moonbird;" and 1 "Popeye."Disc Nine features 12 "Farmer Alfalfa;" 6 "Alice;" 9 "Wacky & Packy;" 2 "Herman the Mouse;" 1 "Cubby Bear as Brownie Bear;" 6 "Christmas Cartoons;" and 15 Other Cartoons.Disc Ten includes 25 "Colonel Bleep;" 5 "George Pal Puppertoons;" 10 "Mel-O-Toons;" 9 "Christmas Cartoons;" and 1 "Meany Miny and Moe" cartoon.Disc Eleven includes 4 "Calvin and the Colonel;" 35 "Clutch Cargo" episodes;" 3 "Terrytoon;" 1 "Felix the Cat;" and 7 Other cartoons.Disc Twelve includes 9 "The Three Stooges;" 16 "Hoppity Hooper" and 15 Other CartoonsIf you're looking for a specific old cartoon, you should be able to find it here. There are hundreds of memorable and even forgettable cartoons. They don't show them on television much and it's a shame.  Television programmers have forgotten the art of programming for younger audiences today. Otherwise, younger children would never be able to enjoy them if they're not exposed to them. If I could, I would probably look for DVDs including "The Three Stooges" and "Popeye" in cartoons.

Dame Vera Lynn was the voice of England during its darkest days. She provided warmth, comfort, and perhaps hope during the London Blitz and the war against the German Nazis. France had Edith Piaf while England had Vera Lynn. She has become a British treasure and institution from a time gone by. She is still in her nineties and alive in England. This compilation includes classic hits like "A Nightingale Sang in Berkeley Square;" "White Cliffs of Dover;" and "Til We Meet Again" among them. There are others sung with heart and soul from a time gone by.In the nineties, Dame Vera Lynn returned to the stage to commemorate the golden anniversary of D-Day. She was awarded the OBE (Officer of the Order of the British Empire) before she was awarded the Dame Commander of the Order of the British Empire for her services to music. She carried a nation with her tune and sound. Her voice and songs remind listeners of life during World War II in England and the never ending threat of the Germans invading England by land invasion. The Germans dropped bombs but never invaded England by foot.Thank you, Dame Vera Lynn, for your voice and service during the war years. Your voice comforted millions living through it. She would go on to a successful singing career but she was at her peak of popularity during the war years. This compilation helps us understand how a voice can give hope in music.

Paula Deen is still one of America's foremost popular television chefs. She started out modestly making sandwiches and having her sons sell them before opening restaurants in her hometown of Savannah, Georgia. This book is about Southern cooking, Paula style. She has quite a sense of humor about herself and cooking. She doesn't take herself too seriously.There are about 20 chapters with each individual title and recipes. The first is "Paula's Birthday Bash." The menu includes beer-in-the rear chicken; bacon wrapped grilled corn on the cob; lace hoecake cornbread and more recipes. Each recipe includes a homespun story about it. The second chapter is "Bridge Club Supper" which includes artichoke rice salad with shrimp, garlic cheese biscuits, and more recipes. The third chapter is entitled "New Year's Day Soup Lunch for the Neighbors" which includes green chili corn muffins, Minnesota Wild Rice Soup, and more. The fourth chapter is entitled "A Cooking Shower" with recipes such as tomato tarts, shrimp and grits, pecan coated fish with remoulade sauce and others.The fifth chapter is entitled "A Georgia Bulldog Parking Lot Tailgate" and includes Dawg bite cheese spread, symphony brownies, and bloody marys. The six chapter is entitled "Keen-Ager Casserole Luncheon" and includes recipes like hot chicken salad, squash casserole, cranberry-pineapple gelatin salad, and others. The seventh chapter is entitled "The Boss Comes to Dinner." Katherine and Kelly's menus feature crab mousse (Katherine's) and glazed rock cornish game hens stuffed with wild rice (Kelley's) and more recipes. The eighth chapter is entitled "Comfort Food" and features quick crab stew, gumbo, black bottom pie, chicken divan and other recipes.The ninth chapter is entitled "A Teenager's Slumber Party." The recipes include Mexican pizza, mom's banana desert, fruit kebabs, and more recipes. The tenth chapter is entitled "The Cookie Swap." This chapter features Paula's ultimate oatmeal cookies, Savannah bow ties, magnolia lace trumpets, benne seed cookines, Mexican wedding cookies, monster cookies, and more. The eleventh chapter is entitled "Hunt Lunch in the Field" which features Bert's Southern Wild Chicken, Suzie's Peach Pickles, Maggie's Decadent Brownies, Rene's Coleslaw, and more. The twelfth chapter  is entitled "A Working Lunch" and includes recipes like salmon salad, curry chicken salad, gourmet potato chips, and other recipes.The thirteenth chapter is entitled "The Saturday Night Grill Party." The recipes include maple glazed salmon with pineapple salsa, minted lamb, teriyaki shrimp, and other recipes. The fourteenth chapter is entitled "A Weekend Campout" and includes blackened fish, Bob's Dutch-Oven Bread, Beason breakfast burritos, S'mores, and more. The fifteenth chapter is entitled "A Big Cocktail Buffet for Out of Town Wedding Guests." The recipe s include store bought shaved country ham, store bought shaved smoked turkey breast with chutney butter and store bought honey mustard, smoked or poached salmon mousse with dill sauce, purist's lump crab salad, and more.The sixteenth chapter is entitled "A Christening Brunch" and includes recipes for praline french toast casserole, baked garlic cheese grits, and more. The seventeenth chapter is entitled "Run for the Roses." This chapter includes Gilbert's Mint Juleps, beer cheese, Kentucky Country Ham and southern biscuits, Kentucky Spoon Bread, and more. The seventeenth chapter is entitled "A Week at the Lake with the Kids." This chapter includes recipes for Patty's Shrimp Creole, Alice Jo's spaghetti sauce, Cuban sandwiches, and more. The eighteenth chapter (18 is good luck number in Judaism) is entitled "A Family Shabbat Dinner." Shabbat is usually held on Friday's nights at sundown in Jewish homes throughout the world. The recipes include chopped liver, Mama's brisket, Sandee's Challah bread, sweet noodle kugel, and a few more. The nineteenth chapter is entitled "An Ice Cream Social." Recipes include banana sherbet, peach ice cream, butter pecan ice cream, lemon ice cream, buttermilk ice cream, strawberry sorbet, and vanilla bean custard ice cream.  The last chapter is entitled "Just Drinks" to include margaritas, fuzzy navel, Irish Jasper Green, hot cranberry cider, plantation iced tea, apple martini and more.The cookbook is a delightful addition to any chef's library featuring Paula Deen and her friends' Southern style cooking. Paula includes funny stories about each recipe. The book includes many colored photographed pictures of selected foods but I wished there were more.

This restaurant guide will help you navigate to the restaurants in New York City including all five boroughs. Each section includes a colorful map, colorful photographs, and descriptions about each restaurants. As somebody who lives near New York City, I would find this guide invaluable to dining out in the finest and established restaurants including newcomers to the restaurant scene.When I worked in New York City, I ate and walked a lot. There were so many restaurants to choose from around any location in Manhattan. This book includes restaurants in the outer boroughs like The Bronx; Brooklyn; Queens; and Staten Island. The guide includes bus and subway maps. The best way to see New York City is by bus rather than subways. There are indexes for cuisine and location. New York City is a gastronomic paradise for the ultimate foodie. You could live here and still never run out of restaurants.

Truman Capote was definitely a talented writer beset by inner demons and a conscience. He was never the same person after he wrote "In Cold Blood." This book is a collection of modest short stories previously published in magazines before he became a well-known published author. The foreword is written by Hilton Als (my advanced copy does not feature it but will be in the advanced final copy).The short stories in this collection are entitled "Parting of the Way;" "Mill Story;" "Hilda;" "Miss Belle Rankin;" "If I Forget You;" "Swamp Terror;" "The Moth in the Flame;" "The Familiar Stranger;" "Louise;" "This Is In Jamie;" "Lucy;" "Traffic West;" "Kindred Spirits;" and "Where the World Begins." The book ends with the author's biography and about the Truman Capote Literary Trust.If you are a Truman Capote fan, you must read his stories and want to purchase this book. The early stories are quite advanced for a young writer. He writes mostly about realistic characters in observational pieces. Each character like Louise is drawn to reflect Americana in some aspect. I enjoyed "Louise" but felt it was probably based on a real life experience. The first story, "Parting of the Way," is about two young men and I wonder if they were lovers than friends (something not mainstreamed in literature of the time). "Kindred Spirits" has the least likable characters to me.If you want to read more about Truman Capote, this book is definitely a must read about his observational skills and poetic writing style in developing characters. Some stories needed to be reread in order to grasp the full understanding. I will be honest that I didn't care much for Truman Capote before this book. I found him to be unlikable after the film, "Capote," about the "In Cold Blood" case. Much like his portrayer Phillip Seymour Hoffman, Capote had inner demons with drugs and alcohol and died prematurely in 1984.Now as I read his words, I feel sympathy and understanding for this complicated writer. Most writers with a genius talent often suffer from inner demons. Truman Capote may have been the life and joke of the party but he was deeply disturbed individual who needed help and understanding. He surrounded himself with the creme de la creme of society much like a jester in the palace. He wanted to be taken seriously and wanted his friends to see reality around him. He had a great knack for describing and writing about how people actually were in reality. Rest in Peace, Truman.

The children's book is about four sisters, Priscilla 'Silly,' twins Astrid and Eleanor, and Marla who live in suburban New Hampshire with their parents. Mom is usually bedridden from some undisclosed illness while Dad is basically in charge of the household. When the sisters discover magic in their bedroom closets, they uncover and unlock the key to some family secrets.The story overall is quite imaginative and realistic. Some young female readers will identify with the sisters and their situation. I just wished the writer focused more on the family secrets and less than on the imaginative world in their closets. Perhaps the author is trying to express that we all have secrets in my bedroom closets about our families.The Mom is the most important character in the story who needs to be better developed. As a reader, I felt that she was shades of a person in reality. The story is telling especially about reality and magic. Perhaps the last line is the most important in signaling the essence of the book's story. You can find magic in reality if you're looking in the right places for it.

Sir John Hurt stars as Father Christopher, a Catholic priest at an UN school in Rwanda. Hugh Dancy plays a young British teacher. When the school becomes a place for the fleeing Rwandans, they have to make choices and decisions.Based on a true story about the ETO massacre, there are harrowing moments in the film with passing scenes of murdered bodies on the streets. I'll never forget how a father pleaded with the UN soldiers to kill all of them with guns rather than machetes. He even pleaded to kill the children rather than them face the machete.The horrors of the Rwandan genocide are retold here ten years after it happened. The DVD features a forty minute feature in the making of the film and the story. The DVD features a commercial for IRC.This film was filmed on location and Rwanda. It tells a harrowing story of sacrifice, life, and madness. You must see it to believe it.

This DVD is a compilation of short films featuring Emmy winners Steve Carrell and James Gandolfini among other well known actors and Paris Hilton. This DVD doesn't have any extra features. The compilation features short films with a common theme of characters finding themselves. Most short films are done by new film directors from film school or emerging on the scene.Don't expect brilliance here but just a different way of telling a story. In the first short film, "Club Soda," stars Emmy winner James Gandolfini. It is about a young man and his conscience. The short is not the best film of the bunch but it is watchable. James Gandolfini displays his acting ability stretching from beyond his "Soprano" days. The role isn't a stretch but the film is worth watching just for his performance. He is a sorely missed actor today. He also produced the short film as well.The second short film features Emmy winner Steve Carrell in "Street of Pain" about memory and dodgeball. This short film is done without any dialogue and also features Emmy winner actor Eric Stonestreet before "Modern Family."The third short film entitled "Member" is about a group of young people driving in Los Angeles, California. I didn't get this short film of all. It is perhaps my least favorite in the bunch.The fourth short film entitled "Life Makes Sense If You're Famous" is about life in Hollywood, California and about fame. I found it troublesome and confusing. There was too much going on in a short film.The fifth short film entitled "L.A. Knights" stars Paris Hilton in a short about finding love and relationships in Los Angeles, California. She pretty much plays herself in the role. It is a forgettable short though but she tries to act.The sixth and final short film is perhaps the best of the bunch about a young woman who fails at suicide and hates her job. Although filmed in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada, this short film feature Ioan Gruffudd in the role as a young man also on the verge of suicide. The story is the best for its simplicity and realism.The DVD doesn't feature any extra features. If you're interested in seeing actors like Steve Carrell, James Gandolfini, Josh Hartnett, Paul Walker, Paris Hilton, and others in short films that are rarely available elsewhere, this DVD is perfect for you. This compilation of short films would be hard elsewhere.This DVD compilation of short films might be ideal for film students to see how a variety of short films are done. The common theme here is about characters finding themselves in the world. My favorite short was the last and it was perfect.

This children's book is about the animals that live at a school during the nighttime hours when the school is closed. The classroom animals include Malcolm and his friends solving the mystery of the gold coin at McKenna School. The novel has its moments and the book should include more illustrations to help enhance the reader's imagination. There are few in my copy and I hope the final copy features much more illustrations. The mystery and the Gold Coin is about the school itself.The writing needs to be edited down for younger readers while I found the story to be enchanted at times and redundant and repetitive at other times. The story of animals at a school when nobody is around is quite genuine. You have to wonder what the animals do when nobody is around to watch them. They have a life of their own. I enjoyed the rabbit most of all.This book has some issues but they can be resolved with more illustrations and better editing to cut down on the repetitiveness and redundancy. The story is a mystery and it is solved about the history of McKenna School.

Ryan Phillippe played Jersey City young man, Shane, who seeks a better life in New York City at Club 54. Mike Myers plays gay owner Steve Rubell with substance and sympathy. You feel sorry for him. Despite his wealth and fame, he was a very lonely man. Myers does a brilliant subtle job in playing Steve Rubell with complexity. You forgot he also played Austin Powers. In fact, his Austin Powers co-star Michael York has a role in the film as ambassador. There was plenty of well-known familiar faces like Sela Ward, Lauren Hutton, Mary McCormack, and Ellen Albertini Dow as Disco Dottie.Through Shane, we see how he gets in and stays in the club until it gets shut down. Club 54 was synonymous with fame and fortune. Anybody who was anybody was at 54 in those days. Selma Hayek and Breckin Meyer plays a married couple who befriend Shane. Neve Campbell plays a soap opera actress trying to achieve fame and fortune as an actress. There are actors playing 54 regulars like Andy Warhol and Truman Capote. I wished they utilized ER's Sherry Stringfield's "Viv" more in the film. She is barely recognizable in the role and is wasted in it.The film does an adequate job in recreating history of New York City in the late seventies. To see the twin towers is haunting enough. They filmed this movie in 1998. The film recreates the grittiness and character of New York City in those days. In fact, New York City was a place where it was possible to live and work in the city. Today, the city has become expensive and unaffordable for the working class unless you move to the outer boroughs.I felt the DVD could have had more features. They only show a music video. I also felt the writing could have been stronger too. Still the movie recreates a life and times of New York City's notorious club 54 and the era.

I have to say that even though I had trouble following the storyline. I had trouble distinguishing between Christian Bale and Bradley Cooper in the film. They looked so much alike that they could be brothers even twins. I wasn't sure who was Irvin or Richie. Amy Adams and Jennifer Lawrence are superb in their roles. Jeremy Renner plays Mayor Carnine Polito, the Camden mayor who loved his family, wife, and city despite being corrupt. Louis C.K. is memorable in his role and I was trying to figure out who he was throughout the film. While at times, I felt Jennifer Lawrence was miscast for the role. She was too young to play Irvin's wife, Rosalyn. Amy Adams is superb as the mistress, con-artist, and player.The cast is superb. I enjoy the art direction, costumes, music and the actors. I just had trouble with the storyline though. I wasn't sure who was conning who at times. Perhaps it was because Bradley Cooper and Christian Bale looked more like brothers and twins than adversaries.The DVD has two notable features such as the making of the film and the deleted and extended scenes as well. Despite some flaws, I found the film entertaining overall. I wished they included a background feature to explain the actual events that occurred. The con was called "Abscam" to target corrupt politicians and officials. You have to wonder what happened to the characters after the story was over.

If you love big band music and the style of three harmonious sisters, you will love the British Beverley Sisters. They were the singing trio of sisters featuring Jocelyn better known as Joy; Babette; and Teddy. Babette and Teddy are identical twins born three years exactly after Joy's birth. The three sisters are the longest running musical trio in music history. Their own daughters have also emerged as the Foxes.The Beverley Sisters performed fondly World War II songs here with the Syd Lawrence Orchestra. They have earned many fans and gained popularity among the gay community. They have each been honored by the Queen with an MBE (Members of the Order of the British Empire). The Beverley Sisters are blonde, harmonious, and dress identically. This CD will thrill and send chills down your spins in remembering Britain's past during World War II.

I'm one of those people that uses gift bags for most presents I give people. I just find them way more convenient. There's no point in me taking my time to wrap presents anymore since everyone will rip them open anyway. I don't want just any cheap gift bag though. I want nice high quality gift bags that look beautiful under the Christmas tree. That's where these come in. Seriously, I was super impressed when these came in the mail. You get 12 bags with 8 assorted designs. The bags are nice and thick so I don't have to worry about them ripping or tearing and I can easily place heavier items in them. The bags are absolutely gorgeous though. They have glitter accents on each bag that makes them look very elegant. The glitter doesn't fall off and get all over the place too like some bags I have gotten in the past. Each bags ribbon handle matches the color theme of the bag perfectly too. You seriously cannot beat this deal for 12 large bags that measure 13" h, 10" h, and 5.5"w. I usually purchase my bags at a large retailer for $4 each but getting these delivered right to my door was more convenient. I'm pretty happy with these and definitely wouldn't hesitate to purchase more next year for Christmas if I end up using all of these this year. *I received this product free in exchange for an honest review*

This is a super cute and comfortable set. I love how it is true to size just like all the other Hers by Herman sets I have. The band on the bra is very comfortable compared to many bras that I have. The bra offers pretty good support for my size 38C chest. I love how this set comes with both a thong and bikini pantie in the same design as the bra so you can match with both styles. My favorite is the bikini though. They are very comfortable and sexy to wear. They are kind of like a cheekini look where they don't completely cover your bottom which are my favorite style from Victoria's Secret. This set is very flattering with the black lace detailing and the polka dots. It's a great price too. *discount received for testing and review*

My dog loves blankets. She is always taking mine. She always curls up on the couch laying on mine and snuggling with them. This blanket was perfect for her as it's her very own. I love the paw print design on this fleece blanket as well as the colors. The blanket is is very nice size and it's not too heavy where I get overheated or too thin. It's perfect for year round to enjoy in Louisiana weather. It is very soft and comfortable to drape over my lap so my dog can cuddle with me on the couch. I left the blanket out on the couch the other night and caught the cat curled up on it so she definitely enjoys it too. I've already washed it once and it has not lost it's softness or thickness at all. No threads have come apart and it's still all intact. I'm definitely happy I got this blanket. Both my beloved pets love it and I love it. I couldn't be happier. *discount received for testing and review*

My husband has been trying out many different Syma helicopters lately. This is the first Chinook style he's flown. This one seemed to take a bit more getting used to. As soon as you would get it off the ground it would want to go forward instead of just up even when not using the forward or back controls. Takes a bit of getting used to but it definitely helps with hand/eye coordination. This Syma S026G definitely can take a beating though. It ran into walls, smashed into the corner of the television, and crashed to the floor multiple times and still got right back up to fly. That's what makes these totally worth it. It's great for a beginner or advanced flyer alike. My husband really enjoys the time he spends flying this around the living room and dining room and practicing his landing skills on his Eagle Pro Helipad which is available here:Remote Control Helicopter Landing Pad - LED Lights Installed - Suitable for RC Helicopters, Quadcopters, Drones, Syma Helicopters.. He knows he has finally controlled his helicopters once he can successfully land on his helipad. All in all, this mini Chinook style Syma is a great little helicopter for all ages. It charges quickly and gives you a solid 7 minutes of fly time with a few crashes here and there. I also like the flashing LED lights on the bottom of it. It adds a nice visual effect. Highly recommended.

I am loving this Blueberry Pet Houndstooth pattern collar. It is very well made and solid. The stitching is perfect and precise. It's very easy to adjust as well as open and close. The collar is soft and padded and doesn't bother my dog at all. My dog usually never wears a collar because they always bothered her and she would just itch and scratch so much. This is padded and gentle enough and she actually seems to like wearing it around the house. I like the added little loop sewn into the Blueberry Pet label so I can add her dog tag or a charm. I got the black and white one and it looks so adorable on my dog. It's really stylish and I'm definitely pleased with the quality of it. *I received this product free in exchange for an honest review*

This 83 piece art set is fantastic and comes with almost everything you need to create great works of art. It comes in a nice wood carrying case and everything is organized and easy to grab and find. The case is perfect for a child to travel with and carry around. I love how this set includes a ton of colored pencils in many different colors, oil pastels, water colors, drawing pencils, three mixing palette trays, brushes, a sanding block, an eraser, and a sharpener. It's seriously the perfect set for a child. The quality is excellent and my niece loves it. It definitely makes her feel like  young little artist. *I received this product free in exchange for an honest review*

This Lova magenta vintage bracelet is beautiful. It stretches and fits my wrist perfectly. The magenta beads with silver tone give it a nice distinct look as well as the metallic decorations.
