It's not just your typical flat back flex case which I really like, as flex cases are my favorite but they can get a little boring.This Note 4 case also fits easily into a holster or side pouch. It's cut perfectly with all ports and buttons easily accessible. If you are looking for a thin case that will really make your phone stand out and you won't find boring in a day or two, this is certainly worth checking out in any of the many colors it comes in.*I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

The foldable Bluetooth mouse is amazingly accurate and is able to handle any motion in applications for photo and digital art editing. It also makes playing games effortless and increases productivity in word-processing and spreadsheets on smartphones or tablets.The button action feels sturdy and consistent. Ergonomically, it is both comfortable and practical to use, even for extended periods of time. The impressively long battery life is also a great feature that enables hours of use without recharging. My favorite feature, however, is that it folds flat and slips right into my briefcase's tablet compartment, right next to my portable charger and miniature Bluetooth keyboard.*I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

This hand crank spice/herb grinder has an impressive and efficient system of grinding blades. It's able to cut up soft flowers or leaves from plant matter just as easily as woody and stem filled components. It grinds them down to a fine, manageable consistency and easily catches all stray pollen in the bottom screened compartment.While it is rather heavy, the weight is balanced and makes you immediately feel how high quality this grinder is. All of the machined threaded surfaces are nicely fitted and screw together easily, and this stays together with no issue even when thrown in a pocket or a bag. This grinder is really everything you need from a handheld one!*I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

While I like these pants overall, there are a couple annoying things about them that lead me to probably not purchasing this type of Dickies in the future.First and foremost is not having front pockets. I really only ever wear these when I specifically need to wear khakis for a particular store that I'm working at(I'm a product/reset merchandiser) and therefore need to carry with me all kinds of small tools and pens/markers, my phone, etc. It was really hard to fit even the basics in the two back pockets.The second is the super tight fit in the legs and hips/butt. I found the waist to be a very expected fit for the size I ordered, but it was super tight everywhere else. Most other Dickies I have worn are fairly loose throughout, I was surprised to find that these were so fitted.If you are looking for a more classy or fitted pair of khakis, these would not be bad to buy. But if you are looking to get these to do actual work in, I would suggest finding ones that are more loose and have actual pockets!

These sunglasses are super cute and highly functional. I was surprised to even find that Coleman made sunglasses like these and not ones that were more practical. I have always had an obsession with larger squared sunglasses and it's nice to find good quality ones that are more for function than fashion. I got the black pair and love them. Although they're a tad bit smaller than I would have imagined them to be, they're still very large and extremely easy to see through, another plus. They look great on and fit wonderfully. They feel very high quality and I don't worry that I'm going to break them anytime soon even though I've already broken 2 pairs of cheap sunglasses this year! They also come with a nice stretchy storage pouch which will make it easy to keep them in my purse and won't scratch them all up.

Although it gives the dimensions in the description for this bamboo cutting board, I was honestly surprised at how large it was when it showed up at my door! It's absolutely huge!It's very heavy duty as well which is something I was a bit nervous about when ordering a bamboo board. It's thick enough that you can't cut through it or put any big puncture marks in, even using the largest of knives. But it's still slim enough that it stores away easily.The surface is great for cutting all kinds of foods, and it's not overly porous like cheaper bamboo boards tend to be. This would make a nice addition to your kitchen!*I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

This is a very nice, plain, simple case for your LG G4. If you are looking to add protection, but don't want anything flashy or bulky, this would definitely be the case to get. It's slim but also keeps your phone protected from smaller drops or bumps.The matte black color is nice and easy to keep clean and it's not overly flashy. It feels more like a plastic case but has the added benefit of being a very lightweight flexi silicone style case. All of the ports and buttons line up perfectly on this case.*I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

This mini photo album is so cute. It's the perfect size for your Instax mini photos, other mini photos, or anything else smaller. A cute idea I've seen people use albums like this for is a neat way to keep business cards, or cut outs of their favorite quotes decorated on scrapbook paper, etc.There are a ton of uses for it, not just a photo album! It's so tiny that it'd be easy to keep anywhere in the house, or to store it away and not worry about big bulky photo or memory albums that take up too much space. The design on this album is very professional, so it would also be an easy way to keep your business cards in your briefcase or purse and not worry about losing them, or looking unprofessional looking around for one or adding one in.*I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

This mini photo album is so cute. It's the perfect size for your Instax mini photos, other mini photos, or anything else smaller. A cute idea I've seen people use albums like this for is a neat way to keep business cards, or cut outs of their favorite quotes decorated on scrapbook paper, etc.There are a ton of uses for it, not just a photo album! It's so tiny that it'd be easy to keep anywhere in the house, or to store it away and not worry about big bulky photo or memory albums that take up too much space. If you are looking for a true white LED bulb, this is the one to get! I've used quite a few different LED bulbs,and have been amazed by the amount of light they put out and how bright they are, but I've never used one that was so true of a white as this bulb.I got this bulb to replace the one in my main living room lamp(so I could use that bulb for another tiny lamp), I wasn't expecting the bulb to be so huge! You'll definitely want to use this with a lighting device that has an open top or a very wide opening where the bulb will fit. It's a standard size bulb, but for a good second I thought I had accidentally ordered an industrial one or something!The amount of light this puts out is a tad bit lower than the other LED bulbs I've used, but it's only in appearance. You can tell an off white glow from a mile away, whereas this looks way more like natural light so it doesn't make the bulb stand out like a sore thumb. I will definitely be ordering more of these.*I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

I really like my new tablet keyboard case. The description was a bit misleading as I thought it was fitted especially for my otherwise impossible to find cases for LG G-Pad 8.0, but it's just a generic sized case. However, it fits it perfectly, so I don't mind at all.I have used a couple generic cases for tablets over the years, and always found the ones that have clip on holders to either fit too large or too small for most tablets. These clips stretch just the right amount to fit my tablet and holds it snugly in place, without worry if they're going to pop off or not. The keyboard is also the perfect size for my 8" tablet, though I imagine it would look perfect with my older 7" tablet as well.The keyboard did take some time to pair up, mostly because I made it more difficult than it needed to be. I work with tech devices constantly so am used to having to hold a button to pair a Bluetooth device, or watch for a blinking or solid light. However, once you turn this keyboard on(another nice function, a physical on/off key), it goes into pairing mode without needing to push anything else. It does take a couple minutes for it to be searchable by your device, though, that's the part I didn't wait for at first! Once it was paired it connected in no time at all.The keyboard itself is a bit small, but it's exactly what you'd expect size wise to have with a tablet. The case can sit up by itself if you wish to prop up your tablet and keyboard on a desk and use it like a laptop, or you can lay it out flat. It did not feel flimsy or unstable at all whenever I've had it propped up.The only other downside I could see is very minimal, once you have your tablet clipped in, the loop over closure seems to either stick out or fit behind your tablet a bit awkwardly. Nothing that would even warrant me rating this below 5 stars, however. Overall if you are looking for a colored and cute keyboard case for a tablet, I highly suggest checking this one out.*I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

0:42 Mins This LED speaker is so cool! While it's not overly large(though bigger than it appears in my video), it puts out a great sound and has a surprising amount of bass for a Bluetooth speaker. I was also pleased to see that it takes an SD card, so you can just load it up and take it anywhere.Of course the best part are the unique colorful led lights. They go completely around the speaker, aside from a very thin strip where the speaker name is. I love that there's multiple modes, too, so you can change up how the led's flash. If you watch my video, I start to change the modes at about 12 seconds in and pause it during each shift. My favorite is the last! These are really bright and pretty and make this speaker one of a kind.The controls for the speaker are along the bottom by the stand, and along with having press buttons for pause, play, etc, there's a button to control the color mode, as well as an actual on/off switch so it can't be accidentally bumped on.If you're looking for a speaker to really make your party or event, and also sound really amazing, get this! It will easily pair up to your phone or device to really show it off.*I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

This 4 piece gift set of essential oils by Ovvio is wonderful. Not only are the oil blends amazing, the packaging is adorable. This would be so easy to order and immediately wrap up for a very lavish gift. I had a hard time taking them from their box and adding them to the rest of my box of oils!The four blends are all very unique and potent. My favorite of the bunch is the Slumber blend. If you pop some of this in a bedroom diffuser at night, you are sound asleep in no time flat. The scent is amazing and I sometimes just blend this to have the smell diffuse throughout my house.The Inhale blend is my favorite to use in the bathroom or during times of bad allergies. The eucalyptus and peppermint(among others) are so perfect for clearing up the sniffles and helping with breathing. I love to turn it on during a shower for a mini spa session.Unwind and Enhance are each good for their own stress relieving properties, I like to just diffuse them at different times and have my house smell great! Unwind really makes you feel calm and the scents make you feel at peace. Enhance is also nice for calming the mind, though it has extra oils that keep the mind a bit more alert but stress free.If you are just getting into essential oils, or have only previously used pure single scent oils, this is a very useful starter kit. Even if you have used some similar stress free or sleep blends, I highly recommend trying Ovvio's blends as they are the best I've tried!*I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

These krill oil pills are a great addition to any supplements you currently take. Omega 3/fish oil pills are said to be about the best around for a daily vitamin/supplement, but krill oil has even better benefits and beyond more potent than just fish oil pills alone.The one a day gel capsules are easy to take, and easy to remember to take most importantly. There is no fishy smell or aftertaste which is also a huge benefit. The only downfall to this product is that the label leaves something to be desired, though it has nothing to do with the supplement itself.*I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

This is all around a very nice, simple oil diffuser. I have quite a few in my house as I've grown mildly(okay, completely) obsessed with diffusing essential oils, and they all seem to have their ups and downs.While this diffuser is fairly small in that it doesn't take a ton of water at once, I really like that it has just a very simple button operation over a remote like another similar one I have. I also enjoy that it has a burst setting, not many diffusers do. This is perfect for use at night in the bedroom when I want to use an oil that has a pretty strong scent and I don't want it continuously going and keeping me up.The subtle white glow is also a nice change of pace, it's beyond perfect for use in the bedroom since it's not too flashy, but you can tell when it's on. Maintenance on this diffuser is very simple due to the cord plug in at the bottom of the unit, and the little cleaning brush to get your extra oils out or to clean around the edges on the inside where buildup can occur.If you're in the market for a diffuser that's not too flashy or big but puts out a great mist, this is the one for you!*I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

This surf hair spray smells and feels amazing in the hair. I have really fine straight hair that can't hold curls to save my life, so I wasn't expecting this to work a miracle and give me super beachy waves. However after using it I do notice my hair feeling more full and seems to have extra life added to it.The smell is the absolute best part. I typically use low chemical shampoos that don't have any scent or a very mild scent, and this helps my hair to smell amazing the entire day. Even if I got zero benefit in the texture of my hair from use, I would use it just for the smell. For those of you that are blessed with hair that this would give amazing waves to, you'll love that you don't need to use heat to activate it.*I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

This Turmeric body sponge is awesome. I've been using konjac sponges for my face for over a year now and absolutely love them. I don't know why it took so long to find full body ones! I can't say I've noticed a huge difference using a turmeric one over charcoal yet, but I know that turmeric has some great skin brightening and texture toning features so I'm sure I'll see great long term results.This is much less harsh than other body scrubbers or loofahs but makes you feel CLEAN. It's big enough to get the job done, but not too big to hold comfortably in the hands. The added hanger and suction cup makes it very convenient to toss in the shower and not worry about it falling down or sucking up too much other gunk.*I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

I typically take some sort of fat busting supplement daily along with another staple supplement like forskalin. I didn't particularly notice any new results using this specific supplement, however I could feel myself low on caffeine/energy when I did forget to take it or I'd have a headache from lack of caffeine, etc.I don't personally work out, but I imagine this would be a nice addition to before starting to exercise even just slightly. Like any pills similar, make sure you give yourself a trial period with them to get out any initial jitters/slight heart racing before going full on into the dosage or before doing severe workouts with them. As I said I did not notice these effects, but I'm used to taking pills like this. However, being that I didn't notice any extras means these are relatively gentle to take. If you're looking for an add on to your current supplements this one is worth a try.*I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

Before getting this toner and looking up the actual benefits/uses of facial toners, I honestly thought they all were basically astringents. I have used a few here and there but typically shy away from them for long term use as they can be harsh and very drying. This toner is exactly the opposite - it is so conditioning and moisturizing. It almost feels like you're spritzing yourself with water, so can be very refreshing after a hot day or using very hot water to clean your skin.The scent is a bit odd but goes away very fast. The sprayer is super convenient for putting it on as well, no more fumbling to put toner on a cotton pad or sponge and rub it in and worry about getting enough on the skin. It dries quickly and makes the perfect base for a facial lotion without weighing it down any. I have yet to be disappointed by any OZ Naturals skin products I have tried, they are my absolute go to.*I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

I have quite a few oil diffusers in my home because I'm slightly obsessed with essential oils. Lemon oil is my go-to when I'm cleaning, or having guests over and want to quickly get rid of the pet smell. It makes my house smell instantly clean, and its such a fun light but crisp scent!The bottle is huge so I will get a ton of uses from this, even with adding it to some of my other cleaners to enhance their smell. Sun Essential Oils are so pure that I'm able to get so much use out of just a few drops of this stuff. I only wish it came with a dropper top as well instead of just a pipette.*I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

You can never have too much jojoba oil on hand. It is my absolute favorite oil for my nails. I make my own cuticle oil, and use primarily jojoba oil since it absorbs the best as well as moisturizes. If you're looking for a new nail or hand care routine and only need one oil, use jojoba oil! Even if you're not in the market for a new nail routine, this has other wonderful uses like for conditioning hair, or for using as a massage oil that doesn't just sit on the skin - it soaks in and moisturizes as well.This bottle specifically is huge, and the dropper is really nice for adding to my other oils or for mixing in handmade bath bombs. InstaNatural is known best for it's wonderful skin products and this is no exception.*I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

Rosehip oil is such a nice versatile oil to have around. If you are into making your own beauty products like I am, this is wonderful for adding to bath bombs and cuticle/hand oils due to all of the skin ailments(dryness, patchiness, marks, etc) that it combats. It's super conditioning which is important to have in those types of products. It's also great on it's own or mixed as a high quality but all natural make up remover, one of it's great benefits is that while it conditions your face it also helps with acne, so no worries about a harsh product causing you breakouts.It's also a really nice oil to use for massages or rubbing in other essential oils. It does not block the properties of a muscle relaxing oil, for example, but makes it easier to rub in and helps it to actually sink in without it being wasted sitting on the skin. The bottle is huge and the dropper is so convenient. Like always, Majestic Pure has great quality oils and I've never been let down!*I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

My husband takes Omega 3 everyday and has tried quite a few different brands, he says this was the one with the least after taste, probably due to the added lemon flavor this one includes. He's on quite a few other supplements due to the medicine he has to take for his bad back so hasn't been able to test it on it's own to notice any extra energy boosts but feels they're at least as great of quality as any higher dollar brands.If you are looking to add a new daily supplement to your life, fish oil pills have about the best benefits out there. This bottle is nice over others due to that added lemon flavoring(seems unimportant until you try a low quality fish oil pill without!) and the size of the bottle, this is a wonderful amount.*I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

The title is not exaggerating, this is a HUGE bottle! I am really impressed with the size of the bottle vs other oils that I get. The scent is super strong(in a good way!), even with the seal in tact and bottle fully closed I could smell it from inside the box even! It's a great soothing scent so it does not bother me in the least that you can smell it even when it's closed. I've been using it in my diffuser anyway with a few other blends so don't mind a bit extra of the soothing scent.Another nice benefit to using such a good quality oil like from Sun Essential Oils is that I can apply it directly onto the skin on top of cuts, scraps, bruises, etc. There have been a few times I've put this right onto them and it helps to soothe them within just a few seconds, and I don't need to worry about doing extra damage to my injuries. I'm also planning on using this to also make some bath bombs and in my homemade cuticle oil so I'm really happy with the size of the bottle and how concentrated the oil is, this will last a long time!*I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

Although this oil is meant for beards, my husband rarely grows out his facial hair long enough to have a use to moisturize it with oils. Instead I've begun using it myself for various reasons. I make a lot of beauty/bath items, especially cuticle oil and mani or bath bombs, and having great oils in them is crucial. This blend is absolutely perfect for them, even though its targeted for men. Mixed with a little extra jojoba oil or a scent, this is a great cuticle oil on its own.The "Bold Forest" scent is by no means unbearable. It's fairly woodsy but not overpowering. Using just a few drops you won't be able to notice it, or mixing it with some other scented oils it goes away right away. However, if you've been looking for an oil for your guy to actually oil his cuticles with, this might attract him! The bottle is also huge which makes this last for a very long time, another plus over a lot of other beard oils out there.*I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

I absolutely love this small oil diffuser! I have one almost identical that's the same size, but it doesn't have the convenient on or off switch. Instead it has timer settings, which is nice but hard to remember to run it again at times. It's the perfect size, yet still holds so much water! I have seen some almost twice as large that hold even less water, so I am very impressed with the design of this diffuser.The multi color lights on it are gorgeous, too, and cycle through at a nice speed. Most importantly, this little guy puts out a ton of mist! It fills up my bathroom or office with the oils I put in it no problem. If you do not need to power a giant room, this is the diffuser to get!*I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

These containers are great! I had actually previously purchased the one compartment containers from the same company and loved them so much that I wanted more. This set comes with both three compartment bento style containers and round containers. The bento containers are great for taking a well balanced meal or a leftover meal to work or school. You can easily keep your meat out of your mashed potatoes and corn. They also work well for taking half a sandwich and fruits and veggies, etc. The possibilities are endless.I like to use the round containers for leftover soup,  chili, or fruit. but they work out great for other things as well. These containers do not leak. They are also BPA free and microwave / dishwasher safe. I love these containers and I would highly recommend them! I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest, unbiased review.

I have had two discs replaced in my spine (neck area), I have a metal rod in my leg, a metal plate and several screws. I also have nerve issues in my wrists. So, I often find myself in pain and in need of some assistance. I have a variety of heat pads and massage tools. I am happy that I now have this bag in my collection. This microwavable heat bag is great for the price. It comes with a thick, soft, fleece cover on the outside. The one downfall is that the cover is not removable for washing. However, I think it is appropriate for the price. I wouldn't recommend tossing the entire thing in the washer/dryer. So, you need to try to keep it clean and spot clean as necessary.In a minute or less of the microwave (I recommend putting it on a paper towel or paper plate to protect the cover), it is ready to go. It is the perfect size for sore wrists or headaches. It also drapes well over your shoulder, or can be used when sitting back in a chair for your neck. I have even used it for my lower back. It stays warm for a decent amount of time (20-30 minutes) and it does not get so hot that it burns your skin. It is also perfectly filled which is normally not the case with microwavable heat bags. I would definitely buy another one and I probably will. I recommend this product. I received this product for free in exchange for my honest, unbiased opinion.

If you are looking for a wireless speaker that can have your entire house rocking (subject to the size of your house), then this speaker is for you. We have several tiny bluetooth speakers that we use throughout our 3 bedroom house. We have always wanted a larger speaker that we could hear clearly everywhere. This Denon HEOS 5 did not disappoint. It is a decent sized speaker at 14.8 x 9.8 x 13.5 inches and just over 11 pounds.We set the speaker up as soon as it arrived. It was easy to setup via Wifi with our Samsung Galaxy phones. You do have to plug your phone into the speaker via cable to setup. We were able to have it running in just a few short minutes. The speaker has great sound quality, bass and gets super loud! We have it on top of a book shelf in our dining room (which is at the entrance and towards the center of our house). We can clearly hear the speaker playing throughout the house.Now for the few issues we have and the reason for 4/5 stars. The first major issue is that it often gets disconnected somehow. When this happens, we have to plug our phones back in and log back into our password protected Wifi. It is a pain and it is made more difficult since our speaker is located on top of a book shelf that is up high. We could move it, but that is our preferred spot for it. It keeps it out of the way. The app is also a pain to use. We still have not figured out how to turn the dang thing off. We normally resort to turning off our Wifi to get it to stop playing music. Maybe we are missing something? I don't know, but we are both pretty technological adept and we can not figure it out.Overall, we still really love the speaker. 90%+ of the time it works great and we do not have any issues. I wish it was Bluetooth instead. However, we are happy to have it in our home. I would still recommend it.

This Lucien Piccard Men's watch is very nice looking. It comes in a gorgeous and well made gift box. It has a classic and timeless look, it has gold, but not too much, and it has a genuine leather band. Unfortunately, there is a "deployment clasp" at the end of that gorgeous leather band that is a deal breaker and makes this watch unviable for everyday wear.When the watch arrived, my Husband and myself were both pretty impressed with it. It was even nicer looking in person than in the pictures. My Husband immediately went to try it on. Then he said, "What? I don't understand." This made me stop what I was doing and come look because my Husband is the type of guy that figures everything out easily...especially mechanical issues. He showed me the clasp and I was confused too. We looked at the small instruction booklet and did not see anything about the clasp. After about 5-10 more minutes of tinkering with it, my Husband figured it out.The clasp is a real pain to use. If you have a small wrist, you may be able to keep the clasp on the opposite end and save some time. However, my Husband has a large wrist. He has to take it completely apart every time. He also showed me how he has to "guess" which hole is right each time since you don't know if you have it right until it is all the way fastened. This is hard to understand without actually seeing the watch in action, but trust me that it is not worth your time. Even with my Husband knowing how to work the watch, it takes several minutes to put on. He will wear this watch occasionally, but it will be rare. He needs a watch that goes on in seconds, not minutes.While this watch would probably get 5 stars without the clasp, the clasp will be a deal-breaker for most people. I do not recommend this watch. There are much more user friendly watches out there.

I ordered this silver mini floating Mom locket necklace as a gift for my Mom. It arrived today and I could not be happier! It is perfect. I have always loved the idea of floating charm lockets, but I always thought they looked a little cheap or clunky. This mini locket is the perfect alternative if you want something that is more sleek and nicer looking. This locket is 2.8 x 1.4 x 0.5 inches or slightly bigger than my thumb. I have my thumb in one of the pictures for reference. The pictures really do not do this beautiful necklace justice. The silver is smooth and shiny, so it doesn't photograph well.The locket comes with a necklace and charms, which is awesome. You normally have to buy those separately. The charms and the locket all look nice. The charms do have a tendency to move around a lot in the locket. The Mom charm sometimes flips over or both the charms will slide and get stuck on top of each other. I am not sure if there is an easy solution for that. I have seen disc charms for the larger lockets, but I don't know if they make them this small. I kind of like the see through look better anyhow. The locket is easy to open and fix the charms. The necklace that comes with the locket has little silver balls every inch or so. It looks nice with the locket. Or, you could put the locket on a regular silver chain to make it look even nicer. I am going to send it to my Mom as is because I know she will love it.I do want to mention that the charms, necklace and locket all come in separate plastic bags. So, you will want to buy a small box or re-purpose an old jewelry box to gift this item.I love this necklace so much that I am asking my Husband to buy me one for Christmas. So, I would definitely recommend it. I received this necklace at a discount in exchange for my honest, unbiased review.

I really like this La Roche-Posay Serum. I have uneven, red skin and I was hoping to even out my skin tone some. I don't think it has evened out my skin tone yet, but I have only been using it for about 2 weeks. However, it does make my skin look much healthier and more vibrant. It seems to moisturize my skin pretty well too. The serum is soft and applies easily. It doesn't feel greasy or heavy. I also have sensitive skin and it did not burn or irritate my face at all. I am hoping that with long term use it will even out my skin tone. Even if it doesn't, I love the way the product makes my skin look and feel. I would definitely recommend it!

I received the 12 Piece "stripe" set. First of all, I want to say the picture on this listing is not currently correct and needs to be fixed. The typed description is correct. This set has eight plates (in two different sizes) and four bowls. The bowls are the standard smaller sized bowls that typically come with sets like this. They are good for small side salads, soup, etc.I wasn't really sure what to expect with this set. I know that Lenox is a nicer and pricer brand. I was hoping they wouldn't be heavy like China plates, but I was hoping they would still be really nice and justify the price. They did not disappoint me! This is a very well made set. However, it is not too heavy. The plates could easily be used as everyday dinnerware. We personally are going to save them for when we have guests over.The design is really neat because it is not your typical boring stripe. The strips are slightly swiggly which makes the plates have character, but still look nice. The plates have a slight curve to them to help keep food on the plate. The bowls are a really nice size for sides and possibly cereal if you actually stick to the serving size (does anyone do that)?Is this dish set in my normal price range? No. Is it worth the money? Maybe. I personally would not spend $200 (the current price) on a 12 piece set of dishes. However, if you have it in your budget, I don't think that this set would disappoint you. I definitely recommend it if price is not an issue!

Epson printers have definitely come along way since the one that I had about a decade ago. This all in one printer, scanner and copier is relatively small at 10.4 x 19.1 x 16.8 inches and just over 20 pounds. It was easy for us to set up the wifi and the printer and start printing in less than 20 minutes. Of course, we do have a lot of experience with setting printers up. So, it may take you a little longer. We also set up our phones to have the capability to print directly from them without issue.The printer has a wide rear feed tray to print off 11x17 photos which is awesome! My previous printers only had the capability to do standard size paper and photos. The photos come out crisp, clear and vibrant. It definitely prints professional quality photos. It also prints directly onto dvd's which is great if you make your own cd/dvd's. It prints the photos at a much faster rate than my older printer (which is a few years old now and probably out of date). The smaller photos I printed came flying out and the standard letter size I printed took around a minute. I have to buy some printer paper in 11x17, but I can't wait to test that size out. It will make for great wall decorations.I also love the 2 sided printing. I sometimes need this function for my school work. It saves my back and shoulder since most of my materials have to be printed, placed into a binder and carried with me daily. Overall, I really love this printer and I highly recommend it!

I LOVE this product. This is the 2nd scent that I have received and my favorite scent so far. I was skeptical before I received the first bottle, but after I tried it, I knew I had to order more scents. This stuff really works! You just spray the toilet a few times until it forms a film on the water (you will see it). The scent immediately starts to waft up. Then, as you go to the bathroom the scent is trapped under the film. It is amazing. No more stink. Now when you say your poop doesn't stink, you are telling the truth. Sort of. This is great for everyone. If you are embarrassed of your foul odor, this will solve your problem. If you are not embarrassed by your odor, but your family does not want to smell it, this will fix your problem. It is so much better than sprays that attempt to mask the scent and end up making the whole bathroom smell even worse. The coconut and lime scent smells wonderful.  I definitely recommend giving Mask a shot.

I have been buying non-GE replacement filters every since I first replaced my filter in my refrigerator. You save a lot of money this way and they are just as high quality. That is true of this Eternawater MWF filter. It is easy to replace. You just pull off the only filter and pop this one in. This one does say to submerge in cold water for 15 minutes before inserting. I have never seen that before, but it is easy to do. Then, you have to run it to get out the sediment. This particular filter has to be flushed for 3 gallons. I love that it says an amount on the filter. My previous one said just to "flush". The water comes out clear and tasting great after it is flushed. I would definitely recommend this replacement filter.*I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest, unbiased review

This is a fantastic brush set for the price! I use brushes for applying almost all of my makeup. I feel like I can never have too many of them. I particularly like the larger and Kabuki style brushes because they blend my face makeup really well.When this set arrived I noticed that it contained a note about the smell. It said that if it smells, just wash the brushes to get rid of the smell. This really is no big deal since you should be washing them before using anyhow. I have a makeup brush cleaner, but liquid soap or gentle shampoo works too. My brushes did smell like plastic. I washed two of the brushes that I would be using right away and the smell was gone. I then tossed the remaining brushes on my vanity for later washing. When I came in to wash them two days later...they didn't smell anymore!! So, the smell will vanish once they are out of the plastic bag for a bit. You really should still wash them for sanitary reasons.I also love that this set comes with a paper telling you which brushes are best for which makeup. It can be kind of hard to tell the difference between some of them. You really could use any of the larger brushes interchangeably. The bristles on the brushes are thick and soft. I have not had them to fall out at all. I did have one brush with a long bristle, but I just cut it off with scissors. The brushes work great. I would definitely recommend this set!*I received this product at a discount in exchange for m honest, unbiased review

We are SO disappointed! We have a Playstation 3 and are planning on buying a Playstation 4 in the near future. So, we were excited to receive this hard drive. The Amazon page says that it has a simple installation. IT DOES NOT. When it arrived we were excited and opened it immediately. All that is in the box for instruction is a piece of paper that says to go to their website (www.seagate.com/playstation). Once we arrived at the website, there are no instructions for Playstation 3 or any mention of it. We decided to watch the Playstation 4 video and hoped that it had similar installation. One of the first things that the video tells you is what you need to install it. Yes, you need a screwdriver. You also need:1- USB external hard drive large enough for all your game data2- USB Flash drive large enough for the Playstation operating system that you will have to reinstallWhat the heck? So you spend over $100 on this hard drive and have to spend even more money on an external hard drive and a flash drive if you don't have one? On top of that you have to download all of your information, change the hard drive, download the operating system from the Playstation website, upload the operating system, etc. This is the short version and missing a lot of steps, but you get the idea. Also, the transfer of your information makes sense, but how come this drive doesn't come with the operating system if it is exclusively for Playstation?? I don't like the thought of installing the operating system. Make sure you watch the installation video before buying this product because it is lengthy and ridiculous.At this point, I don't think that we will be installing this until we buy a Playstation 4. We are not going to spend the extra money for an external hard drive and we don't want to lose our current games. Please make sure you know what you are getting into before buying this. I do not recommend this hard drive.

I have straight, thick and normal to oily hair (sometimes it gets oily). I first tried the Nexxus Oil Infinite Conditioner and I liked it. So, I decided to try the shampoo too. Unfortunately, the two together make my hair feel greasy and oily only an hour or two after showering. I think the reason that the conditioner worked for me where the shampoo fails is because I do not put conditioner on my roots. This is my biggest oil/ grease spot. With shampoo, you have to scrub it into the roots and all the hair. Regardless, this product was not for me. If you have dry hair, or oil is not an issue for you, then it may work wonders. If your hair gets oily at all, do not buy this version of Nexxus products. There are many hair lines out there with oil that are for all hair types, but this does not seem to be one of them

This fishing grip is a great tool to have in your fishing kit. It makes it easy to grip the fish and pull it up out of the water. I received the long tube fishing grip and it has a decent length to it so that you don't have to bend over as far. It is decently made and functions well. It also comes with a holster, but it is not something I will personally use. This is a good addition to our fishing tackle box.*I received this product in exchange for my honest, unbiased review

I have a LOT of shoes that desperately need organizing. I currently have some in two different closets, on the floor in my bedroom and shoved under the bed. Those that are under the bed are really hard to pull out and find the matching pair. So, I was really excited to try out this StorageManiac underbed shoe organizer. The organizer arrived folded up. If you need to fold it up to move or store it, you can easily fold it up again.The organizer is supposed to hold 12 shoes. However, I found that my gym shoes are a little large for it and work best with one shoe in each compartment. My flip flops, sandals and dress shoes (flats) all were able to fit one pair per slot. I wear size 9 shoes and they fit perfectly. My Husband's shoes (Men size 11-12) however, would not fit unless I slid them under the dividers. I am fine with that since it means that I don't have to share the storage space. I have plenty of shoes to fill it up.The organizer is a little loose in shape when you first unfold it. It does solidify more after you load it with shoes and zip it. I also love that it has a handle for pulling it out from under the bed or carrying it. I do wish that the top was clear so I could see what shoes were inside. I plan on storing my lesser used or out of season shoes in the organizer, so it isn't a big deal. Overall, I really like this shoe organizer and I love that I don't have to "fish" under the bed for my shoes anymore.*I received this product in exchange for my honest, unbiased review.

I have thick, straight and oily hair. I used to avoid any products that had the word "oil" in them out of fear of slick, greasy hair. However, the hair industry has changed in the last few years and a lot of oil products are good for all hair types. I adore the Nexxus brand and normally love all of their shampoo and conditioners, so I decided to try this Nexxus Oil Infinite Conditioner.The conditioner has a light, sweet scent to it. I find it pleasant and it seems to fade after I am out of the shower. The conditioner got rid of the tangles and made my hair feel soft and great outside of the shower, but nothing special. Unfortunately, after a night of work it makes my hair slightly oily. It isn't too bad and I can and will continue to use the conditioner, but it is nothing special. As a side note, I later received the Nexxus Oil Infinite Shampoo and when I pair the two together my hair gets SUPER greasy and oily. I think the conditioner on its own is less of an issue since I don't apply it to the roots. Overall, I like the conditioner when used by itself, but I don't think it is worth the price.

I typically buy the Glad garbage bags that stretch, but I was happy to review another brand. The first thing that I noticed when this box arrived was that it was rather large and heavy for 45 garbage bags. It also currently has a lot of box tops for education on them which is nice. If you don't collect those, save them for someone who does. Our education system can use all the help it can get. Anyways, there were several things that stood out to me when I opened the box and viewed the bags. The apple scent is FAINT. It definitely is not enough to stand up to the stench of my cats and their litter. This is a shame since the odor block was one of the selling features for me. Then again, my regular garbage bags do not stand up to their stench either. These bags are also NOT the stretch bags. They are still pretty sturdy and did not rip on me. I do love that the bags have the good, strong tie handles.Overall, these are good garbage bags. Do they block all the odor? No. Do they break? Not easily. Would I buy them again? Probably. Will I switch from my usual bags to these? No.

This is a great charging cable! It has USB 2.0 and charges at about the same speed or faster than my other cables. The cable is just over 3 feet which makes it the perfect length for most circumstances. I have been using it in my car plugged in to a usb car charger, at work plugged into my desktop tower and at home plugged in to a usb power adapter. It has functioned well in all of these situations. I can pretty much never have enough usb cables and this is a good one. I recommend it.*I received this product in exchange for a honest, unbiased review.

I have recently started using "gel creams" more often for moisturizing because they go on easily and they don't feel heavy on your skin. I am typically a fan of AHAVA products. Unfortunately, this one missed the mark for me. It is more cream and less gel cream compared to the other products that I have tried of this nature. This product is thick and it goes on heavy. It makes my skin feel greasy and I have a hard time not washing it off. I will probably use the rest of the container for my feet or elbows where I don't mind the heavy and greasy feeling as much. I have tried it on my elbows and I do like the cream there. So, all is not lost.I will say that I am super picky about moisturizers and I hate the feel of heavy creams on my face. Other people may love this product. It depends on your preference and for that reason I am giving this 3 stars and not less. If you like heavy moisturizers, you will probably love this.

I am one of those people that hate the feel of lotion or creams, particularly when they are greasy. As I have gotten older, moisturizing has become a necessity. I am happy to report that I really love this cream. It only requires a small amount to moisturize your hands. There is a faint, sweet smell. It is light and doesn't linger.The cream is thick, but it doesn't feel heavy going on your hands. It leaves my hands feeling soft and silky. Witch Hazel is really good for your skin too. I use it as a moisturizing toner on my face. So, I am hoping it will help my hands to stay young looking. I have also been putting this on my feel here and there because they have been super dry and it is heavenly. I definitely recommend this cream! I would buy it again.

EXTERMINATE! EXTERMINATE! What is better than comfy socks? Comfy Doctor Who socks!! I am a Whovian and I was so excited to receive these socks. They came looking just like the picture and I was thrilled that they were also soft and comfortable. I live in Florida and I like my socks to be minimal (low cut or ankle socks and thin), but still sturdy and comfortable. These socks are all of these things I love the colors. I have worn the blue and orange a few times. The grey have been neglected because they aren't as bright...but I will get to them too. They are slightly big on me because the black ankle part is up on my heel. However, they feel like they fit perfect. The huge dalek print is amazing. Overall, these are great socks and would be great as a gift for any Whovian. I recommend them.*I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest, unbiased review.

My Husband has always wanted a coffee grinder. So, we were both happy to receive this. We have been using K-cups for a few years now and we were getting fed up with the ridiculous prices. So, we purchased some refillable cups  and this grinder and we are now drinking freshly ground coffee from our Keurig. It tastes so much better when it is freshly ground!This Coffee Land Manual Coffee Grinder allows you to adjust how fine the grind is. You do have to work for your coffee, but it isn't that much effort and is worth the better taste. The grinder is easy to use with the large handle on the lid. The container that your ground coffee drops in to is glass. So, it will keep the ground coffee fresh and won't contaminate it from one brand to the next. The entire grinder is also easy to take apart and clean.I also love that it came with the most adorable smiley face spoon and fork as a bonus. This is a great machine and I recommend it.*I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest, unbiased review.

This is my second ZAQ diffuser and my 5th diffuser overall. Honestly, ZAQ makes a far superior product to the other companies that I have tried. This diffuser is not only nice looking, it is well made and highly effective.To fill the diffuser, you simply lift off the top half of the pyramid, fill the plastic container that is included up with water, pour the water in, place a few drops of essential oil (3-5 is recommended, but I do 6-10), replace the top and press a button. It cycles through several different colors. If you find a color you like, press the button again to stop it on that color. Or, you could press the button a third time to turn off the colors while still diffusing. If you press the button four times, it turns off the machine.This ZAQ Noor diffuser has a very powerful stream of air that comes out the top. I placed lemon essential oil in it and my entire living room and kitchen was smelling amazing in a few minutes. I also love the price of this diffuser. At less than $40, it is definitely one of the better ones on the market for this price. I highly recommend this diffuser!*I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest, unbiased review.

I ordered this eyeglass holder for my Husband. He keeps his reading glasses on his small nightstand and often knocks them over, spills stuff on them or lays something on top of them. We are both always worried that his glasses will be destroyed. This eyeglass holder is actually a lot nicer looking in person than on the listing. It is very sturdy and takes up little space on our nightstand. It is exactly what we needed. I definitely recommend it and I am probably going to buy myself one too!*I received this product in exchange for my honest, unbiased review.

We own about two dozen dart guns, so we are always excited to try the latest and greatest. If you are a huge fan of mods, this is definitely the dart gun for you. It comes with a few pieces, but if you really want to mod it out you will have to buy mod packs that cost $11.99-34.99 each (there are four of them designed for this gun...but you can use parts from other guns or other mods too). If you buy all the mods, there are supposedly over one thousand combinations.Anyways, this is a good gun. I don't love that it is battery powered. I do like that it has a banana clip and shoots fast and pretty accurate. I wish the banana clip could hold more darts. It only holds 10. Of course, you can replace it with clips from other guns or even buy a larger clip for it. One of the mods is a flip clip.Overall, this is a good gun. It just isn't my favorite. Honestly, most of the mods are not necessary. It is more of a "cool" factor than anything. If you want an awesome new gun for dart battles, I would recommend the new Nerf Zombie Strike Doominator Blaster which I also ordered and love a lot more.

I am a huge fan of Tresemme Shampoo and Conditioner. So, I was excited to try this Youth Boost shampoo. My hair is starting to fall out more and have a little less volume as I age. I could use whatever help I can get.This shampoo unfortunately comes in a smaller bottle. I prefer to buy the bigger bottles of Tresemme that last a lot longer. The shampoo has a nice scent. It is hard to describe. It sort of smells like a mixture of flowers and berries. I find it refreshing in the shower and the smell does not linger. My hair feels and smells amazing after I use this shampoo. Even more importantly, it has noticeably more volume and is shiny and healthy looking.I would definitely recommend this shampoo!

This Groom Industries Perky Fur Broom sweeps up dirt, fur and dust easily. I was impressed with just how much of the dirt in collected into a pile on our floor. I think it actually does a better job than our regular straw broom. I did have two problems with it however.1- Assembly. It comes in four different pieces. The broom handles are supposed to just connect easily by pushing them together. I thought I had assembled it fully until I tried to use it and the handle was bending and coming apart. My Husband asked to see it and pushed the handle together the rest of the way. For reference, there should not be any white showing in between the joints. If there is, keep pushing them together. It technically only takes seconds to assemble, but it does require a lot of strength. I couldn't do it on my own.2- It's hard to actually get the dirt pile off the floor using this. I tried to use this broom with a dustpan I have and it didn't work out very well because of the width of the broom. In the end, I ended up using my old straw broom with the dustpan to get the rest of it up.Overall, I like this rubber broom and I will continue to use it especially to collect the pet fur and dirt off of my floors.

I ordered these Stoon Bluetooth earbuds to use at work. I have a desk job with other people nearby that involves a lot of getting up, walking around and answering phones. So, I wanted to be able to listen to music to where only I could hear it, still hear the phone and my coworkers and be able to walk around at the same time. It sounds like a lot to ask for, but these earbuds allow me to do it.Pros:-No dangling wires-You can add a second earbud with the included attachments if you want a set of earbuds. I only need one.-Clear sound via Bluetooth-No skipping when walking aroundCons:-The earbud is shaped awkwardly. It isn't really uncomfortable, but I feel as though it is going to fall out (even though it doesn't).-The accessories are easy to lose. The earbud itself is even easy to lose.Overall, this is a nice earbud. It is definitely a great deal for the price. My only real issue is that I am finicky when it comes to my ears and it really annoys me that it feels like it is not sitting right. For this reason, I am giving them 4 stars instead of 5.*I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for my honest, unbiased review.

I am constantly looking for a spoon or fork at work, so I wanted to get a spork to keep in my locker. This Tapirus set is really nice because you receive four sporks in a zippered carrying case. These would also be great for camping or tailgating too. The spork set has a spoon on one end and a fork that has a knife on one edge on the opposite side. So, you have all of your plastic utensils in one. I used it to eat my yogurt for a snack, my salad for lunch and some leftover salmon and vegetables the next day. It works great. I also love that it is BPA free. I would definitely recommend this set.*I received this product in exchange for my honest, unbiased review.

This GrayBunny Shepherd Hook is just what my front yard needed. As a matter of fact, it could use a few of them and I plan on buying more. The Shepherd's Hook is 4 feet tall, so it is not super high. However, it is the height that I wanted for my purposes. I debated whether to hang a plant, a lantern or a birdhouse from the hook. In the end, I choose a pretty garden ornament. I had been trying to figure out how to hang it from my roof and this works out much better. It looks gorgeous in my garden area in front of my house. The hook is really easy to place into the ground with little effort. I just placed it where I wanted it and put my foot on the bottom. It slid into the hard dirt like butter. SUMMER JOB is one of those one-and-a-half star five star movies that's so bad it's good. Yeah, the script was written on a cocktail napkin , the editing is deplorably choppy, the acting is uneven, and most of the humor hits its marks only at unintended moments, but SUMMER JOB is the type of film that nobody makes anymore --- a low-budget T & A comedy --- that is fun simply because it is utterly mindless. Pop open a cold one and roll your eyes a lot. The soundtrack of the film is a tour de force of a band called OrKestra. Never heard of them? Neither did anyone else. The pretty girls and pretty boys of SUMMER JOB spend most of their time leering at each other, and almost all the bikini tops in this movie have a far-less-than-deplorable tendency to surrender to gravity. I say "almost all" because the stunningly statuesque "Mystery Woman" of SUMMER JOB succeeds in keeping the mystery intact while playing a double role. Although most of the young actors and actresses of SUMMER JOB remained unknowns, Sherrie Rose moved on to acting, scriptwriting and production, and Amy Lynn Baxter gained fifteen minutes of notoriety (that's seven-and-a-half minutes per boob) on the Howard Stern Show.

I bought this CD to celebrate my 55th (egad!) birthday. It's an excellent compilation, a mix of stereo and mono recordings, and most (but not all) of the Beach Boys' real classics are included.  I would have enjoyed more live performances and some of the circa 1967 SMiLE material, but considering that they have presented us with 30 songs on one CD (and with fine sound quality) I won't complain.  A good disc when you need to pop it in the player, drop the top, and take a ride on a sunny day.

According to the biographies, Morgan Llywelyn was born in New York (or Ireland)(or possibly on-board ship sailing between the two). In any event, she is thoroughly Irish (or Irish-American)(or as Welsh as her name). Her love of history came early, when her mother encouraged her to explore her Llywelyn roots. This exploration made her a modern reinterpreter of the old Celtic legends which she presents in the form of novels. Prolific, she has written more than a score of books in that many years.Given the length of most of her works, her imagination is clearly protean. The quality of her output is unsurprisingly uneven, to be objectively critical. You can't have a winner every time, especially at that pace. I've liked many of her books, but disliked others.In "The Horse Goddess" we meet the ancient Celts of the Iron Age Hallstatt Era. In "Druids" we are witness to the downfall of the Gauls in the face of Roman imperialism. In "Bard: The Odyssey of the Irish" we view an unspoiled Ireland first being colonized by the Celtiberians. In "Red Branch" we are presented with a readable retelling of the Ulster Cycle legends."1972" is a continuation of Llywelyn's "Irish Century" series of books. The story opens in the early 1950s, and focuses primarily on the growth and maturation of Ursula "Precious" Halloran's son, Barry (or to give him his birth name, Finbar).  The identity of Barry's father is uncertain. Ursula, the young Irish Republican firebrand  of "1916," "1921," and "1949" is still shocking people with her unconventional and independent lifestyle, but she has more and more retreated into obscurity on the family's farm in County Clare. Ireland of the 1950s and 1960s has become an almost pathologically repressive society in which women most definitely hold second class citizenship. Ursula is doing all she can to teach Barry to disrespect such repressive norms. Like his mother, Barry eventually becomes a journalist, though he chooses photography rather than radio as his medium.Morgan Llywelyn places Barry and his camera (by contrivance, deus ex machina, and plot device after plot device) at the scene of every major domestic political incident in Ireland of the era, including the "Bloody Sunday" of 1972 (which began as a peace march). Unfortunately, once Barry reaches young adulthood, Llywelyn all but ignores plot, color, and character development in favor of straight historical reportage (thus the Three Stars of this review).As the "story" progresses toward its eponymous climactic year,  Barry the character fades, becoming little more than an authorial conceit. "1972" begins to read like a textbook on modern Irish history, or perhaps Llywelyn's own memoir of the time. And although she is scrupulous in documenting incidents (to the extent of footnoting) "1972" has a decidedly partisan feel.Llywelyn  is a staunch Irish Republican of the old school, for whom Padraig Pearse is the ideal man. She so strongly abhors and abjures the meaningless and ego-driven violence that engulfs the north of Ireland in the early 1970s, but she never really seems to grasp the deeper Whys? and Wherefores? of it. Llywelyn tends to place the blame for the violence on self-serving individuals (on both sides of the line) but doesn't really delve into why those people became self-serving or why they attracted followers. She recites the history, but does not analyze it (a necessity in the best historical fiction).An advocate of peace, and an advocate of a liberal and diverse Ireland, the goals she espouses are admirable, and almost utopian, but within the scope of the world as it existed in "1972" they remain utterly unachievable.They remain barely achievable today.By mildly fictionalizing history, Llywelyn allows us to get inside the troubled history of Ireland, north and south. Take advantage of the endnotes to delve deeper---many of the characters' quotes are their actual words, either spoken or written.This is the fourth volume in what became Morgan Llywelyn's "Irish Century" series which consists of  "1916," "1921,"  "1949", "1972," and "1999: A Novel of the Celtic Tiger and the Search for Peace," all critical turning points in modern Ireland's history, and all seen through the eyes of the Halloran family

Greta, Willow, and Solana Gothard are three multitalented sisters hailing from the Pacific Northwest. They play a variety of instruments (focusing on strings), and perform traditional Celtic music as well as their own Celtic-tinged compositions. They are also champion stepdancers.Their videos are great fun to watch. They always remind me a little of Tolkien's elves, bright, blonde and ethereal, an image reinforced by the natural settings in which they play and their frequent use of medieval style clothing.They are extremely accomplished performers who have an impeccable sense of one another's timing. Solana, the youngest sister, is their primary vocalist. She has a pleasant, if markedly regional, singing voice that is well suited to their choice of material, which on this album includes standards such as "Danny Boy" and "The Whistling Gypsy Rover" and the Gothard Sisters composition "Flying Sails."

Camille and Kennerly Kitt are classically-trained identical twin harpists who have taken their not inconsiderable talents on the most ethereal of stringed instruments and applied them to the field of popular music. HARP ATTACK 2 is the second volume in a collection of themes from a broad selection of heavy metal, "hair band" and "stadium rock" artists. The very uniqueness of "The Harp Twins"' arrangements are arresting. This is a phenomenal listening experience, especially for listeners who think that "classical" instruments can only create "classical" music.  Much more is available on their You Tube channel or as mp3 downloads, and these two beautiful young women will not only capture your ears they will capture your full attention and hold it.

David Halberstam's insightful classic, for which he won his first Pulitzer Prize, should really have been entitled INHERITING A QUAGMIRE, because the U.S. did not create the morass that was Vietnam, it only complexified it. The reality of Vietnam is that the only time to have unraveled its tangled skein was in 1945, when Ho Chi Minh, then a young nationalist leader of the Viet Minh movement, wrote to Franklin Delano Roosevelt, asking him to use his influence with the French to establish autonomous states within the French Union (France's version of the Commonwealth of Nations) in what had been wartime Japanese-occupied French Indochina.Unfortunately for history, for Vietnam, and for the United States, FDR died before he could address Ho's correspondence, and Harry S Truman ignored it in favor of supporting the U.S.'s wartime ally. Had FDR lived (which he did not) and had he taken up Ho's cause (which he may well have either singly or through the mechanisms of the new United Nations), and had he influenced the French positively (a remote possibility), then Vietnam would have been what America always pretended it was, a bulwark against Communist expansion.Ignored by America, Ho turned to the Soviet Union (as, later, did Fidel Castro). It is perhaps one of the greatest failings of American postwar foreign policy that American planners saw the Second World as entirely monolithic and conflated Marxism with Stalinism.  Had the State Department not been so ossified, it is quite likely that non-Communist though truly democratic Marxist nation-states might have helped to bring down the inflexible, often dangerous, willfully blind U.S.S.R. by exporting their own brand of democracy through the Third World.By the time David Halberstam reached South Vietnam in 1961, the die was cast. Rather than supporting the goals of the Viet Minh, the United States had demonized it, supported the old French imperial structure, and had pushed the Viet Minh into the outstretched claws of the Insatiable Red Beast. In some ways, this mistake was understandable. Picking up the fallen banner of the West after the 1954 French defeat at Dien Bien Phu, the United States (which had just fought against Communist aggression in Korea) made the mistake of equating Vietnam with Korea --- as at first glance they seemed equivalent as two east Asian nations divided artificially at parallels, North and South, Communist and Free World. This view led to an unnecessary military buildup along the 17th Parallel.However, aside from the superficial similarities described, Korea and Vietnam could not have been more different.The war in Vietnam was an insurgency, with fighting not along the borders but throughout the territory of the propped-up southern republic. The Communists of Vietnam were not the conquerors of the country, they were the patriots who had won the war against the French. And there were as many patriots in the South as there were in the North. Thus, even those who disliked the Communist model were of two minds about fighting the Viet Cong.Making a confused situation far worse was the fact that the government of the South was not a government at all; from 1955 to 1963, South Vietnam was a family dictatorship under the Ngo clan, managed by fiat and by whim. The Ngo family was Catholic, drawn from the French-dominated upper-class, while most of the country was Buddhist. Under the Ngo clan, only Catholics rose to prominence. Personal loyalty to the clan rated above loyalty to the country. Competent administrators and military commanders who told the Ngos what they did not want to hear were usually subject to marginalization, sometimes exile, sometimes arrest, and occasionally death. President Ngo Dinh Diem was a Mandarin --- isolated, autocratic, singularly moral, but closed off from the people.Diem's large extended family, particularly his power-intoxicated brother Ngo Dinh Nhu and Nhu's frightening wife, the histrionic Madame Nhu, maintained their status by displays of Fascist pomp. They depended upon American support, publicly denounced the United States, and actively confounded all American plans for land reform, defense, and social programming. Cheerfully ignoring the advice of American political and military figures in regard to sustaining the country, they were responsible for their own downfall.Ngo leadership of South Vietnam was focused only upon maintaining Ngo power, while the Second World plan for the entire country was touted by its proponents, the Viet Cong, as better organized and more humane than the chaos which was the First World plan. That the Communists later became brutal and repressive in turn was almost inevitable, but in the early 1960s, they seemed to hold out hope for a stable society.U.S. leaders in South Vietnam were convinced against all logic that they could control and direct the Ngos despite every indication to the contrary. Sadly, having painted the United States into a corner by backing a cadre of tin-pot dictators, American advisors hypnotized themselves with their own hyperbole, suppressed reports of failures, and became pathologically optimistic about South Vietnam's chances to be self-sustaining, even as the thatch caved in and the walls of the house that was South Vietnam came down. Halberstam claims that only the journalists saw the full picture at the time, and he is probably right.In part, this policy of pathological optimism was a reaction to concurrent events such as President Kennedy's dismal handling of the Bay of Pigs invasion in Cuba, his humiliation by Khruschev at Vienna, the rise of the Berlin Wall, and the Cuban Missile Crisis.Admissions of failure in American foreign policy simply were not a viable choice in 1962-63, and so most Americans in Vietnam ignored the rabid elephant in the room, telling Washington what they wanted Washington to hear --- happy talk.Had Kennedy lived, it's possible that the American mission in Vietnam might have ended quietly in 1965 or 1966; but his death promoted Lyndon Baines Johnson to chair in the Oval Office.Johnson was the man who described Diem as "the Winston Churchill of Asia," a comment which speaks volumes about the American capacity for self-delusion. Johnson wanted to fight a war, and did, much to the detriment of the nation he led.Diem was gone by the time LBJ rose to power. Halberstam describes the last few months of the Diem regime as "a government committing suicide."  A popular protest led by Buddhist monks finally challenged Ngo power. Halberstam reports on the "Buddhist Crisis" but it's clear that he neither understands the Buddhists nor their motivations. Several monks immolated themselves, acts of sacrifice which galvanized the population. Madame Nhu, for her part, "clapped her hands" and made public statements alluding to the "barbecues." South Vietnam was ripe for a coup, and a coup occurred, ending in Diem's and Nhu's deaths. Madame Nhu fled to Europe.Having let South Vietnam kill itself, the United States was not satisfied to let the corpse rest, but tragically and pointlessly kept trying to reanimate it by assuming the leading role in a war only a minority of Vietnamese wished to fight. The 56,000 Americans (and millions of Vietnamese) who died in this most unnatural of wars still have no living legacy.One can criticize Halberstam's "know everything" tone, and hindsight is always 20/20, but for anyone interested in understanding how America got drawn into an endless war, THE MAKING OF A QUAGMIRE is an essential read, especially in these days of the War Without End on Terror.

Harold Holzer's LINCOLN PRESIDENT-ELECT shines a light on a rarely-studied period of American history, that of what Holzer calls a little inaccurately the "interregnum" between the Presidential election of November 1860 and the inauguration of  Lincoln as President in March 1861.Yet, in another sense, "interregnum," the period between royal reigns, is the perfect term. Lincoln's predecessor, the doughface James Buchanan was not simply a lame duck President, he was an abysmally failed leader who did absolutely nothing as the Union convulsed and a coterie of men created the Confederate States of America, a doppleganger of a nation the purposes of which were never clear even in its day.Lincoln, or the spectre of Lincoln, was the proximate cause of the convulsion. In 1820, the Missouri Compromise was passed between the pro-slavery and anti-slavery factions in the United States Congress, involving primarily the regulation of slavery in the western territories. It prohibited slavery in the former Louisiana Territory north of the parallel 36∞30‚Ä≤ north except within the boundaries of the proposed State of Missouri. To balance the number of "Slave States" and "Free States," the northern region of what was then Massachusetts was admitted into the United States as a Free State to become Maine. Thomas Jefferson prophesied that the division of the country created by the Compromise Line would eventually lead to the destruction of the Union:"...but this momentous question, like a fire bell in the night, awakened and filled me with terror. I considered it at once as the knell of the Union. It is hushed indeed for the moment. But this is a reprieve only, not a final sentence. A geographical line, coinciding with a marked principle, moral and political, once conceived and held up to the angry passions of men, will never be obliterated; and every new irritation will mark it deeper and deeper."And so it happened. The election of Lincoln, the first Republican President, and a perceived abolitionist, was the mark that tore the national fabric. It is important to note that Lincoln was NOT an abolitionist in 1860; at most, he wanted to restrict the expansion of slavery into new U.S. Territories. Yet despite this oft-repeated position, the South (and pro-slavery Northerners, of whom there were more than a few) refused to heed the President-Elect's words, focusing instead on their fears.No President has been hated more than Abraham Lincoln, who was derided as "an ape" and worse, even before he announced his candidacy. Almost as soon as he was elected (and long before he was inaugurated) the Southern States began to secede. That this was the desire of a few fire-eating Southerners who sought power and influence in a new political entity is abundantly clear. That they took the mass of the citizenry living south of the Mason-Dixon Line with them by baldfaced manipulation of the facts is also clear. Many people distrusted the secessionists; a noted Virginian referred in December 1860 to lone seceded South Carolina as "that impudent little vixen."Lincoln has long been criticized for doing nothing and saying nothing during the four month long "Secession Winter." In truth, Holzer shows us that Lincoln picked his words with extraordinary care during the interregnum, choosing most often to say nothing since nothing was truly the best thing to say. Without authority, any word of Lincoln's could worsen the crisis, and even in the earliest weeks of his pre-Presidency Lincoln feared losing the Border States. He also wanted, if he could, to calm the fears of the States of the Upper South. That hysteria overtook his attempts at pouring oil on troubled waters was perhaps an inevitability.Instead of speaking publicly, Lincoln spoke privately --- to visiting politicians and national leaders in closed-door meetings, and to thousands upon thousands of ordinary citizens seeking Federal patronage jobs, people he met with individually. Among them were folk from the Deep South who'd come to see "the monster" and went away feeling that the President-Elect was a man uniquely suited for the task ahead. Other reviewers criticize Holzer for not sufficiently documenting these meetings, open and closed, but the 19th Century was unlike the 21st --- there was less mania to record a person's every act.For a politician, Lincoln made very few missteps. No, he didn't speak out often, but perhaps that was better, as he apparently himself believed. No matter what he said, his words were used as wedges by the highly politicized Press of the day. Often the same phrases evoked violently disparate reactions in editors and readers depending on Party and Section, and day of the week. Speaking less under such circumstances was probably wiser, as it allowed him to focus more on creating his Presidency and less on defending it.When Lincoln did speak publicly, his preplanned speeches rang with authenticity, but his off the cuff remarks were sometimes sloppy.  Still, only occasionally did he misstep, and once only with clearly damaging consequences, when he allowed himself to be smuggled through pro-secesh Baltimore in the face of a threat of assassination. Coming immediately before his arrival in Washington, it gave the appearance of skulking into the capital; at the same time, Holzer provides enough, if not conclusive, evidence that Lincoln did evade an assassin.Holzer does not spend a great deal of time discussing in a general, historical sense, the slow implosion of the Union in these four months. How the implosion impacted Lincoln in the broadest sense is skimped, and whether the President-Elect had to radically shift his views, or how much, between November and March Holzer seems to overlook. The focus of the book is on the man and only secondarily on policy, an oversight that seems invisible while reading the book but glaring in retrospect and costs it a star. Otherwise, this is a readable, enjoyable, and very necessary addition to the vast library written on the Civil War.

I received this CD as a gift from a spiritual teacher in the wake of the death of Hope, my significant other who just recently died at 45. "It will help you," I was told. "Help you to sleep, help you to sort things out."I fell asleep listening to it. The next day, I was at the Japanese Garden which our town is fortunate to have, and I met a man playing a Japanese flute---including one of these compositions. Amidst the purple orchids (her favorite color) I wept.I can think of no better endorsement for this CD than the action of the universe. Delve into FLOWERS OF SILENCE. And share your experiences.

Norman Jewison's dystopian parable of a world rendered complacent is a far better commentary on evolving social mores than it is a science fiction film. In fact, ROLLERBALL (1975) is less scientific than merely futuristic.The world of ROLLERBALL was supposed to look futuristic compared to contemporary 1975, but the stage settings now look bizarrely "mod" and retro in 2013 (look at the computer-printer fonts, for example). Our 2013 society has both stepped back away from and toward the ROLLERBALL world, with our current strange societal mix of religious fanaticism and corporate greed. It's likely, however, that many people would mindlessly and happily submit to a world where their whims would be sated while their thoughts would be strangled.After as period of political unrest which has done away with national governments and after a world war of sorts in which individual corporations have merged into huge conglomerates, in the year 2018 the world is run efficiently and effectively by an oligarchy of seven corporate CEOs representing basic human needs such as Food, Health, Energy, and Luxury.
