Another win for Style J! I love the fit on this, it hugs my hips and then flairs out around my knees. I have gotten several compliments. It fits perfectly and like all of the skirts I have from them, it holds up perfectly after being laundered. The color is great

I got this to replace my 20 year old toaster oven that finally gave out. I was at first disappointed that I couldn't find one that had a pull down lever for the toast option. But now that I have figured this one out, I am very satisfied. The top knob is for the top heating and the middle one is for bottom heating. The bottom knob is the timer that turns it on. I like that the dials don't turn too easily, so no accidental wrong temperatures. I think it toasts just fine, the bread in the back toasts a little more but no big deal. It is decent sized, I can bake a potato without having to turn on my oven.I am very happy with this. The price is great, too.

This watch looks fantastic. I love black and silver and I like that the background is black. It has three smaller dials, one for military time, one for  stopwatch seconds, one for stopwatch minutes. It also has the numerical date (day of the month only).I prefer men's watches because they are bigger, more like chunky jewelry. This one is too big. You can remove links to size it smaller, I just don't have the right tools. I'm trying to improvise as I really want to wear it soon. It is water resistant. I don't think I will wear it swimming but I do wash my hands frequently and snow is coming soon, I assume.This would make a great gift. It comes in a bright yellow box and a cute little pillow to fit inside the watch.

I love this for the most part. It is a great organizer to have in my cubicle. The only issue is it can be a pain to put it up every morning because the part it hooks on to is not permanently attached to the part that hooks into the cubicle fabric. Probably not an issue for most but I have to take it down and lock up the folders each night because of confidential paperwork

This is very pretty, looks just like the picture. I'm using it to cover a table right now but I plan to hang it up once I get some painting done. It is thin fabric, not something you would use as a blanket.

This watch is gorgeous, I love the look of silver with the faux diamond crystals around the face, and roman numerals at 12,3,6,and 9. The face is a little larger than what you usually find on women's watches but I prefer it this way. The clasp is sturdy, you can't even see it when you are wearing it, making this look more like a bracelet. And it is water-resistant but not for diving or snorkeling in case this is a deal-breaker for you. It comes in a fancy box that is great if you are giving this as a gift.

This is probably the most flimsy of any Kindle case I have ever had. The polyurethane cover is okay but once you move the flap back to the standing position is stays puckered up a bit, even the the case is held closed with magnets. The inside that holds the tablet feels like durable enough, it has cutouts for the power button, charger port, camera, volume, and speakers. I don't feel like my kindle will fall out but it isn't as snug as I would like. This also is a bit bulky, it doesn't feel comfortable to hold which I am reading it. It is certainly less expensive than the Amazon one but I have nicer covers for similar price.

This watch is gorgeous though not as functional as I'd like. The smaller dials tell the date, day of the week, and military time. But they are very small and I have to squint to see them, especially if the large and small hands are blocking them. You can adjust the smaller dials by the two push buttons on the side. I like the large face and the band is comfortable once you work the leather a little. Probably a little higher priced for what it does.

My dogs really like this and I was happy with the ingredients though I'd prefer sweet potatoes to be higher on the lIst than brown rice. But I recently found out that some of Solid Gold dog food is made by Diamond dog food. I'm just not comfortable taking chances so I won't be giving this to my dogs again.

I bought this because I dropped the cover on an overhead light while changing the bulbs. It comes with the equipment to install an overhead light, but I just needed the cover. It is pretty and you can't see the two light bulbs underneath. This is better than the square covers. It arrived in safe packaging to prevent breakage.

Disclaimer: I received this product free in exchange for an honest review.This is the second Luseta product line I have been lucky enough to receive for review. This first was the Argan Oil line, which I loved. The Keratin shampoo and conditioner are equally wonderful. The shampoo is moisturizing without stripping color, which is important as I color my hair red and that can fade easily. The conditioner is also moisturizing and my hair was very soft after use. It was still soft after using the blow dryer and hair straightener, I did have to use any oil or serum with it. When I just air-dry my hair, it didn't get frizzy. And the smell is very nice, not like products with added fragrance that can be too strong. And no sulfates!Both shampoo and conditioner come in large bottles, so the price is pretty reasonable for the amount you will be getting.I noted in my review of the Argan Oil products that the shampoo and conditioner look the same, a creamy white, so just double check the label as it is the same with the Keratin line. They are packaged well so that there is no leakage during delivery. The pumps are handy.

Disclosure: I received this product free in exchange for an honest review.I love having the opportunity to review shampoo and conditioning products because even if I don't like them I can use the shampoo as bubble bath and the conditioner for shaving.  But after using them, I know the Luseta Argan Oil products will not be in my bath! I have been disappointed with some of the oil hair products that are coming out. The last one made my hair drier. It was also nice to be able to use the shampoo and conditioner together and get a better sense of the quality of the products.I used these after coloring my hair, when it can be dry. Normally, I have to use the conditioner that comes in the box. The Luseta shampoo was creamy and moisturizing, it did not strip any color, it is sulfate-free. The conditioner was fabulous, my hair feels softer than before I colored it. It's so soft, I keep running my hands through it. It didn't get frizzy when I just let it dry naturally. I am very happy with these products. They both also smell nice. I look forward to trying out their hair oil treatment.They come in very large bottles, so I think the price is very reasonable for the pair. This will last a long time. I also like that it comes in a pump form, it is more convenient. Just note that both the shampoo and conditioner are a creamy white, it would be easy to mix them up without looking at the label. My only suggestion to the company would be packaging that differentiates the different products in their line. I have received their Karatin shampoo and conditioner to review and the bottles look the same as this line.

I live in the north east and everybody has low  vitamin D. Even though mine is low my doctor won't give me a prescription for the very high doses of D. My mom and aunt have them and they really notice a difference. I have been taking three of these a day. I haven't noticed a difference yet but I will probably be getting lab work done in a few months so then I will have more concrete evidence. I do like Viva Labs so I feel confident I am getting a high quality product.

While I did not love every story in here and I am not a James Patterson fan, I really enjoyed this as a whole. I am assuming that Patterson as editor means he picked what stories went in the collection. I think he did a great job and short stories might be my new favorite way of reading mysteries.  Many of the stories are not mysteries in the traditional way and I would consider them more as dark and literary stories. But they were still good. If I didn't like a story, no biggie, it wasn't very long. The only story I truly disliked was "Many Dogs Have Died Here". It was ridiculous and made no sense. But I discovered that Jeffery Deaver, whom I have heard of but never read, is a great writer, "The Adventure of the Laughing Fisherman" was my favorite and one that is a more traditional mystery and one that I had hoped to find he'd turned into a novel. I now have a short story collection of Deaver's on my Kindle to read. Joyce Carol Oates is in here with "The Home at Craigmillnar". I have read that previously in one of her collections and enjoyed it. Dennis Lehane and Michael Connelly wrote a story that brought together two characters they are known for; Patrick Kenzie and Harry Bosch. Most of the authors I had not even heard of before which I liked so then I didn't know what to expect. This was a great collection, perfect for people who enjoy mysteries even if they don't read them often. I think I may purchase the 2014 mystery collection.

If the rest of this season is as good as the season two premiere, then I will be getting my money's worth with my season pass. Such a hilarious episode, I am just really loving Edgar!Such a refreshing change from the usual sitcom fare.

I love this show. It is so funny and so different from anything else I have seen lately. I haven't seen these actors in anything before, they are so great, just perfect casting and great writing. So glad it was renewed for a second season.

I like using pencils and I always have to have them sharp. This is perfect for my desk at work. It is battery operated so that is one less annoying plug in my way. It is also not too loud so I don't disturb my co-workers. This worked great for regular pencils and mostly pretty well for my colored pencils, a couple were a bit choppy. I spent about 15 minutes trying to get the top off to clean out the shavings. The directions make it seem like you are supposed to twist the whole clear top. Finally, a co-worker came over and twisted off the small plastic piece at the top that I had thought was attached. So it's easy but apparently not idiot proof. It takes 4 AA batteries. I hope they won't have to be replaced very often, otherwise the cordless aspect isn't much of a plus.

Oh, how I love memory foam! I have a few toppers and practically have another mattress worth of them. I thought about adding this one on top but then I wouldn't even be able to climb in bed without stairs. I decided to remove the top one as it really was only a couple inches of memory foam and one inch of regular foam. When I put this new one on instead, I really noticed a difference. It is all memory foam and since it wasn't shipped as compressed as most of them are, it quickly became the full three inches. There are air holes for ventilation. I have never had an issue of memory foam being too warm, so I didn't notice anything different. I put a quilted topper on this and I sleep between layers of comforters and quilts, so I wouldn't notice anything anyway as far as temperature. The company says this is supposed to be one inch shorter in each side to fit with your sheets. I did not notice it shorter than my queen size mattress but it is shorter than other toppers. This is nice as it makes the bed look neater.So for the final test; sleeping. This topper is firmer than other toppers that I have and it actually was much more comfortable and hopefully, more durable. I slept fantastic!!! I find memory foam so much more comfortable than regular mattresses. My regular mattress was getting a bit soft, these toppers are a great way to put off having to make an expensive purchase. I would definitely recommend this topper, it is the best of all that I have tried.

This oil shampoo doesn't have much oil in it but it is a very creamy shampoo that gives lots of lather when you use it. I rarely find this with shampoos that are sulfate and silicone free which this is. I have missed that with what I currently use. That being said, I'm not sure that the outcome is much different from similar products. I thought the oil infusion would make my hair softer or that I'd be able to use this without conditioner on the days I don't need to blow dry but that did not happen. It made my hair feel somewhat dry. They may use some good ingredients but then they have alcohol or other drying ingredients. I can't believe this improves anyone's hair.It does make a decent bubble bath so not a total waste.

I like what this company is about, they seem very eco-friendly. I am all about using oils as much as possible. I frequently use coconut or almond oil to shave my legs. However, next to those, this product seems too oil-lite. When you rub it in your hands before applying it gets a little sudsy. This might be a step up from shaving with soap but there isn't enough oil to make a real difference. I didn't get a very good shave nor did it soften my skin like a good oil product should. It's too bad, this is a company I'd like to support. I will check out their other products, though.

I have used this cream for a few mornings and nights so far. It is light and doesn't cause any breakouts. The anit-fatigue part is that this is supposed to help with under-eye puffiness which I don't have. I have the dark circles. The only thing that helps with that is plenty of sleep and concealer. I have noticed, however, that I look less Zombie-ish in the mornings. And my concealer goes on easier. I think this is because it makes my skin softer, though I'd like to think it is because my lines are fading but I haven't noticed any change there. The cream does have a scent to it that doesn't bother me unless I rub my eyes, then they get irritated. I will update this review if people start telling me I look more rested or younger!

I am a big fan of Matthew Dicks. His last novel, Memoirs of an Imaginary Friend was a very touching and quirky novel that I just loved. Unfortunately, The Perfect Comeback of Caroline Jacobs pales in comparison. It is my least favorite of his novels. If you have never read his work, I suggest starting with Something Missing. If you read his one, you won't be inspired to read his other works.There are two reasons I didn't like this book. First, Caroline Jacobs. She is a pushover, she isn't a very interesting character. She irritated me. The second things I didn't like was that much of the plot seemed so contrived. Caroline gets mad and swears at a mom bully at a PTA meeting, then the next day  she picks up her daughter, Polly, at school because Polly punched another student in defense of her mother. Caroline doesn't take her home but instead takes her on a roadtrip back to where she grew up, so she can confront her former best friend, Emily, who ditched her once they started high school. I know bullying is a sensitive issue and a huge problem but I wouldn't say that Caroline had been bullied. Emily no longer wanted to be friends with Caroline because she wanted to be popular. She cut Caroline out of her life in a not very nice way but did not continue to harass her once she was out. Emily wasn't nice, certainly, but I found it hard to believe that this resulted in Caroline not being able to stand up for herself as an adult. Telling Emily off isn't going to accomplish anything and it felt forced that this was a decision Caroline suddenly made. But this was contrived to get Caroline back home where other events could be brought to light. There were parts of this book that were touching and meaningful. But the plot to get to those parts was very mediocre. There were some interesting characters, I really liked Polly.I would not recommend this book to anyone but I would recommend this author and his other books. I will definitely read his next book. This one just felt flat to me.

My grandmother's cats get more finicky about their food as they get older so I decided to entice them with these Divine Duos. The Tilapia pate with Ahi tuna was tried but not really loved. They mostly tried to get to the tuna. I think they would have eaten more if it didn't have the pate. However, they did love the chicken pate over diced salmon. It was the winner of the three, with tuna over diced salmon coming in second. They now only eat dry food if it is mixed with wet which is good as I think it would take a lot of canned food to fill them up.These easy peel back lids are nice, especially for an elderly grandma.The downfall is that Wellness isn't made in the US, so I don't know where they get their ingredients.The price wouldn't be so bad if that meant a better safety guarantee..

It I'd bad enough that there are promoted pins on interest but now there are spam pins mixed in. When you report the pin as spam, it still stays in your feed when you use this app. How many times have you seen that skiddles craft pin?? They look like regular pins but site up so frequently with no pinner name unless you click on the pin.I can only use pinterest on the web, the apps are now useless.

I am a big fan of oil cleansing. I started doing this a couple of years ago and my skin is so much better, I rarely break out. Unfortunately, this does not do what oil cleansing is supposed to do. Even though the first ingredient is mineral oil (not an oil that I use) it left my skin feeling dry. I have used Neutrogena products before and they are generally pretty good. But this is a fail. It is cheaper and more effective to use coconut or almond oil which are my preferences. Lots of people use olive oil and swear by it as well. Oil cleaning really does work for oily or acne prone skin. I wish I had learned this years ago.

I have never read anything by China Mi√©ville before but I first heard of him when The City & The City was released, it was all anyone on bookish social media could talk about. I'm not a huge fan of speculative fiction  so I never tried to read it. But when I had the opportunity to review this book, I grabbed it because short stories are the best way for me to try new genres.Mi√©ville didn't disappoint me. Such a variety of stories, many that left me hanging and wanting them to become novels and others that just seemed weird or disturbing and I would end up skipping to the next story. But because they were very different from each other, I am not able to get a solid feel for his writing. I don't think I could read one of his novels and know what to expect.I'm not sure I would recommend this to a reader unfamiliar with his work or not a fan of fantasy. But if you already like him, you will probably like these short stories.So like I said, not really my genre but I'm glad to have tried a new reading experience.

I had a really hard time getting into this book. The cover is very off-putting. It wasn't until I read good some reviews that I picked it back up and dove in. It was pretty average as far as writing and characters and the plot was just too familiar. Two girls are shipped off to live with their grandmother in Barbados because their mom can't take care of them. The older girl, Dionne is sixteen and ready to test boundaries. Phaedra is about ten and grows close to her grandmother who is an herbalist and midwife. Then the girls' no good father and trashy girlfriend show up to bring them back to Miami. Dionne wants to go but Phaedra knows her father is worthless.This is really a coming of age novel more than about a family. I felt that Phaedra was the central character and the most interesting. Other characters were not as well developed. Some reviews have commented that the novel makes them feel that they are in Barbados. I didn't feel anything like that, it was not very descriptive. I just didn't get any feelings about this story other than with the younger sister. Hyacinth, the grandmother, felt like a character I have met several times before. I honestly don't understand all the buzz about this book.I stand by my thoughts on the cover, I don't like it, although I read an article about why the author choose the get this work of art as her cover as it was done by a fellow artist from Barbados and it reminded her of Dionne. But I bet this will do better with ebook sales.

This is a gorgeous deck that looks like Renaissance paintings with gilded edges and is on good quality heavy stock.The back of the cards are a nice subtle pattern of beige and browns. It comes in a beautiful stand-up box that you will want to keep using, unlike some I have gotten with other decks. It also comes with a book that interprets the meaning of the cards and also fits in the box which is great. These are harder for me to read that the Hanson-Roberts tarot deck that I use most frequently along with the Rider-Waite. But these are what I imagined I would use when I first got into tarot. I hope to be using them soon and not just keep as a collector's deck. These are even more beautiful than The Llewellyn deck I purchased recently.
This is a great color, it is more sheer than lipstick so it doesn't feel painted on.

I'm not always sure why I can watch and rewatch this show. Some of the characters are annoying. But I really felt like there was more depth and complexity to this season.It could easily have been the last season as there are some closures with several plot lines but the renewed for Season 5 and I am glad. I love Jemima Kirke.

I love Eucalyptus oil. I find it has a lot of medicinal value for headaches and colds. When I mix it with peppermint oil it can knock out a migraine. I will pour a couple of drops in my bath water as well. Not too much, one or two, otherwise it can sting a little in combination with hot water. I usually buy Oils for NOW foods. This was better priced and the quality is just as good.

I'm addicted to these word puzzles! I like starting out with the easy ones and working my way up. I find I need less hits and can solve the puzzles faster. These keep my occupied during boring staff meetings. I only wish there were a wider variety of words. These are better than series 4 but still need some work.
These are strong and durable as I have heavy denim and winter skirts that would not hold well in my other hangers. These are great and the pins and be adjusted a little in each side for an even hang.

I purchased four wireless chargers. I needed two each for the office and home. I did not know which one would work best and I am giving you my opinions of the four wireless Qi chargers in this review.Yootech triangle $14 http://amzn.com/B00NWMI07SYeesite Charging stand: $22 http://amzn.com/B00UE9O0WQYeesite Bamboo charger $21 http://amzn.com/B00ZED4HMKAnker charger $12.50 http://amzn.com/B00Y839YMUI have a Motorola Droid Turbo 2 phone released in mid-November 2015. The phone also has Turbo Charge which is the same as Quick Charge 2.0. NONE of the wireless chargers will charge as fast as the Turbo or Quick Charge but the wireless does seem to charge about as fast as the regular wired charger. The Turbo or Quick Charge requires a special hi-power supply that is several times stronger than the regular USB wall power supplies and charges about 3 times faster than wireless or regular wired chargers.I did not test the 4 different chargers against each other for charging speed but they all seemed to charge at about the same rate using 2 amp USB wall power supplies. Most wireless chargers recommend using a 2 amp output or stronger power supply. Most do NOT include the power supply, only a USB cable. It simply makes sense that with an inductive charger the stronger the power source the stronger the charging field and the faster the charging. Only the Bamboo included a charger, therefore be prepared to supply your own 2 amp USB charger with most of these.One of the major problems with wireless or Qi charging is getting the phone on the sweet spot. If the phone is not positioned just right on the charger, it won't charge. This is a big issue as you can spend time jockeying the phone around on the charger to get it to recognize the charger and begin charging.Two of the chargers did excellent in ease of placement.The Youtech triangle was the easiest by far. If I placed the phone on the Yootech triangle, I got it right 9 of 10 times. It was easy to place and I rarely got it wrong.The stand was second with a caveat. My phone had to be raised about 1/2 inch to work. I simply placed a 9 volt battery on the stand and then put the phone on top of the 9 volt battery and it charged every time. I will rig something more visually appealing that is 1/2" high later. Wireless phone stands need a way of adjusting the height of the phone on the stand for varying sized phones or center charging spots on the phone. Although the 9v battery under the phone works, it is something the stand should have included to accommodate differing sized phones.Note: Your phone may not have a problem with the stand if the height is just right and thus you may need nothing to adjust the height. If that's the case, then the stand is the best bet because it is the easiest to place the phone and get right.With that consideration and a 9v battery, the stand wins hands down because it has positive placement and it keeps the phone in a position where you can see it on your desk with the Youtech triangle second.The bamboo was third and I could place it correctly about half the time and it looks exotic.The Anker was last and I could only place it correctly about a third of the time.The Anker does have the advantage of a more rubberized surface that keeps your phone from sliding off and it has the smallest footprint. Thus for mobile use the smaller size may weigh in heavily in it's favor.Note: This was the response from Anker: "Sorry to hear that Anker wireless charger does not work in your desired way. As stated on listing, this is a single-coil wireless charger, which makes it a bit difficult for adjusting positioning for charging."All charged well but you've got to get it charging first, thus my emphasis on the charging sweet spot.I will carry one in my laptop bag and that will be the Youtech triangle since the stand is too big and awkward to fit into a laptop bag. I will probably relegate the Anker and Bamboo chargers to some distant desk and order additional Youtech triangles. The Youtech is not called a triangle by Youtech, it just has a triangular shape and perhaps that is what gives it such a large sweet spot that makes placing your phone in a working position so easy.Best: Yootech triangle http://amzn.com/B00NWMI07SBest with height adjustment: Charging stand: http://amzn.com/B00UE9O0WQ3rd: Bamboo charger http://amzn.com/B00ZED4HMK4th: Anker http://amzn.com/B00Y839YMU

This seemed to be an excellent stirrer BUT it stopped working within a week after I first used it. It sat unused for a few weeks and it was beyond the 30 day return period. I contacted the seller twice but as of yet I have received no response.

This review covers the comparison of three different headphones.1. Max Rock Soft Silicone Headphones $9.99 MAXROCK (TM) Total Soft Silicon Headphones with Mic Sleep Choice for Cellphones Tablets and 3.5mm Jack (Green)2. Max Rock Metal Headphones $9.99 MAXROCK (TM) Slim Flat Cable 3.5mm Metal Headphones with Mic and Remote Control (Gray)3. Klipsch Ri6 Headphones $99.99 Klipsch R6i Black In-Ear Headphone with Patented Oval Tip (Black)Often it is not just a particular item that you are interested in, but you want the best item for the money. I built and owned a recording studio so I am more sensitive to sound quality than the average person. Of the three headphones, I purchased two of them at full price. I was given a discount coupon for an honest review of the Max Rock Soft Silicone headphones and got them for $1.00.This is my up-front summary of the three headphones.1. Max Rock Soft Silicone Headphone: Price $9.99. I paid with the discount coupon $1. Opinion: I want my dollar back.2. Max Rock Metal Headphones: Price $9.99. Opinion: Absolute BEST value for the money3. Klipsch Ri6 Headphones: Price $99.99. Opinion: Hard to decide which sounds best between the Max Rock Metal and Klipsch but with a 10X price difference the choice is a no-brainer.First, so we can get those out of the way and out of the picture, the Max Rock Soft Silicone Headphones. They sound terrible. The sound quality is like a muffled AM radio. You can hear the music but it is muffled in every frequency range. I got the solid green model. If you have streaks of red, yellow, purple and green in your hair then the green headphones will accent things beautifully. Otherwise the green looks cheap. The headphones feel cheaply made although I must admit they are as advertised - soft. The softness does make them comfortable in your ear but no more so than the silicone inserts the other two headsets and they actually don't feel as good as the other two headsets because they are floppy feeling in your ear. The major drawback with these headsets is simply that they sound terrible.If these headsets were waterproof, fireproof, zombie proof and doubled as a hacksaw then maybe those pluses would make it worthwhile in a survival situation. Otherwise the terrible sound simply is not worth it, even for a dollar. Enough said about the Max Rock Soft Silicone Headphones. Do not buy them.Next are the Max Rock Metal Headphones. They are the SAME price as the soft silicone but the sound, look and build quality is a world apart. They have clear bass, mid-range and decent highs. I switched between the Max Rock Metal and the Klipsch Headphones over a dozen times and could not decide which was better. They had different sound qualities but both were excellent. I purchased the Klipsch Headphones because a major consumer magazine rated them as a good value for the sound quality. The problem was they only tested rather high-end headsets. They did not test the Max Rock Metals.The sound difference basically is that the Klipsch maintains a more distortion free sound at maximum volume but the Max Rock is clearer sounding at a normal listening level. Both really sound good.The Klipsch is ten times the price of the Max Rock Metal. If I had not heard the Max Rock Metals then I would have thought the Klipsch was a good value but having heard the Max Rock Metal I am of a different opinion. If you want status, buy the Klipschs. If you want great sound quality, buy either. If you just hit the lottery for 100 million, buy the Klipschs. If your Amazon stock just went up in value a few million during the last week, buy the Klipschs. If you had lunch with Jeff Bezos recently and you bought him lunch because you've got more money, buy the Klipschs. They don't necessarily sound better, but they have a more prestigious name and status does matter to some.However, if you drive past three gas stations to save five cents a gallon and actually know what your bank balance is, buy the Max Rock Metal. If you want great value, buy the Max Rock Metals. Both headsets really have excellent sound but the price difference for similar sound is so vast that only the most stringent audio connoisseur will benefit from the sound difference and that's only if you think the Klipschs sound better. They sound different but it is objective as to which sounds better. After I listen for a few minutes I really can't tell which one I am listening to.I could not find the L or R marker on the Max Rocks and the L/R is super small on the Klipsch. The mic is on the left headset on both units so that makes it easy. The ear bud with the mic on the wire goes in the left ear. They should just say that in the instructions but neither headset tells you that simple fact that makes placing the headset in the correct ear easy.The wire on the Klipschs is a heavier gauge. This may make it more durable but it also makes it stiffer and heavier so that is a trade-off. If the wire does eventually break on the Max Rock, then you have nine more to buy before you equal the price of the Klipsch. I have more headsets lost the broken so in that respect the Max Rock definitely has the advantage of disposability.My recommendation, avoid the Max Rock Soft Silicone, buy the Max Rock Metal (or buy several pairs) and if you have money to burn and desire the status, buy the Klipsch Ri6.

They sound terrible. The sound quality is like a muffled AM radio. You can hear the music but it is muffled in every frequency range. I got the solid green model. If you have streaks of red, yellow, purple and green in your hair then the green headphones will accent things beautifully. Otherwise the green looks cheap. The headphones feel cheaply made although I must admit they are as advertised - soft. The softness does make them comfortable in your ear but no more so than the silicone inserts the other two headsets and they actually don't feel as good as the other two headsets because they are floppy feeling in your ear. The major drawback with these headsets is simply that they sound terrible.If these headsets were waterproof, fireproof, zombie proof and doubled as a hacksaw then maybe those pluses would make it worthwhile in a survival situation. Otherwise the terrible sound simply is not worth it, even for a dollar. Enough said about the Max Rock Soft Silicone Headphones. Do not buy them.Next are the Max Rock Metal Headphones. They are the SAME price as the soft silicone but the sound, look and build quality is a world apart. They have clear bass, mid-range and decent highs. I switched between the Max Rock Metal and the Klipsch Headphones over a dozen times and could not decide which was better. They had different sound qualities but both were excellent. I purchased the Klipsch Headphones because a major consumer magazine rated them as a good value for the sound quality. The problem was they only tested rather high-end headsets. They did not test the Max Rock Metals.The sound difference basically is that the Klipsch maintains a more distortion free sound at maximum volume but the Max Rock is clearer sounding at a normal listening level. Both really sound good.The Klipsch is ten times the price of the Max Rock Metal. If I had not heard the Max Rock Metals then I would have thought the Klipsch was a good value but having heard the Max Rock Metal I am of a different opinion. If you want status, buy the Klipschs. If you want great sound quality, buy either. If you just hit the lottery for 100 million, buy the Klipschs. If your Amazon stock just went up in value a few million during the last week, buy the Klipschs. If you had lunch with Jeff Bezos recently and you bought him lunch because you've got more money, buy the Klipschs. They don't necessarily sound better, but they have a more prestigious name and status does matter to some.However, if you drive past three gas stations to save five cents a gallon and actually know what your bank balance is, buy the Max Rock Metal. If you want great value, buy the Max Rock Metals. Both headsets really have excellent sound but the price difference for similar sound is so vast that only the most stringent audio connoisseur will benefit from the sound difference and that's only if you think the Klipschs sound better. They sound different but it is objective as to which sounds better. After I listen for a few minutes I really can't tell which one I am listening to.I could not find the L or R marker on the Max Rocks and the L/R is super small on the Klipsch. The mic is on the left headset on both units so that makes it easy. The ear bud with the mic on the wire goes in the left ear. They should just say that in the instructions but neither headset tells you that simple fact that makes placing the headset in the correct ear easy.The wire on the Klipschs is a heavier gauge. This may make it more durable but it also makes it stiffer and heavier so that is a trade-off. If the wire does eventually break on the Max Rock, then you have nine more to buy before you equal the price of the Klipsch. I have more headsets lost the broken so in that respect the Max Rock definitely has the advantage of disposability.My recommendation, avoid the Max Rock Soft Silicone, buy the Max Rock Metal (or buy several pairs) and if you have money to burn and desire the status, buy the Klipsch Ri6.

This is a serious clipper. It is very light but quite strong. The handle has holes in it which reduces the weight. I have rather tough toenails and this clipper handled them easily. I had another giant nail clipper but I like this one much better. The head also swivels horizontally so that you can cut at an angle.I received this item at no charge for an honest review but I purchased a second one because I was so impressed with it.

This is an excellent water bottle. The metal is thin but that also contributes to the lightness. It is well constructed of stainless steel and the cap fits like a well machined metallic part. It is also quite attactive.

I am one of the top 2,000 reviewers on Amazon. I get offers for multiple free products daily in exchange for an honest review. Even though I read quite a few books, rarely do I review books. I purchased this book after seeing a television interview with the author and was so impressed that I had to write a review.Most of us either need to make a change or change will be forced upon us. But how? What is the BEST way and thought pattern to either make change or handle change? Change Your Trajectory explains many of the changes and reasons for the changes that we so often face in life. But more importantly, Change Your Trajectory gives you the PRACTICAL HOW of what to do about it. The language and reasoning is clear and easy to understand and it is often the easy to understand stuff that is so powerful. It is not a question of IF you will need to make changes sooner or later, it is a question of when. Change Your Trajectory could be the difference when you face change of whether change boosts you or blasts you.This book is epic..

I use these for the office staff. I've ordered several of them and they are used by the office staff to cook multiple meals daily. The units have never stopped working. I ordered more because the rice bowls became stained. Some of the staff used the for hot spicy foods and they left chilli sauce stains in the rice bowls. Soooo... I had to buy new units just to get new rice bowls. I notified the staff no chilli sauce in the rice bowls.My only complaint is there is no preset for the cooking time and it does not remember the last setting. I use 45 minutes. It starts at 20 minutes and then I must use the up arrows to increment to get to 45 minutes. Not a big deal but a remember last setting option would be nice.The clear steamer sections don't seem very durable but they have never broken or even chipped even with the constant office use. I am super pleased with these units.

It is very comfortable and for the price you simply can't beat it. It will leave space in a very large chair but it is still plenty big enough for all but the largest of bottoms. I like the ability to wash the chair cushion every once in awhile.

It's like a tank for a phone. Both a gas tank and an armored tank.Pros:1. Battery life is phenomenal. It's roughly double the 3,000mah stock battery.2. Protects the phone. The case has a 3/16" bevel that sticks out above the front glass of the phone. This provides better front glass protection than most cases.3. Rubbery non-slip surface. This makes it easy to grip in your hand without slippage.5. Very easy install one minute install.6. Solid back makes it suitable if you want to add a belt tab. I buy round belt clip tabs and glue it on the battery, drill a hole in the case and then stretch the tab through the drilled hole then clip the phone to my belt clip. It works great.To do this buy the tab and belt clip. Use 3M mounting tape #03609 (this is far stronger than the tape you get with the belt tab), drill a 3/8 hole in the case EXACTLY centered on where the tab will be. The hole is smaller than the tab so you must stretch the case hole over the tab. The case back will hold the tab in place because even the super strong mounting tape won't hold the tab long without a strong case back holding the tab also (believe me I've tried). With this case the tab has never come loose and you don't have to fear your phone popping off the belt clip and being lost or damaged.7. Case buttons work well with phone buttons. Pressing the buttons of the case is a solid feel and works easily with the phone buttons underneath.Cons:1. It's big and heavy. No, I mean really, this thing is big and heavy. It literally makes the phone feel 3X heavier. It's big. It's like an Otterbox case with lead inside. If you put your phone inside of your suit jacket and wish an unnoticeable bulge where you phone is, run, don't walk away from this battery. It doubles the thickness of your phone and increases the likelihood of your jacket or pants pocket bulging from the shear size of this phone. I've gotten used to the size and weight and actually like them both now. My hands are big and I'm strong so it works for me. If you have trouble opening doors, this phone is not for you.2. It takes double the time to charge. That figures if it's double the capacity but usually it's left on the charger overnight anyway.3. The battery level is no longer accurate. Maybe it's just my battery learning but it will drop to 95% in a few minutes yet take hours to move from 4% to 0. The battery meter is not smoothly linear. UPDATE: After the battery is conditioned a couple of weeks, the battery gauge us now accurate. To be honest, the battery meter doesn't matter. If you charge your phone at night, unless you play movies all day, your battery simply will never run to zero so a battery meter is almost unnecessary with this battery. On my heaviest use days I've always had 50%+ of battery left at the end of the day. With the stock battery it would go to zero on some days.4.  Your phone is no longer waterproof. Because this replaces the sealed back plate the phone is no longer waterproof. The front of the phone is still rather tightly sealed. It may remove the immersability of the phone but I think it will hold up well in the rain. Just don't go swimming with it.

I really wondered, "Where is the sweat going?" Bikram Yoga is hot and during 90 minutes it seems as if I lose a half a gallon of sweat. A normal towels would be ringing wet but somehow this towel absorbs it all and still does not "feel" wet.When I received it I was initially disappointed because I thought it was a mat. It's not a mat, it's a towel. It's thin so it makes carrying a bulky towel obsolete.  It is fairly non-slip but it has very little cushioning so if you want a mat this is NOT it. It's a terrible mat but it's a great towel. You would use this to put over your mat.I received this product as a top reviewer. I get offers almost daily for free products to review but I accept very few of them simply because my time to review is often worth far more than the product and I don't review things that I don't use or would not potentially buy. I have given an honest review of the product.

Boy is this recorder great! I use it to record movies for quotes as a reviewer for MovieFoot.com and it works perfectly. I have purchased four of these for use by other reviewers on the team and all have worked flawlessly. Although my phone has an audio recorder it is nowhere as clear as the ICD-PX333 for recording sound in a theater. This recorder has a low cut filter and noise filter that makes the dialog much easier to understand during playback.Since I use the recorder to record movie quotes, I need to be able to go back to the exact point in the audio so that I can get it verbatim. That's where the T-MARK function comes in.When I hear a great quote, I press the T-MARK button and it places a bookmark at that point in the audio. What I later discovered is that when I copy the file from the recorder and open the MP3 file in Sound Forge (a Sony audio editing program), the bookmark shows up as a marker in Sound Forge. This makes it super easy to move from one bookmark to another and transcribe the quotes. I just back up a few seconds since I press the T-MARK button after the quote and there it is.It does not have a lighted screen but you don't want that in a dark theater anyway. You can set the record LED OFF or ON. I set it to ON but I put a piece of white tape over it. That way, it gives off a very dull glow so that I know it's recording but it's not so bright that anyone notices it.I can record about five or six movies (roughly 9-10 hours) before the battery indicator is down to one bar and then I put in 2 new AAA batteries.I also use this whenever I speak at functions with an Olympus ME-15 lavaliere microphone. It records speeches crystal clear and with the lapel microphone it records like a truly professional setup and the whole rig fits in a shirt pocket.Although I have a micro SD card I simply don't need it with the built-in 4GB of memory. At 128kbps (CD quality) the built-in memory gives you over 60 hours of recording.

This unit is fantastic! I wonder why dentists always mention the old fashioned string floss but rarely a water flosser? I believe the water flosser reduces your need for the dentist and has a much higher use rate once a person starts. Is it a conspiracy? I don't know but I do know the water flosser is not the best thing since sliced bread, it is BETTER than sliced bread. It will help remove the bread stuck between your teeth.PROS:1. Leaves your teeth and gums super clean.2. Actually is a joy to use.Once you use it for about a week, you ACTUALLY look forward to water flossing which is the opposite of string flossing.3. FAR MORE enjoyable than regular flossing. Yes, I needed to say that twice.4. It cleans between my teeth BETTER than regular flossing.5. At my last dental cleaning after a few months of the water flosser, there was literally nothing for the dentist to clean. Normally I have quite a bit of tarter and plaque that requires a lot of unpleasant scraping. So it cleans my teeth better, not just between my teeth.6. Simple to use. At first you may spray some water over the counter until you get the hang of it.7. Adjustable. You can adjust the force from 1 to 10. I use 10 and that's plenty powerful (I'm a macho non-squeamish man).Most will prefer the middle range.8. Quick. A tank of water lasts 90 seconds on level 10. In 90 seconds your mouth is clean.9. Relatively inexpensive for what it does.Cheaper than a pair of running shoes, four IMAX movies or the emotional turmoil from losing the love of your life because your teeth are messed up.10. Definitely increases my gum health by the massage action which flossing does not do. Some of the reviews gives you actual dental numbers of gum health. They state their gum numbers at the dentist improved from 5's and 6's to 2's and 3's (lower is better). I fully believe that. When I went back to the dentist after a few months of using the water flosser the dentist found virtually no tarter or plague on or between my teeth. Normally it is a good bit of very uncomfortable scraping but not after the water flosser.The dentist also said that my gums did no bleeding like they normally do when the dentist flosses during the cleaning. Although I did not have objective gum numbers, my gums are definitely in better shape.Cons:1. No truly small portable unit. Once I've gotten used to the water flosser I miss it when I travel.2. Somewhat noisy. If someone is sleeping in an adjacent bathroom, it will likely wake them up.3. Needs AC power4. Takes up counter spaceThere really aren't any significant cons that I can find on this unit.This is one of the best investments in my health that I have ever made.Both you and your smile will love this unit!

For the price you simply can't beat these. They count perfectly. There is no backlight so you can't read the count in the dark but other than that they work superbly. I use them for counting laughs in movies as a reviewer for MovieFoot. I did not want a counter that made a clicking sound or lit up. In a dark or quiet theater both of those qualities are negative so these fit the bill. The reset button is small enough so that you don't accidentally press it.

These cups are FANTASTIC! I use them for water and smoothies and I reuse them. One cup lasts me a very long time and I wanted a plastic cup that didn't crack when "abused." I literally took the first cup and crushed it 25 five times to see if I could crack it. They don't crack! There were a few white creases where I had crushed the cup flat multiple times but absolutely no cracks. The cup remained watertight after being flattened 25 times.These cups are rugged! The tops fit well also but the have the X slit cut in them for the straw. Water can leak through the X cut but other than that even the caps fit super. These are great cups. The case I ordered may last so long that I leave these in my will.

Write speed in real world conditions is my main concern. The drive writes at a consistent 80MB/s with Win 8 and USB 3 slots.I had to reformat the drive with NTFS file format because I needed to transfer files larger than 4GB. It comes pre-formatted with a Fat32/exFAT format which has a maximum file size limit of 4GB. The drive easily reformatted to NTFS which has a practically unlimited file size limit.I like that it does not have a removable (read can easily be lost) cap but a slide mechanism. The slide mechanism is not the smoothest but it works. The slide has a strong positive click and once you get used to it the click top works fine.I am super pleased with this drive. I bought six of them. I have files that I want to give to my children containing audiobooks and this drive will hold my entire collection.

These fit perfectly and register on the camera battery meter. Occasionally aftermarket batteries can have a bad fit due to the battery case being off specs. These batteries appear to last as long or longer as the factory battery. I took over 1,300 pictures (using the electronic viewfinder not the LCD screen) on my Lumix FZ200 and the battery meter never moved from full. I also like the charger better than the charger that came with the camera because it is more compact.

I purchased seven of these and I am re-ordering more. The counters work perfectly. There is no solid click when you press the button but that's what I wanted. I use them to count laughs as a movie reviewer for MovieFoot.com. I needed a counter that didn't make noise. I put one on each hand and count my laughs on one hand and the audience laughs on the other hand. So far the counters have performed flawlessly.Even though there is no click, all that you need to do is solidly press the button and it increments each time. The reset button is very small and in the upper right corner so you don't risk accidentally resetting the counter. The display goes off in a few minutes to preserve battery power. When you press the counter button the counter increments by one and then turns on the display.There is no backlight so I can't see the count with theater lights off but I don't need to. I just note the count when the lights come on. You can read the display easily in sunlight. I'm ordering a bunch and will keep the spares in the refrigerator to make the battery last longer. They are so inexpensive it's probably cheaper to buy another unit than a battery even if the battery is replaceable.The finger strap is not the easiest to stay snapped but I bought several other counters that are much more expensive and they have the same type of finger straps so it is on par with the rest of the counters. You just have to make sure that you have the snaps really snapped in which takes some effort but once snapped in they stay snapped fairly well. I have large hands and I have plenty of snap holes left for expansion. They should fit any sized finger, especially larger hands.For less than $2 including shipping, I can't see where you can go wrong unless you get a defective counter and none of my seven were defective.

First, I was sent a pair of these wrist bands to review. I particularly agreed to accept the bands because I had recently hurt my wrist and had purchased three different wrist support bands to help my wrist heal. So I was a prime candidate to evaluate these.PROS:1. The biggest advantage is that they look great. The other bands that you buy in the Ace and Futuro look like medical devices. They make you look like you've hurt your wrist. These on the other hand make you look like a sports person who's going out for a hard workout. Big difference in the look.2. They are sturdy. They provide excellent support on par or better than all of the band EXCEPT those that have a metal strip. Those with a metal strip provides more support but of course much less flexibility. If you want to keep your wrist as still as possible, get a wrist band with the solid metal strip.3. Durable. I believe from the construction these will hold up over time.4. Economical. Two of these cost less than one wrist support band from the drug store.5. Great support. They support the wrist well, especially for sports activities.CONS:1. They are L/R specific. They are not ambidextrous bands which means you have one for the left and right wrist and they only fit the left and right wrist. This can be a problem for people who have trouble keeping up with things and you do have to take extra time to make sure that you've got the correct band on the correct wrist.2. The strap that goes over the web between the thumb and forefinger was less comfortable on one hand than the other supports. This may be because the other supports don't use a strap but the whole sleeve and the strap portion is wider and puts less per square inch pressure on the thumb web. Not a big issue but it is a difference.Overall, these are a super value, they look far better and they work well.

This is not a summary of the movie but a five page history of awards and other stuff about the movie. I was looking for a rather detailed summary of the movie. For 2.99, this is grossly overpriced and the Wikipedia article is better and free.I Origins was an excellent movie which is why I wanted the summary. The DVD isn't out yet or I would have bought the DVD.No wonder this is unauthorized.
These are decent bags for the money but they are NOT heavy duty. Don't put anything heavy in the bag or it will be on the floor. They are typical grocery store bags.

It does the job well. It will charge 2.1 amp devices (pads) and all cell phones. The only negative of the unit is the BRIGHT light. If you need a night light, this will do double duty but if you want dark, then you will need to get the all purpose duct tape and just tape over the light.
For the money, these just can't be beat. An excellent frequency range for all but the most demanding audiophiles but if you are that demanding you need wired not bluetooth. They are very comfortable.
Nice looking hub with power. This means each port provides power for high drain USB devices. It's worth it if you have a lot of USB devices.

This picks up ferrous metallic objects extremely well. It won't work on non-ferrous metals such as stainless steel but no magnet will pick up non-ferrous metals. We were having problems in our parking lots and the street in front of our building with screws in our tires because of nearby construction. One person spent an hour going over the parking lot and street and came back with a half a bucket of metallic stuff.This really works and the wide sweep allows you to cover a lot of ground quickly If you've got ferrous metal to pick up, this will be a great help and for $40 you can't beat it.
Best scale that I've ever owned! Even the waist tape measure that came free with my unit is the best tape measure that I've ever owned.
I have a lot of paper coming in and out. This works super on my desk and it's very attractive. It is sturdy, I don't think it will ever break. I will retire before this gives out.

Bought these to keep the cold air out and to keep our daughter safe.  Our daughter isn't old enough to crawl yet but I actually purchased these before hand to keep the cold air out.  Have you ever put your hand over a socket during the winter on an external wall?  Anyways these do a great job of plugging up the draft and I'm sure they will do a good job keeping my daughter from sticking her finger in an outlet.

I wish I could say I really like this pillow, it has very high reviews on Amazon, unfortunately it is not living up to the hype.  It was great the first 2-3 days, nice and lofty.  Now its so flat that each night I need to fluff it and then flip it over and I have to do this every couple of hours.  I'm a back sleeper and every morning I wake up with neck pains with this pillow.  (but it only started happening after it lost the loft to it).Let me also mention I buy a lot of pillows (much to my wife's dislike) I'm always buying new pillows trying to find the perfect combination of softness and loft.  I'd say in the last year I've purchase at least 4 different pillows.Also Marlow's Mercantile the company who makes this pillow says to contact them with any issues, though they don't give a way to contact them.  Going through Amazon, it basically says if there is an issue to contact Amazon and not the seller.  I even got an email a week after I got the pillow and it said at the end, "If for any reason you aren't completely happy, please give me a chance to make things right before leaving negative feedback. Customer satisfaction is really my # 1 priority.  Kevin - Cofounder "  Once again, no information on how to contact them.Anyways I did give the pillow 1 extra star as the bamboo cover is very nice and soft, also I did like the presentation (aka the pillow was rolled up in its own bamboo carrying bag).  I just wish the pillow would have stayed true to how it was the first few days.

One item I hate the most about dealing with dog collars is trying to attach the tags (rabies, nametag, etc) onto those huge d-rings.  With this clip I only have to do that once and if I need to move them or take them off all I do is un-clip it.  Not sure why someone did not invent this sooner.My only issue (which is why I took off 1 star) is because of how low it hangs, it has gotten caught on a few things and ended up unwinding  the keyring part.

Great basket to go with your GarageWorks set if you can get it at a decent price.  Gladiator GarageWorks products are known for being expensive, but most of them are well worth it if you can get them at a decent price.  The basket can hold a lot.  I use this for holding a bunch of sports stuff,  balls, rollerblades, pads etc.  Definitely recommend it, it takes up about 2 feet on a 6 foot GarageWorks rail.

Hard to find a better deal,  9-Count bottles for $4?  Bought a pack of these so we could bring them to daycare for our daughter rather then sending the expensive Philip and Playtex bottles with her.  She has no problem drinking from them according to daycare.  The colors were correct (red and yellow).The only thing I have to question is where is says reduces colic.  It seems like every bottle maker these days states that claim and each have their own gimmick, I don't see anything on these bottles that looks like it would reduce colic.

Even though Amazon shipped me the wrong item twice, I finally did get the footie version of this outfit.  It fits really good and looks to be made of high quality material.  I get lots of compliments on it.

Love this outfit and so do all my gamer friends.  I always get multiple comments on it.  I wish they made a full footie version but the onsie will have to do.  My daughter is totally going to be a gamer!

No, complaints with this tube.  I got it to connect my Washing Machine to the Dryer so I could use the steam function.  This cord is plenty long, I can now move my dryer without moving the washing machine too.  I have a lot of extra slack which hides nicely behind the machine.

So far 1 out of the 10 bulbs was defective.  The connector area was covered in white crud (almost like when a battery goes bad).  The 2nd one I tried was fine.  I'm not going to go un-pack/wrap the other 8, but be warned.  I guess for $2 a bulb I can't really complain to much, I guess will see how long the bulbs last.  I use them in my master bedroom ceiling fan, so they get turned on and off a lot.

0:08 Mins Received this Pack n' Play from my wife's parents for our first child.  I wish I could start off with the pros, but I really don't have any.First this Pack N' Play was ridiculously hard to put together.  You basically have to take 2 sets of 3 connected flexible tubes and slide them around the bassinet part so it is supported.  I'm not kidding when I state it took me at least 30 minutes to do this part.My next and biggest complaint is the changing table.  There is no support on the left side, so when you place your baby in the changing table, it will tilt to the left and your baby will roll and face plant into the side.  The odd thing is if you look at most of the Graco Pack N' Plays, they now have an extra little clip on the left side for this very purpose to keep the table flat, why it was omitted on this model is beyond me.  I even contacted Graco regarding this, I sent videos and photos to them and they basically came back with, "confirmed the product is safe to use and continually tested to ensure this safety. "  The changing station may be safe but its definitely a design defect.I have since purchased the Graco Smart Station Pack 'N Play and it is far superior in every way.Photo - https://www.dropbox.com/s/38i94invczr157j/IMAG0321-small.jpg?dl=0

I've owned ATI/AMD video cards as long as I can remember, I purchased this model as an upgrade from my Radeon 6870 model.  I'm a gamer but only tend to buy the mid-range line as I don't feel there are any games out there that are currently pushing my system to the limits.  I never go with a stock cooler video cards because they tend to be loud, and just look boring, so I tend to always get an overclocked model or one with a decent heatsink/fan.  HIS is well known for their IceQ coolers and this model is no different.With this card I am able to run Battlefield 3 on Ultra settings and getting about 40-45FPS most of the time running an Intel I7 3770k with 16GB (not overclocked).This card is amazingly silent I don't hear it spin up at all.  It is a ginormous card though.  I'm using a Corsair 600T case and this sucker just barely fits in it (because of where the hard drive cages are).AMD does a great job with the driver releases with a new set every month and they are very into player feedback and the community.I did have an issue getting my Mail-in-Rebate but that was not HIS's fault, I think it was because the date from Amazon was wrong since when I ordered it, it was on back order.

I own the CP1500AVRLCD and picked up the CP1000AVRLCD the other day for my wife's new 27 inch IMac.  Works great with the IMac, it list if the power goes out she has at least 40 minutes of power on this.  You don't need to install the software, but you do need to connect the computer with the USB cable as IMACs have built in UPS management software.  If you can get this model for under $90 its an amazing deal.My only dislike is this model is a bit bulkier then the CP1500 model.  Why couldn't they kept the same slim size and just cut it in half?

Ok, I'm going to be honest here, I'm 34 and enjoy playing with nerf guns.  Around $11 for a pack of 36 darts is a decent deal. The big issue is after using each dark multiple times it gets to the point where the dart is compressed and doesn't shoot as far, also the more times it sticks to the wall and you pull it off, eventually the suction tip falls off.P.S.  be careful, these sting when hit in the face with one.

I've tried both the Gillette Fusion Proglide Power and the Schick Hydro Power, and the Gillette model is far superior, it just feels better on the face and produces a smoother shave.This is actually my 2nd Gillette Fusion Proglide Power as my previous one got water in the battery compartment and basically killed the battery and the electric system.  I like to use the razor in the shower so maybe they need to re-work the cap so it doesn't allow water inside. But for $10, if the base last a year or two that is fine with me.My biggest beef is the blades though, they are way overpriced. occasionally you can get a decent deal at some big name wholesale clubs, but this is one reason I can't give the razor 5 stars.

For the price you can't beat it.  5 brushes for under $8, I'm not a master painter so I don't buy into this you need a $40 brush etc.  I use these one time and toss them away, don't need to deal with cleanup for anything.  If you got a quick project you need done and don't want to spend a lot on brushes, these are definitely the way to go.

Ok, so I realize this is an airtight safe, but according to First Alert that means you need to open it up once a month and let it air out.  That is a major annoyance and sometimes I don't even remember.  I put a bunch of important papers including my passport in the safe and the first time I opened it up they were all damp.  My passport was almost ruined and had a horrible smell to it.  If you contact First Alert they will mail you some silica gel packs for free to help minimize the moisture, but you still need to follow the 30 day air out procedure.

Bought 2 of these to replace some builder grade lights in my townhouse and to compliment the AF Lighting 617600 Contemporary Lighting Collection Chandelier I also purchased.  Next to the chandelier they look great with the matching design.  They are very bright with 2 60 watt equivalent fluorescent bulbs.They are a little difficult to install as stated in some of the other reviews.  Our handyman actually blew a fuse when he accidentally screwed one of the screws into the wire, because of how these sit against the wall and the heat insulation its hard to see what is going on.My only beef is its a little difficult to remove the glass to replace the bulbs, so hopefully with the fluorescent bulbs I got a good 7 years before I need to deal with trying to replace them.

I actually bought 2 of these to replace some old builder grade chandeliers in my townhouse.  They are very nice looking, while I can't comment on the setup because I had a handyman install them he was able to get them installed pretty quickly.They recommend you use 3 100 watt bulbs for this chandelier, I think this is overkill, we put in 3 60 watt equivalent fluorescent bulbs and its extremely bright.  On a side note if you end up getting 100 watt equivalent fluorescent bulbs they are to large and wont actually fit in the chandelier correctly.  On other annoyance is the dome traps all sorts of bugs, flies etc and its difficult to clean, though this could be an issue with any chandelier where the bulbs don't face downwards.I also bought 2 AF Lighting 617602 Contemporary Lighting Collection Flush Mount, Brushed Nickel, lights which the design goes perfectly mounted near this chandelier.

Let me start off by saying I did not purchase this camera from Amazon as I found it cheaper on another online store.  I have currently owned it about 3 months now.When I first started my search for an IP camera I was surprised by how many brands there were but also by how many bad reviews each one had.  I think most of the bad reviews are because setting these cameras up are not as user friendly as they could be so people get frustrated.  If you buy a camera like this model that has the cloud feature you can usually set it up pretty quickly, but a lot of them that you have to setup Port Forwarding will drive most people crazy.This isn't a bad camera per say, and its very sleek and cool looking and from a hardware perspective its great, but when it comes to the software it needs a lot of work.The reason I got this one was because it had all the features I wanted: Night Vision, Pan and Tilt, 2-Way Voice, SD card slot, extra high resolution.This being one of the highest resolution consumer grade camera's I thought the picture quality would be great.  Sadly I'm not even able to take advantage of the high resolution as according to Edimax "one 1280x1024 camera equals 4.3 640x480 cameras in pixel count.  Streaming the max resolution over the Internet is virtually impossible for the average home."The camera gives you the option to view in Mpeg,  Mpeg-4 or H.264 but there doesn't seem to be a way to specifically pick which one to use (unless you access it with the Admin Account).  According to Edimax only IE supports H.264, but since there is no way to specifically select it, I'm not sure its even working.Next their directions for port forwarding say open up ports, 80, 554, 50000-60000.  Why in the world does it need 10k port range open, and pretty much every ISP blocks port 80 from being opened so your forced to change the port to something else for that one.Finally their Android App is horrendous. Its very slow to load and somehow if you don't close it correctly you end up with multiple instances of it running.  I downloaded IP Cam Viewer Lite for my Android device and its far superior and much faster.I do have to say their Customer Service seems to be decent, the few times I emailed them I had a response back within a few hours.

Bought one of these to replace the light fixture in my basement bathroom, it must have been an after thought for the builder because there was just a bulb hanging from the ceiling junction box.  Anyways very easy to install, gives off plenty of light and best of all it was pretty inexpensive.  Tossed in 2 60 Watt Equivalent Fluorescent bulbs and I was good to go.

I've now purchased 2 of these, they last about 6-8 months depending on how wet they get.  They rust very quickly.  Unfortunately its very hard to find a shower caddy this large that hangs on the wall.  It has plenty of room for all my shower stuff as well as my wife's.  Like others have mentioned the suction cups are an issue,  2 out of 4 of mine were folded oddly and I've never been able to get them to stick on the shower wall.  Luckily the 2 that do work seem plenty strong to hold the caddy up.If InterDesign would change the material so it didn't rust and fix the issue with the suction cups this would be a 5 star all the way,

Ordered this replacement for my Winix WAC9300 model, the medium size top of the line WINIX air purifier.  Not much to say about it other then it was poorly packaged.  When I opened it up the rubber stripping (that goes around the edge of the filter) was coming off.  This would be comparable to your door weather stripping which keeps stuff from getting around the filter.  Anyways I had to peeling it off and reapply the stripping around the filter before I could fit it into the air purifier.Other then that, the product works how it should, and for around the $60 mark for a replaceable filter that last a year isn't bad at all.

So I bought these dental chews along with a bunch of other Tropiclean products as my dog has some serious bad breath and plague build up and we are unable to put him to sleep for a teeth cleaning because of a heart condition.First let me say my dog loves these, though he pretty much enjoys any treat, so I don't think its particular to these, he devours them pretty quickly.  These dental chews smell pretty gross, I almost gag every-time I open the bag.  But my biggest issue is the recommended feeding size.  A bag comes with 24 and the bag recommends for a 7lb-30lb dog giving them 4-8 a day.  If I would to give the max amount to my dog a dag I would need to buy a new bag every 3 days.  If I did the minimum amount each day, this bag would not even last a week.So far I've been giving my dog 1-2 a day along with some other Tropiclean products, and I can't tell that this product is doing anything worth wild.I'd have to buy 1 pack every week to fit their feeding recommendations, there are much better and cheaper teeth cleaning dental chews out there.

Tried to add this to the ceiling fan in my bedroom but for some reason it was not compatible with the remote control that came with the ceiling fan.  Litex swears you should be able to use this with their fans so I'm not sure what the problem was.  Ended up removing it and sending it back to Amazon.

Purchased 2 of these to hook up my new living room TV.  Ran both through the wall, 1 connected to a Blu-Ray player and one connected to a soundbar.  Using the Audio Return Channel (ARC) from the HDMI In on the TV to the HDMI Out on the Soundbar and its working great.  Price was good for a high quality 15 foot HDMI cable.

Purchased this Mount for my living room to mount my new 46" inch Samsung LED.  First of all the the price is great compared to most other Cantilever mounts on the market, though this particular model can be purchased online at a "warehouse" store for almost $20 cheaper then Amazon.The quality and construction seem great and was easy to install on the wall once the stud was found. Its very slim and my TV sits very close to the wall, but I can easily maneuver the TV out from the wall and face it towards the kitchen or dining room if need be.My only gripe with this mount was screwing in the extender plates so I could attach it to the TV (VESA 400 x 400), the directions were hard to decipher and the tools listed were not correct.  I ended up needing to use socket wrench and a screw driver to fully get the extender plates on the backplate.*edit*  Also the information is wrong on Amazon for the size this mount can handle, per MountWerks, the TV can hold up to 60 pounds and a 55 inch TV (assuming it has VESA 400 x 400 holes)

I got this band set about 2 weeks ago to try to start doing some P90X,  I did not run into any missing items thankfully.  My biggest complaint so far is these bands have way to much metal on them,  there is a huge metal loop on the handles and then huge metal clips on each band,  When doing most exercises the metal rubs against your arms and is very uncomfortable.  Most other sets I've seen have very little or no metal, now this might make these more secure and stronger, but its at the sake of being uncomfortable.They do seem well built though and (knock on wood) I haven't had any issues with bands snapping or breaking.  The added CD is a nice touch and it shows you how to do a bunch of exercises and use the bands correctly, but I wish it had some actual workouts on it.  The little carrying bag is a nice touch so I can keep everything together.

Ordered a pack of these because I need to move part of my couch (the love seat) into a storage unit for a bit.  It took 2 of us to get the bag onto the couch.  We ended up using the 2nd bag and put it on from the reverse side for double protection.  We did manage to put a few holes in the bag trying to move it over the ends of the couch.  The biggest issue I had with this bag was how slick it made the couch.  My friend and I could barely hold the couch because the bag was so slippery.  How well does this bag work long term?  I will know sometime in June when I take the couch out of storage, for now though it served its purpose and we got the couch to the storage unit without destroying it.

Got my results the other day and they said my dog was a Mini Schnauzer and a Japanese Chin mix.  Taking one look at my dog you can easily tell he is mostly Chihuahua.  Sent an email to the company and got the below response:"Dear XXXXXX,Thank you for contacting Mars Veterinary, the creators of Wisdom PanelÆ Insights(tm), the best-in-class cheek swab DNA test for mixed-breed dogs.  We have received your comments regarding Tonka's  results and are sorry to hear our test did not meet your expectations. Tonka's profile shows that he is a very mixed dog and our computer had trouble identifying with confidence even the two great grandparents. A main point of our testing is that visual identification is almost impossible; even practiced vets are only able to correctly guess one breed about 30% of the time, and much less when they try to identify more breeds in a mix. This happens most often with supposed 'Lab mixes' because of their collection of dominant traits, making many combinations come together to resemble a Lab.With Tonka, he has such a wide variety in his mix (from Chihuahua and Japanese Chin to Boxer and Large Munsterlander) that he has a possibility for a vast array of different physical characteristics. However, since we were only able to identify one great grandparent with high confidence, this is grounds for a possible refund. Since you did not purchase the kit directly through us, you will need to obtain your refund through the distributor you bought it through. If you have any problems, please let us know.If you have any additional questions, please do not hesitate to contact us at customercare@marsveterinary.com or 888-K9 PET TEST (1-888-597-3883).Regards,XXXXMars VeterinaryCustomer Care Department[...]"Their website states: "If you are still not satisfied with your results after you have consulted with our customer care team through either e-mail or our toll free number we will be happy to offer a 100% money back guarantee."  yet now they are telling me to contact the seller for a refund?  I'm still waiting to hear back from Amazon but something tells me that isn't going to float.I was so excited to use this product when I first read about it, its a shame it didn't work out.

I bought a pair of UltraFit 3000 Orange/White off another online store, let me start out by saying the pictures made them look really snazzy, and they do in person.  When I first got them I attached the longer cord so I could take advantage of the play/pause and volume buttons on the control pod to use with my Ipod Nano.  I quickly realized something was wrong, the volume buttons did not work, I swapped the earphones over to my Iphone to see if it was a problem with my Nano, but same issue.  I sent an email to Polk and much to my surprise, they responded in less then 5 hrs and said they were sending me out a replacement piece, no questions asked.  So either this is a common issue or they have amazing customer service.  I got the replacement control piece and everything was working and actually they sent me a complete set of attachments for the headphones not just the broken piece.Now for my actual review:These earphones for $80-$100 seem cheaply made, just looking at the control pod with the mic, play/pause and volume buttons its not completely enclosed and looks like it will easily break, and there is also gaps on both sides, so while maybe the earphones are moisture resistant, I'm not sure what happens if this part gets wet.My next issue is the length of the cables and everyone else seems to have brought this up too, the cable with the control pod is way to long and the other cable is way to short.  The flat cable is a nice touch but it seems to make the cable a lot heavier then I'm used to.The sound quality doesn't seem to bad, initially I was really concerned that these had no bass to them, then I realized the earpieces I was using were not a good fit, when I switched them to a different size I could definitely tell a huge difference and the bass was much stronger.  Remember these are In-Ear Canal headphones, that means they actually need to be in the ear canal.(ie a good fit)If you can find these under $60 they might be worth it but at the current price I'm having a hard time recommending them.  I am giving Polk 1 extra star for their amazing customer service.
